This is a unique opportunity for an entrepreneurial individual to shape a growing coliving business, supported by secured EU funding. We offer a highly flexible partnership, including full coverage of living expenses and a negotiable compensation package that can include a salary, profit-sharing, or equity in the properties. The role is designed to be synergistic with your own projects, remote work, or startup ideas, with the infrastructure to support them.\n\n\n\nThis document outlines the opportunity for a dedicated co-founder to join the ColivingLiguria project. We are looking for a true partner to help build, manage, and scale the entire business, leveraging our recent funding from the FESR Azione 1.3.3. EU Grant to bring our vision to life.\nThe Role &amp; Vision: A Hands-On Entrepreneur\nAs a co-founder, you will be a driving force behind the project, turning vision into reality. While the role requires you to be on-site, it is not conceived as a traditional full-time job for the majority of the time, allowing ample space for your own ventures.\nKey Responsibilities:\n\nCommunity &amp; Operations Management: Oversee the day-to-day life of the coliving space, manage volunteers and guests, and cultivate a vibrant, collaborative community.\nInfrastructure &amp; Project Development: A core responsibility will be to lead the implementation of our planned infrastructure, making our space a hub for innovation. This includes setting up facilities for manufacturing, workshops with 3D printers, high-speed internet and server capabilities for software startups, and more. You will make sure these are not just plans, but realities.\nBusiness Growth &amp; Strategy: Actively contribute to marketing, partnerships, and the long-term strategic direction of the project.\n\nWe strongly encourage applicants who have an existing remote job, are developing their own projects, or want to launch a startup. The ideal scenario involves a synergy where your work and ColivingLiguria‚Äôs growth are mutually beneficial.\nAn Incubator for Your Venture\nWe want to be more than a coliving space; we aim to be a launchpad. If you have your own startup, you can use our space as a base for your team. We are prepared to adapt our buildings to your needs, whether you‚Äôre in manufacturing, software development, or another field.\nA Flexible Partnership &amp; Remuneration\nThis is a partnership, and the terms are open to negotiation based on your skills, experience, and what you bring to the table. We will cover your on-site living expenses (rent, food, etc.). The financial compensation is highly flexible and will be defined together. The options we can discuss include:\n\nA regular fixed salary.\nA significant share in the project‚Äôs future profits.\nA path to ownership of the properties of ColivingLiguria.\n\nThese are not mutually exclusive and can be combined to create a package that aligns with your long-term goals. A fixed salary is not mandatory if you prefer a structure more heavily weighted towards equity and profit-sharing.\nHow to Connect\nI am open to having a conversation with anyone who is seriously interested in this opportunity.\n\n\nFor an initial chat, feel free to reach out directly to schedule a call. You can contact me via:\n\nPhone/WhatsApp: +39 339 637 9372\nInstagram: @colivingliguria\n\n\n\nFor a more formal application, please send an email to colivingliguria@gmail.com with:\n\nYour CV.\nA summary of your past experiences.\nA motivation letter explaining your interest and how you envision your contribution to ColivingLiguria.\n\n\n\nI look forward to hearing from you. For more background, feel free to browse the main ColivingLiguria page or our Contact details."},"ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Openings":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Openings","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Openings.md","title":"Openings","links":["Ville-Chiappella","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Propose-a-Project","ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Supplementary-Projects/Supplementary-Projects","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Volunteer-Offer","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Digital-Nomad-Offer","ColivingLiguria/System/Contact","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Farmer","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Casa-del-Forno","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Terreni-oltre-Torrente","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Gardener","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Casa-del-Noce","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Woodland-Steward","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Terreni-alla-Fonte","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Terreni-Lungotorrente","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Mountain-Bike-Guide--and--Trail-Designer","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Climber-Guide","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Carpenter","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Interior-Designer","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Web-Designer","ColivingLiguria/System/Software/Software-for-ColivingLiguria","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Social-Media-Manager","ColivingLiguria/Advertising/Social-Media/Social-Media","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Photographer","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Model","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Cook","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Italian-Teacher","ColivingLiguria/System/Archive/MicroSturtupHub/ColivingLiguria-for-Startups-and-Cofounders","Contract-for-Residents","ColivingLiguria/People/Simone-Testino"],"tags":[],"content":"‚Äî Italiano Sotto ‚Äî\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nWe are not offering traditional jobs. We are looking for entrepreneurial partners, creatives, and skilled individuals to join our community at Ville Chiappella. These roles are flexible, designed either as key resident contributions or as independent ventures (see Propose a Project) that will be listed on our Supplementary Projects page. We provide the land, the infrastructure, and a vibrant community; you bring your vision.\n\n\n\n\nNote: If you don‚Äôt have a specific professional skill but still want to join, please check our general Volunteer Offer or Digital Nomad Offer.\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Check Availability First! \n                  \n                \n\n\nSome of these positions may already be filled. We are also open to having multiple people in the same role, or one person taking on two or even three different roles. If you are interested in one or more positions, please Contact me (Simone Testino) as soon as possible to check for current availability.\n\n\n\nLand &amp; Outdoors\nThis category includes roles focused on developing, managing, and creating value from our extensive lands and unique location.\n\nFarmer\n\nWe are looking for a farmer to manage our agricultural production, from the vegetable gardens at Casa del Forno to new fields at Terreni oltre Torrente and potentially raising livestock. You will have creative freedom and can build a business selling produce.\n\n\nGardener\n\nThis role focuses on designing our leisure gardens (over 2000m¬≤) around Casa del Noce and Casa del Forno. You will select plants, design relaxation and recreation areas, and shape the aesthetic harmony of the property.\n\n\nWoodland Steward\n\nA highly creative role with ‚Äúcarta bianca‚Äù to manage our forested lands like Terreni alla Fonte, Terreni Lungotorrente and Terreni oltre Torrente. The mission is to inventively develop these spaces, creating water features, art installations, or hidden offices.\n\n\nMountain Bike Guide &amp; Trail Designer\n\nDevelop a new MTB trail network on our hillside, located right next to the world-famous Finale Ligure outdoor area. This is a business opportunity to act as our resident guide, attracting riders and building your own guiding venture.\n\n\nClimber Guide\n\nWe are looking for a certified Climbing Guide to join our community near Finale Ligure. This is a dual-role business opportunity: design and build on-site bouldering routes (on houses/trees) and launch your own independent guiding business for our residents and guests.\n\n\n\nRenovation &amp; Design\nThis category is for the hands-on creatives who will build and design our physical spaces.\n\nCarpenter\n\nA foundational role to lead the hands-on renovation of our houses. We are looking for a skilled craftsperson who can join as a resident, a paid contractor (if legally registered in Italy), or as a long-term equity partner with co-ownership in the buildings.\n\n\nInterior Designer\n\nWe are looking for a designer to create the complete interior vision for Casa del Noce and Casa del Forno. This role is highly sought after, and we prefer candidates who can join as residents soon to shape the project from the start.\n\n\n\nDigital\nThis category includes roles focused on managing our brand and digital infrastructure.\n\nWeb Designer\n\nA hybrid Web/Graphic Designer &amp; Front-End Engineer to design a new, ‚Äúcatchy‚Äù commercial website and build the UI for our internal databases (Software for ColivingLiguria). This role can be remote, but on-site residents are preferred.\n\n\nSocial Media Manager\n\nTake full charge of our Social Media presence. This key role is preferably on-site (but remote is considered) to capture daily life, create content, and build our brand. We are open to beginners with a great eye or seasoned professionals.\n\n\nPhotographer\n\nA dual role to act as our resident photographer (for social media content) in exchange for accommodation, and to launch your own independent, paid photography school (working with our Model).\n\n\nModel\n\nBecome a face of our brand. This dual role involves modeling for our in-house Photographer‚Äôs school (with profit-sharing) and being a key personality on our Social Media channels (working with the Social Media Manager).\n\n\n\nCommunity\nThis category includes roles focused on building our community and providing services to our residents.\n\nCook\n\nWe are looking for a community cook to manage our kitchen, plan meals in synergy with our Farmer, and create a wonderful, shared culinary experience for all residents.\n\n\nItalian Teacher\n\nJoin our community to offer Italian lessons to our international residents. This is an independent business opportunity with a large, ready-made market of students (60-90% of our residents are interested in classes).\n\n\n\nDon‚Äôt See Your Role? Propose Your Own Project or Startup!\nIf you don‚Äôt see yourself in any of these roles, or if you have an even better idea, we highly encourage you to design your own.\n\nFor a personal project: The Propose a Project page explains the process for submitting your idea. This path is highly valued and can be an excellent solution for both you and the project.\nFor existing Startups: If you have your own startup and are looking for a place to grow, we can partner. ColivingLiguria is designed to be an incubator and we can host your team. Find out more on our ColivingLiguria for Startups and Cofounders page.\n\nOur Compensation Model: A Flexible Partnership\nWe believe in rewarding contribution and commitment. All stays are formalized with a Contract for Residents, and compensation generally follows one of three pathways:\n\n\nCore Resident\nYour primary contribution is your project or skill (e.g., managing the gardens). In exchange, you receive free or heavily reduced rent at Ville Chiappella. This is the most common model for residents.\n\n\nIndependent Business (VAT / Partita IVA)\nYou run your project as your own independent business (as per Propose a Project). You earn income by selling your products or services (e.g., the Farmer sells produce, the MTB guide charges for tours, the Teacher charges for lessons). You keep part or all of the profits from your venture.\n\n\nLong-Term Equity Partner\nThis is for key individuals who commit to a long-term, on-site vision. We offer a path to co-ownership of the assets you work on. This could mean equity in the buildings or co-ownership of the woodlands or agricultural lands you develop.\n\n\nHow to Apply\nTo apply for any of these roles, the process is simple:\n\nCheck Availability: First, please Contact me (Simone Testino) to confirm the position is still open.\nEmail Your Application: Send your application to colivingliguria@gmail.com.\n\nPlease include the following:\n\nYour CV and a Motivation Letter.\nPortfolio: For creative roles (Designer, Photographer, Carpenter, Model, SMM, Web Designer), a portfolio is essential.\nConcept Proposal: For entrepreneurial roles (Farmer, Woodland Steward, MTB Guide, Teacher), please include a brief concept proposal as outlined in Propose a Project.\n\nContacts\nFor a first, informal chat or any questions, feel free to reach out to me, Simone Testino:\n\nEmail: colivingliguria@gmail.com\nWhatsApp: +39 339 637 9372\nInstagram: @colivingliguria\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nNon stiamo offrendo lavori tradizionali. sotto‚Äî\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nShare Your Idea with Coliving Liguria\nAt ColivingLiguria, we believe that great ideas can come from anywhere. This page outlines how you can submit your own project proposals, from small improvements to brand-new ventures. If accepted, your idea will become an official part of our ecosystem, listed on our Supplementary Projects page.\n\n\n\nA Note on Our Openings Page\nThis ‚ÄúConcept Proposal‚Äù process is the official way to apply for many of the entrepreneurial roles listed on our Openings page.\n\nFor Roles like Farmer, Woodland Steward, Mountain Bike Guide &amp; Trail Designer, or Italian Teacher: These are positions where you are essentially proposing your own business or long-term project. This document is the core of your application.\nFor New Ideas or Startups: If you have an idea that isn‚Äôt on our list‚Äîor if you have an existing startup and want to partner with us‚Äîthis is also the correct process to follow. You can learn more about how we act as an incubator on our ColivingLiguria for Startups and Cofounders page.\n\nThe Evaluation Process (The Founder‚Äôs Role)\nAs the founder and owner of ColivingLiguria, Simone Testino, my primary responsibility is to ensure the long-term sustainability and coherence of the entire project. Therefore, every new idea must be evaluated against several key criteria.\nMy role is to:\n\nAssess Financial Viability: I will review your proposal to ensure it aligns with our financial resources, budget, and overall business strategy.\nEnsure Strategic Fit: I will verify that your project is consistent with the long-term goals and values of Coliving Liguria.\nPrevent Conflicts: I will check for any interference with other ongoing projects, ensuring that new proposals integrate smoothly with our current and future plans.\n\nUltimately, as the owner, the final decision on whether to approve and implement a proposal rests with me.\nHow to Submit a ‚ÄúConcept Proposal‚Äù\nTo propose an idea, you need to create a document that clearly outlines your vision. It must include the following sections:\n\nAbstract (Max 300 words)\n\nA brief, clear summary of your project‚Äôs core idea, the problem it solves, or the value it creates.\n\n\nTechnical Plan &amp; Calendar\n\nA description of the practical steps (Method) and a simple timeline with key phases (Timeline).\n\n\nBudget &amp; Resources\n\nAn estimated budget, and a list of the physical spaces or specific tools required from Coliving Liguria.\n\n\n\nTwo Ways to Collaborate: Defining the Legal Framework\nEvery project must be legally and fiscally transparent and must fit into one of the two following models:\n\nModel A: Your Independent Project (Renting Our Resources)\n\nWhat it is: You run your own project and rent resources (space, tools) from Coliving Liguria.\nOwnership &amp; Profit: The project and all profits are 100% yours.\nLegal Structure: We will sign a formal rental or service agreement.\n\n\nModel B: A Coliving Liguria Project (You as a Contributor)\n\nWhat it is: Your idea becomes an official Coliving Liguria project, and we invest our resources to make it happen.\nOwnership &amp; Profit: Coliving Liguria will have full ownership of the project and any resulting profits.\nYour Remuneration: Your contribution will be formally compensated, through methods like discounted accommodation, a share of the profits, or even equity, all detailed in a formal collaboration agreement (see Openings for examples).\n\n\n\nWhen you submit your proposal, please indicate which model you envision for your project.\nHow to Submit Your Proposal\nBefore submitting, it is highly recommended to get in Contact with me, Simone Testino, to schedule a preliminary meeting.\nTo submit your Concept Proposal, please follow these steps:\n\nPrepare Your Document: Create a single document containing all the sections mentioned above.\nFormat and Length: The final document must be in PDF format. A minor proposal can be 1-3 pages, while a major one should be more comprehensive.\nSend via Email Only: All proposals must be sent exclusively by email to:\ncolivingliguria@gmail.com\n\nPlease do not send proposals via other channels to ensure proper tracking.\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nCondividi la Tua Idea con Coliving Liguria\nA ColivingLiguria, crediamo che le grandi idee possano venire da ovunque. Questa pagina illustra come puoi presentare le tue proposte di progetto, da piccoli miglioramenti a vere e proprie nuove iniziative. Se accettata, la tua idea diventer√† parte ufficiale del nostro ecosistema, elencata nella nostra pagina Supplementary Projects.\n\n\n\nUna Nota sulla Nostra Pagina Openings\nQuesto processo di ‚ÄúProposta Iniziale‚Äù (Concept Proposal) √® il modo ufficiale per candidarsi a molti dei ruoli imprenditoriali elencati nella nostra pagina Openings.\n\nPer Ruoli come Farmer, Woodland Steward, Mountain Bike Guide &amp; Trail Designer, o Italian Teacher: Si tratta di posizioni in cui, essenzialmente, stai proponendo la tua attivit√† o un progetto a lungo termine. Questo documento √® il cuore della tua candidatura.\nPer Nuove Idee o Startup: Se hai un‚Äôidea che non √® nel nostro elenco, o se hai una startup esistente e vuoi collaborare con noi, questo √® anche il processo corretto da seguire. Puoi scoprire di pi√π su come fungiamo da incubatore nella nostra pagina ColivingLiguria for Startups and Cofounders.\n\nIl Processo di Valutazione (Il Ruolo del Fondatore)\nIn qualit√† di fondatore e proprietario di ColivingLiguria, Simone Testino, la mia responsabilit√† primaria √® garantire la sostenibilit√† a lungo termine e la coerenza dell‚Äôintero progetto. Pertanto, ogni nuova idea deve essere valutata rispetto a diversi criteri chiave.\nIl mio ruolo √®:\n\nValutare la Sostenibilit√† Finanziaria: Esaminer√≤ la tua proposta per assicurare che sia in linea con le nostre risorse finanziarie, il budget e la strategia aziendale complessiva.\nGarantire la Coerenza Strategica: Verificher√≤ che il tuo progetto sia coerente con gli obiettivi e i valori a lungo termine di Coliving Liguria.\nPrevenire Conflitti: Controller√≤ eventuali interferenze con altri progetti in corso, assicurando che le nuove proposte si integrino senza problemi con i nostri piani attuali e futuri.\n\nIn definitiva, in qualit√† di proprietario, la decisione finale sull‚Äôapprovazione e l‚Äôimplementazione di una proposta spetta a me.\nCome Presentare una ‚ÄúProposta Iniziale‚Äù\nPer proporre un‚Äôidea, devi creare un documento che delinei chiaramente la tua visione. Deve includere le seguenti sezioni:\n\nAbstract (Massimo 300 parole)\n\nUn breve e chiaro riassunto dell‚Äôidea centrale del tuo progetto, del problema che risolve o del valore che crea.\n\n\nPiano Tecnico e Calendario\n\nUna descrizione dei passaggi pratici (Metodo) e una semplice timeline con le fasi chiave (Timeline).\n\n\nBudget e Risorse\n\nUn budget stimato e un elenco degli spazi fisici o degli strumenti specifici richiesti a Coliving Liguria.\n\n\n\nDue Modi per Collaborare: Definire il Quadro Legale\nOgni progetto deve essere legalmente e fiscalmente trasparente e deve rientrare in uno dei due seguenti modelli:\n\nModello A: Il Tuo Progetto Indipendente (Affittando le Nostre Risorse)\n\nCos‚Äô√®: Gestisci il tuo progetto e affitti risorse (spazio, strumenti) da Coliving Liguria.\nPropriet√† e Profitti: Il progetto e tutti i profitti sono tuoi al 100%.\nStruttura Legale: Firmeremo un contratto formale di affitto o di servizio.\n\n\nModello B: Un Progetto di Coliving Liguria (Tu come Collaboratore)\n\nCos‚Äô√®: La tua idea diventa un progetto ufficiale di Coliving Liguria e noi investiamo le nostre risorse per realizzarla.\nPropriet√† e Profitti: Coliving Liguria avr√† la piena propriet√† del progetto e di eventuali profitti derivanti.\nIl Tuo Compenso: Il tuo contributo sar√† formalmente compensato, tramite metodi come alloggio scontato, una quota dei profitti, o persino equity, tutto dettagliato in un accordo di collaborazione formale (vedi Openings per esempi).\n\n\n\nQuando presenti la tua proposta, ti preghiamo di indicare quale modello immagini per il tuo progetto.\nCome Inviare la Tua Proposta\nPrima di inviare, √® altamente raccomandato mettersi in Contact con me, Simone Testino, per programmare un incontro preliminare.\nPer inviare la tua Proposta Iniziale, segui questi passaggi:\n\nPrepara il Tuo Documento: Crea un singolo documento contenente tutte le sezioni menzionate sopra.\nFormato e Lunghezza: Il documento finale deve essere in formato PDF. Una proposta minore pu√≤ essere di 1-3 pagine, mentre una pi√π importante dovrebbe essere pi√π completa.\nInvia Solo via Email: Tutte le proposte devono essere inviate esclusivamente via email a:\ncolivingliguria@gmail.com\n\nSi prega di non inviare proposte tramite altri canali per garantire un corretto tracciamento."},"ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Rentals-Customer-Matrix":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Rentals-Customer-Matrix","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business Segments/Rentals Customer Matrix.md","title":"Rentals Customer Matrix","links":[],"tags":[],"content":"\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nThis document outlines the rental business segments for Coliving Liguria, which constitute the primary source of the project‚Äôs cash flow. We will first classify rental types based on their duration, considering the legal framework in Italy. We will then analyse the different purposes for a guest‚Äôs stay. Finally, we will combine these concepts to create a flexible model for categorising potential customers, acknowledging the hybrid nature of their stays.\n\n\n\nThe revenue for Coliving Liguria will be generated almost entirely through rentals. To understand our market and structure our offerings, we classify every stay along two primary dimensions: its duration (the temporal dimension) and its purpose (the activity dimension).\nThe Temporal Dimension: Duration of Stay\nThe length of a rental contract is not just a practical matter; it has significant legal implications in Italy that dictate the type of agreement we can offer. Based on Italian law, we can categorise stays into three main types. Our primary business model, as defined by our ATECO code (55.90.00 - Altri servizi di alloggio), is focused on providing accommodation to workers and students.\n\nShort Stays (Less than 30 days): These are legally defined as locazioni brevi (short-term lets). They are designed for tourism and very brief stays, offering the most flexibility but typically involving higher turnover.\nTransitory Stays (1 to 18 months): These are covered by contratti di locazione ad uso transitorio (transitory rental contracts). This is a crucial category for us, as it legally accommodates students, remote workers, and volunteers staying for a medium-term period. The law requires a justified ‚Äútransitory reason‚Äù from the guest (e.g., a temporary work project, a university course), which fits our target audience perfectly.\nLong Stays (Over 18 months): Any stay longer than 18 months would typically fall under standard residential contracts (e.g., ‚Äú4+4‚Äù). While we can offer such stays, they are not the primary focus of our business model, which is geared towards a more dynamic community.\n\nThe Purpose Dimension: Reason for Stay\nBeyond the duration, the purpose of a guest‚Äôs stay defines their relationship with the project. We have identified three primary purposes, which can be mixed and matched. Unlike the linear dimension of time, these are three separate, non-exclusive dimensions.\n\nVocational: This describes a stay purely for holiday and leisure. These guests are here to enjoy the villa and the Ligurian landscape, with no expectation of contributing work. Their financial contribution is a standard rental fee.\nVolunteer: This describes a stay where the primary purpose is to contribute actively to the villa‚Äôs renovation, maintenance, or development. In exchange for their work, volunteers receive free or heavily discounted accommodation.\nRemote Worker: This describes a stay for individuals who use the villa as their base for professional work. They require reliable infrastructure (especially internet) and a productive environment. Their financial contribution is a rental fee, but they benefit from the unique work-life balance the villa offers.\n\nThe Customer Matrix: A Hybrid Model\nIf we were to simplify these two dimensions into a discrete matrix, we would get nine basic customer profiles.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nShort Stay (&lt;1 month)Transitory Stay (1-18 months)Long Stay (&gt;18 months)VocationalTouristSabbatical / Extended HolidayResidentVolunteerTaster SessionProject ContributorLong-term VolunteerRemote WorkerWorkationDigital NomadRemote Resident\nHowever, this matrix is just a guide. The reality is that our guests are often hybrids. One could be a remote worker who also volunteers on weekends, while technically being on an extended holiday. The ‚Äúpurpose‚Äù is not a single point but a blend of the three dimensions.\nTherefore, for a more precise and future-proof model (which will be crucial when we formalise this into software), we will define each customer not by a single category, but by a set of parameters: the total duration of their stay, and the number of hours they expect to dedicate to each of the three core activities. This allows us to create truly tailored agreements that reflect the unique, hybrid nature of each person‚Äôs contribution to Coliving Liguria.\nStrategic Targeting: Reaching Our Customer Types\nThe customer matrix is more than just a classification; it is a strategic tool. By understanding the distinct needs and habits of each of the nine customer types, we can tailor both our investments and our advertising efforts to attract the right people and maximise the appeal of the villa. A one-size-fits-all advertising strategy would be inefficient. Different customer types frequent different online platforms and respond to different messages. Our approach is to use a variety of targeted channels to reach each segment effectively.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nShort Stay (&lt;1 month)Transitory Stay (1-18 months)Long Stay (&gt;18 months)VocationalAirbnb, Booking.com, Instagram (targeted tourism ads)Niche travel blogs, ‚ÄúSlow Travel‚Äù Facebook groupsLocal rental platforms, word-of-mouth referralsVolunteerWorkaway, Worldpackers (for short ‚Äútaster‚Äù sessions)Specialised volunteer platforms (e.g., for permaculture, renovation), university partnershipsPersonal or alternative contanctsRemote WorkerNomadList, Airbnb (monthly stays), targeted digital nomad Facebook groupsColiving-specific websites (e.g., Coliving.com), LinkedIn, remote work job boardsDirect community outreach, long-term coliving platforms\nAs the table shows, platforms like Airbnb and Booking.com are excellent for attracting short-term vocational guests, but they are less effective for finding long-term volunteers or remote workers. For these segments, we must engage with specific online communities, such as dedicated Facebook groups for digital nomads or platforms like Workaway, which connect volunteers with projects."},"ColivingLiguria/People/Internships/EU-Students-Admission-to-Internship":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/People/Internships/EU-Students-Admission-to-Internship","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/People/Internships/EU Students Admission to Internship.md","title":"EU Students Admission to Internship","links":["ColivingLiguria","Luna","ColivingLiguria/People/Simone-Testino","ColivingLiguria/Rules/Policies/Contracts/Active-Contracts/Contract-for-Internship","Contract-for-Residents","ColivingLiguria/People/Volunteers/Onboarding","ColivingLiguria/Rules/Regulations/Risorse-Umane/Internships-Curriculari-in-Liguria"],"tags":[],"content":"‚ÄîItaliano sotto‚Äî\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nThis page outlines the application process for students from European universities who wish to conduct a Curricular Internship at ColivingLiguria or Luna through the Erasmus+ Traineeship Programme. This is the primary and most streamlined legal path for an unpaid internship.\n\n\n\nOur Internship Philosophy\nWe believe in providing real-world educational experiences. Our internships are structured as curricular traineeships, meaning they are part of your official university studies and are designed to provide you with academic credits (ECTS).\nThis process is built upon a formal, triangular legal agreement between you (the Student), your University (the Promoting Body), and us (the Host Organisation).\nHow to Apply: The Erasmus+ Path\nThis process is specifically for students whose university is a participant in the Erasmus+ programme.\nInitial Contact\nYour first step is to send a formal application email to colivingliguria@gmail.com. This email must include two mandatory attachments:\n\nYour full Curriculum Vitae (CV)\nA copy of your valid Passport or National ID card\n\nIn the email, please also briefly state your motivation and which project (ColivingLiguria or Luna) you are interested in.\nThe Interview\nIf your profile matches our needs, we will invite you to schedule a video call with the founder, Simone Testino, to discuss your motivation, skills, and the specifics of the potential traineeship.\nThe Learning Agreement for Traineeships (LAT)\nThis is the central document of the entire process. If the interview is successful, the procedure is as follows:\n\nYou Provide a Contact: You must provide the official email address of the international or traineeship office at your university.\nWe Send the Agreement: The founder will send the Learning Agreement for Traineeships (LAT), already signed by the Host Organisation, from the official certified email address (simone.testino@legalmail.it) to your university‚Äôs contact. An example of this is uploaded in Contract for Internship.\nYou are CC‚Äôd: You will be included in the CC field of this email.\n\nUniversity Obligations: Insurance (Crucial)\nFor the internship to be legally valid in Italy, your university (the ‚ÄúSending Institution‚Äù) must fulfil its obligations under the Erasmus+ programme.\n\nSign the LAT: Your academic coordinator must review and sign the LAT and send it back.\nGuarantee Insurance: The university must certify (usually in a dedicated section of the LAT) that you are covered for the entire duration of your stay by:\n\nWorkplace Accident Insurance (equivalent to Italian INAIL)\nThird-Party Liability Insurance (RC)\n\n\n\nThis is a non-negotiable legal requirement in Italy, even for office-based work. We assume the total cost for this complete insurance coverage is below ‚Ç¨50 per month. This cost is expected to be covered by the university. However, in cases where the university lacks the funds or the procedure is too complicated, the student is free to cover this expense personally to finalise the agreement.\nCosts and Residency\nAs this is a formal curricular traineeship (not employment), there is no salary.\n\nAccommodation Contribution: You will be required to pay a weekly contribution of ‚Ç¨30 to ‚Ç¨50. This covers your accommodation and utilities.\nFood: Food is not included in this contribution, as will be specified in your residency contract.\nResidency Contract: You will be required to sign the standard Contract for Residents. The specific template for interns is found in our Contract for Internship policy.\n\nFinal Step: Onboarding\nAfter the Learning Agreement for Traineeships (LAT) has been signed by all three parties (you, your university, and us), you will be officially accepted.\nFrom that point, you will proceed with the standard Onboarding process to be formally enrolled as a resident, which includes signing the Contract for Residents. This internship procedure must be completed before the standard onboarding begins.\nLegal Reference\nThis process is built on specific Italian and regional laws. For a detailed breakdown of the legal obligations (especially regarding insurance), please refer to our internal notes: Internships Curriculari in Liguria.\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta pagina delinea il processo di candidatura per gli studenti delle universit√† europee che desiderano svolgere un Tirocinio Curriculare presso ColivingLiguria o Luna attraverso il Programma Erasmus+ Traineeship. Questo √® il percorso legale principale e pi√π snello per un tirocinio non retribuito.\n\n\n\nLa Nostra Filosofia di Tirocinio\nCrediamo nel fornire esperienze formative concrete. I nostri tirocini sono strutturati come tirocini curriculari, il che significa che fanno parte del tuo percorso di studi universitario ufficiale e sono progettati per fornirti crediti formativi (CFU/ECTS).\nQuesto processo si basa su un accordo legale formale e triangolare tra te (lo Studente), la tua Universit√† (l‚ÄôEnte Promotore) e noi (il Soggetto Ospitante).\nCome Candidarsi: Il Percorso Erasmus+\nQuesto processo √® specifico per gli studenti la cui universit√† partecipa al programma Erasmus+.\nContatto Iniziale\nIl tuo primo passo √® inviare un‚Äôemail di candidatura formale a colivingliguria@gmail.com. Questa email deve includere due allegati obbligatori:\n\nIl tuo Curriculum Vitae (CV) completo\nUna copia del tuo Passaporto o Carta d‚ÄôIdentit√† nazionale validi\n\nNell‚Äôemail, ti preghiamo anche di indicare brevemente la tua motivazione e a quale progetto (ColivingLiguria o Luna) sei interessato.\nIl Colloquio\nSe il tuo profilo corrisponder√† alle nostre esigenze, ti inviteremo a pianificare una videochiamata con il fondatore, Simone Testino, per discutere la tua motivazione, le tue competenze e i dettagli specifici del potenziale tirocinio.\nIl Learning Agreement for Traineeships (LAT)\nQuesto √® il documento centrale dell‚Äôintero processo. Se il colloquio avr√† esito positivo, la procedura √® la seguente:\n\nFornisci un Contatto: Devi fornire l‚Äôindirizzo email ufficiale dell‚Äôufficio internazionale o tirocini della tua universit√†.\nInviamo l‚ÄôAccordo: Il fondatore invier√† il Learning Agreement for Traineeships (LAT), gi√† firmato dal Soggetto Ospitante, dall‚Äôindirizzo di posta certificata (simone.testino@legalmail.it) al contatto della tua universit√†.\nSei in CC: Sarai incluso in ‚ÄòCc‚Äô (copia conoscenza) in questa email.\n\nObblighi dell‚ÄôUniversit√†: Assicurazione (Cruciale)\nAffinch√© il tirocinio sia legalmente valido in Italia, la tua universit√† (la ‚ÄúSending Institution‚Äù) deve adempiere ai suoi obblighi previsti dal programma Erasmus+.\n\nFirmare il LAT: Il tuo coordinatore accademico deve revisionare e firmare il LAT e rispedircelo.\nGarantire l‚ÄôAssicurazione: L‚Äôuniversit√† deve certificare (solitamente in una sezione dedicata del LAT) che sarai coperto per l‚Äôintera durata della tua permanenza per:\n\nAssicurazione contro gli Infortuni sul Lavoro (equivalente all‚ÄôINAIL italiano)\nAssicurazione per la Responsabilit√† Civile verso Terzi (RC)\n\n\n\nQuesto √® un requisito legale non negoziabile in Italia, anche per lavori d‚Äôufficio. Stimiamo che il costo totale per questa copertura assicurativa completa sia inferiore a 50‚Ç¨ al mese. Ci si aspetta che questo costo sia coperto dall‚Äôuniversit√†. Tuttavia, nei casi in cui l‚Äôuniversit√† non avesse i fondi o la procedura fosse troppo complicata, lo studente √® libero di coprire personalmente questa spesa per finalizzare l‚Äôaccordo.\nCosti e Residenza\nTrattandosi di un tirocinio curriculare formale (non di lavoro), non √® previsto uno stipendio.\n\nContributo Alloggio: Ti sar√† richiesto un contributo settimanale da ‚Ç¨30 a ‚Ç¨50. Questo copre il tuo alloggio e le utenze.\nVitto: Il vitto (cibo) non √® incluso in questo contributo, come sar√† specificato nel tuo contratto di residenza.\nContratto di Residenza: Ti verr√† richiesto di firmare il Contract for Residents standard. Il modello specifico per i tirocinanti si trova nella nostra policy Contract for Internship.\n\nPasso Finale: Onboarding\nDopo che il Learning Agreement for Traineeships (LAT) sar√† stato firmato da tutte e tre le parti (tu, la tua universit√† e noi), sarai ufficialmente accettato.\nDa quel momento, procederai con il processo standard di Onboarding per essere formalmente registrato come residente, che include la firma del Contract for Residents. Questa procedura di tirocinio deve essere completata prima che inizi l‚Äôonboarding standard.\nRiferimento Legale\nQuesto processo si basa su specifiche leggi italiane e regionali. Per un‚Äôanalisi dettagliata degli obblighi legali (specialmente riguardo alle assicurazioni), fai riferimento alle nostre note interne: Internships Curriculari in Liguria."},"ColivingLiguria/People/Internships/Internship-Opportunity":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/People/Internships/Internship-Opportunity","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/People/Internships/Internship Opportunity.md","title":"Internship Opportunity","links":["ColivingLiguria","Luna","ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Team","ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Software/Software-Team","ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Software/Shreshth-Kapai","ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Architecture/Architecture-Team","ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Openings","ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Event-Organisation-Team","ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Marketing/Marketing-Team","ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Construction/Construction-Team","ColivingLiguria/People/Simone-Testino","ColivingLiguria/People/Internships/EU-Students-Admission-to-Internship","ColivingLiguria/People/Internships/Non-EU-Students-Admission-to-Internship","ColivingLiguria/People/Shreshth-Kapai"],"tags":[],"content":"‚ÄîItaliano sotto‚Äî\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nThis page serves as the main portal for internship opportunities at our two companies: ColivingLiguria and Luna. We offer high-level, research-based traineeships for students seeking academic credits. Below, we outline the diverse fields of study available at each entity and guide you to the correct application process.\n\n\n\nOur Two-Company Internship Ecosystem\nWe host curricular traineeships across two distinct, founder-led companies. This structure allows us to offer a uniquely broad spectrum of opportunities, from community and land management to applied physics and engineering.\n\nColivingLiguria: This is our hospitality, community, and land-management venture. Internships here are broad, covering topics like software, architecture, agriculture, hospitality, and event management.\nLuna: This is our deep-tech manufacturing startup, developing innovative, patented lighting solutions. Internships here are strictly STEM-focused, dealing with applied physics, material science, and mechatronics.\n\nInternship Fields at ColivingLiguria\nThe best way to understand our needs is to explore our operational structure. Our work is organised into specialised units, and you can propose an internship or thesis project within any of them. You can see the full structure, including the competent people leading each section, on our Team page.\nWe are particularly interested in students for the following fields:\n\nSoftware &amp; Data: Collaborate with our existing team (e.g., Shreshth Kapai) on developing the custom software suite that runs our project. This involves databases, administration tools, and marketing automation.\nArchitecture &amp; Design: Assist in planning the renovation, interior design, and aesthetic vision for our historic properties. (Note: This team page is currently under development but will be a key area).\nAgriculture &amp; Nature: Develop projects related to permaculture, sustainable farming (see our Openings), or natural trail design on our land.\nHospitality &amp; Event Management: Work with our Event Organisation Team on the logistics, planning, and execution of community events and workshops.\nOther Teams: We also have needs within our Marketing &amp; Social and Construction Team.\n\nInternship Fields at Luna\nLuna is a high-tech project focused on applied science and engineering. This is an ideal environment for a challenging scientific or engineering thesis. We are looking for students with a background in:\n\nPhysics &amp; Optics: Core to the project is the modelling and application of light.\nMaterial Sciences: Researching advanced polymers, plastics, and textiles for the main structure.\nEngineering: Fluid dynamics, thermodynamics, and 3D modelling.\nSoftware Team|Software &amp; Robotics: Developing the physical simulation models (Python) and the onboard mechatronic/robotic control systems.\n\nPropose Your Own Thesis or Research Project\nWe actively encourage students to bring their own ideas. If you have a specific thesis topic or research project that aligns with our goals‚Äîeven if it‚Äôs not listed here‚Äîyou can propose it.\nAll proposals are reviewed by the founder, Simone Testino, to ensure they fit within the scope of our ventures.\nHow to Apply\nWe have two distinct and mandatory legal processes for admission, based on your university‚Äôs location. Please select the guide that applies to you:\n\nEU Students Admission to Internship: For students enrolled in universities within the EU (or participating in the Erasmus+ Programme).\nNon-EU Students Admission to Internship: For students from all other universities (e.g., UK, USA, Canada, Asia, etc.).\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta pagina funge da portale principale per le opportunit√† di tirocinio presso le nostre due aziende: ColivingLiguria e Luna. Offriamo tirocini di alto livello basati sulla ricerca per studenti che desiderano ottenere crediti accademici. Di seguito, delineiamo i diversi campi di studio disponibili presso ciascuna entit√† e vi guidiamo al corretto processo di candidatura.\n\n\n\nIl Nostro Ecosistema di Tirocinio a Due Aziende\nOspitiamo tirocini curriculari attraverso due distinte aziende guidate dal fondatore. I tirocini qui sono ampi e coprono temi come software, architettura, agricoltura, ospitalit√† e gestione di eventi.\nLuna: Questa √® la nostra startup manifatturiera deep-tech, che sviluppa soluzioni di illuminazione innovative e brevettate. I tirocini qui sono strettamente focalizzati sulle materie STEM, occupandosi di fisica applicata, scienza dei materiali e meccatronica.\n\nAmbiti di Tirocinio in ColivingLiguria\nIl modo migliore per comprendere le nostre esigenze √® esplorare la nostra struttura operativa. Regno Unito, USA, Canada, Asia, ecc.).\n"},"ColivingLiguria/People/Internships/Non-EU-Students-Admission-to-Internship":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/People/Internships/Non-EU-Students-Admission-to-Internship","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/People/Internships/Non-EU Students Admission to Internship.md","title":"Non-EU Students Admission to Internship","links":["ColivingLiguria","Luna","ColivingLiguria/People/Simone-Testino","ColivingLiguria/Rules/Policies/Visa-Assistance-Policy","ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Visa-Consultancy/Premium-Visa-Assistance","Contract-for-Residents","ColivingLiguria/Rules/Policies/Contracts/Active-Contracts/Contract-for-Internship","ColivingLiguria/People/Volunteers/Onboarding","ColivingLiguria/Rules/Regulations/Risorse-Umane/Internships-Curriculari-in-Liguria"],"tags":[],"content":"\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nThis page outlines the application process for students from non-EU universities who wish to conduct a Curricular Internship at ColivingLiguria or Luna. This process is legally complex and requires a visa, an accredited Italian intermediary, and careful planning.\n\n\n\nOur Internship Philosophy\nWe believe in providing real-world educational experiences. Our internships are structured as curricular traineeships, meaning they are part of your official university studies and are designed to provide you with academic credits (ECTS).\nThis process is built upon a formal, triangular legal agreement between you (the Student), an accredited Italian Promoting Body, and us (the Host Organisation).\nThe Legal Framework for Non-EU Internships\nThis path is significantly more complex than the one for EU students. You must be aware of two major legal requirements:\n\nVisa Requirement: You will require a specific visa (e.g., for study or internship) to enter and stay in Italy legally. You must apply for this at the Italian Consulate in your home country well in advance.\nAccredited Promoting Body (Soggetto Promotore): Under Italian law, your home university (e.g., in the USA, UK, Canada, or Asia) cannot legally activate an internship in Italy. You must use an accredited Italian intermediary (an ‚Äòente promotore‚Äô). This can be a foundation, an agency, or a partner university in Italy that is legally accredited to manage internships.\n\nIt is your sole responsibility to find, contact, and manage the relationship with this Italian intermediary. We (the Host Organisation) cannot do this for you.\nHow to Apply\nInitial Contact\nYour first step is to send a formal application email to colivingliguria@gmail.com. This email must include two mandatory attachments:\n\nYour full Curriculum Vitae (CV)\nA copy of your valid Passport\n\nIn the email, please also briefly state your motivation and which project (ColivingLiguria or Luna) you are interested in.\nThe Interview\nIf your profile matches our needs, we will invite you to schedule a video call with the founder, Simone Testino, to discuss your motivation, skills, and the specifics of the potential traineeship.\nThe Activation Process (After the Interview)\nIf the interview is successful, the official legal process begins. This is what you must do:\n\nFind Your Italian Intermediary: You must find an Italian ‚ÄòSoggetto Promotore‚Äô accredited to manage internships for non-EU citizens.\nProvide Us Their Contact: You must provide us with the official email address of your chosen Italian intermediary.\nWe Sign the ‚ÄòConvenzione‚Äô: The founder will send the Convenzione (Framework Agreement) from the official certified email (simone.testino@legalmail.it) to your intermediary. This is the master legal agreement between our company and them.\nDevelop the ‚ÄòProgetto Formativo Individuale‚Äô (PFI): Working with us and your intermediary, you will develop the PFI (Individual Training Plan). This document details your learning objectives and activities.\n\nMandatory Obligations: Insurance and Visa\nThe PFI and Convenzione are the essential documents you will need for your visa application.\n\nInsurance (INAIL &amp; RC): The Italian intermediary is legally responsible for ensuring you have mandatory INAIL (Workplace Accident Insurance) and RC (Third-Party Liability Insurance) coverage.\nAdministrative Costs: The intermediary will charge fees for their service and for the cost of these insurance policies. These costs are your responsibility (or your home university‚Äôs). The Host Organisation does not cover these administrative fees.\nVisa Application: Once all documents are signed, you must use them to apply for the correct visa at your local Italian Consulate. This process can take several months, so you must start immediately. You can seek help by consulting the page Visa Assistance Policy or pay for the Premium Visa Assistance.\n\nCosts and Residency\nAs this is a formal curricular traineeship (not employment), there is no salary.\n\nAccommodation Contribution: You will be required to pay a weekly contribution of ‚Ç¨30 to ‚Ç¨50. This covers your accommodation and utilities.\nFood: Food is not included in this contribution, as will be specified in your residency contract.\nResidency Contract: You will be required to sign the standard Contract for Residents. All specific contracts and templates (including the PFI) are collected in our Contract for Internship policy page.\n\nFinal Step: Onboarding\nAfter all the paperwork is signed (Convenzione, PFI) and, most importantly, your visa has been approved and issued, you will be officially accepted.\nFrom that point, you will proceed with the standard Onboarding process to be formally enrolled as a resident. This internship procedure must be completed before the standard onboarding begins.\nLegal Reference\nThis process is built on specific Italian and regional laws. For a detailed breakdown of the legal obligations, please refer to our internal notes: Internships Curriculari in Liguria."},"ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Emanuele-Garr√©":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Emanuele-Garr√©","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Emanuele Garr√©.md","title":"Emanuele Garr√©","links":["ColivingLiguria/People/Simone-Testino","System/Contacts/Contacts","ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Emanuele-Garr√©","ColivingLiguria/Advertising/Social-Media/Social-Media"],"tags":[],"content":"Emanuele Garr√® played a helpful role in getting the Coliving Liguria project started. He contributed to the complex search for the villa, assisting with the bureaucracy and handling key aspects that could be managed remotely. He also provided practical support by personally joining the first property visits. Emanuele‚Äôs help was present throughout the process, from the initial viewings to the final purchase of the villa.\n\nContacts\nThe following contacts are available full-time. It is designed to be an organised space where every member can find relevant information without being overwhelmed by unrelated messages. By joining the main community, you gain access to the public announcements channel. Access to more specific working groups is granted based on your role and involvement in the project.\n\n\n\nJoin Us\nYou can access the main community via this link:\n\nClick here to join the ColivingLiguria Community\n\nGroup Structure: A Hierarchy of Involvement\nOur main community is structured in numbered levels. The first level is open to everyone, while access to higher levels is by invitation only, based on your active role.\nI. üì¢ Public Level\nThis is the public gateway to the project, split into two parts to ensure clear communication.\n\nAnnouncements Channel (Default): You join this channel by default. It is used for sharing essential news, major announcements, and official updates. It is a low-volume, read-only channel, ensuring you receive key information without spam.\nDiscussion Group (Optional): An interactive space for members to chat, share ideas, and ask questions freely. Joining is optional.\n\nII. ‚≠ê Ex Loco\n\nPurpose: To maintain a connection with former guests and volunteers who have already experienced Coliving Liguria.\nFor Whom: Once you are part of the family, you can stay in this group indefinitely to receive major updates and event invitations.\n\nIII. üè° In Loco\n\nPurpose: For managing day-to-day life inside the villa (shared dinners, cleaning schedules, grocery runs).\nFor Whom: Exclusively for people physically staying at the villa at any given time. You join upon arrival and leave upon departure.\n\nIV. üõ†Ô∏è Active Projects\n\nPurpose: The operational heart of the hands-on work at the villa. Used to coordinate daily tasks, materials, and physical contributions.\nFor Whom: Officially accepted volunteers and collaborators currently working on-site.\n\nV. üß† Core Team\n\nPurpose: The strategic ‚Äúbrain‚Äù of the project for long-term development and key decisions.\nFor Whom: The limited group of people who make up the long-term foundation of the project.\n\nSpecialist Teams\nIn addition to the main hierarchy, we have specific working groups for our formal Specialized Teams. These groups are where our professionals (see People) coordinate their work in weekly online meetings.\n\n\n                  \n                  Professionals Only \n                  \n                \n\n\nThese groups are not open-access. A university degree or relevant professional experience is strictly required. You must have a video call with me first to present your competence and experience before joining.\n\n\n\nüèõÔ∏è Architecture &amp; Design\n\nPurpose: This is the coordination group for the official Architecture Team.\nFor Whom: For architects, technicians, exterior designers, and garden designers who are formally collaborating on the project.\n\nüì∏ Marketing &amp; Social\n\nPurpose: This is the coordination group for the official Marketing Team.\nFor Whom: For photographers, social media managers, content creators, web designers, and graphic designers.\n\nüë®‚Äçüíª Software &amp; Data\n\nPurpose: This is the coordination group for the official Software Team.\nFor Whom: For those collaborating on our GitHub repository to manage data, financials, and internal software.\n\n‚öñÔ∏è Legal &amp; Bureau\n\nPurpose: This is the coordination group for the official Legal Team.\nFor Whom: For professionals discussing legal matters, contracts, and bureaucracy.\n\nüé™ Event Organiser\n\nPurpose: This is the coordination group for the official Event Organiser Team.\nFor Whom: For professional event planners, coordinators, and organizers who collaborate on planning and executing events at ColivingLiguria.\n\nüåï Luna Startup\n\nPurpose: Dedicated to our sister project, the innovative startup Luna, which will have one of its production labs within Coliving Liguria.\nFor Whom: Strictly reserved for the few people directly collaborating on the Luna project.\n\nHow to Join Higher Levels\nAccess to all restricted groups is managed directly by me, Simone Testino. Access to these groups is granted when you formally join one of our specialized teams.\nIf you believe you have the right skills for one of the Specialist Remote Teams, please check our Openings page and then Contact me directly for a chat.\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nLa Community WhatsApp di Coliving Liguria √® il nostro centro nevralgico per la comunicazione quotidiana. √à progettata per essere uno spazio organizzato dove ogni membro pu√≤ trovare informazioni rilevanti senza essere sommerso da messaggi non attinenti. Il primo livello √® aperto a tutti, mentre l‚Äôaccesso ai livelli superiori avviene solo su invito, in base al tuo ruolo attivo.\nI. üì¢ Livello Pubblico\nQuesto √® l‚Äôaccesso pubblico al progetto, suddiviso in due parti per garantire chiarezza.\n\nCanale Annunci (Predefinito): Ti unisci a questo canale automaticamente. Viene utilizzato per condividere notizie essenziali, grandi annunci e aggiornamenti ufficiali. √à un canale a basso volume, di sola lettura, per ricevere informazioni chiave senza spam.\nGruppo di Discussione (Opzionale): Uno spazio interattivo per chiacchierare, scambiare idee e fare domande liberamente. I will stop taking other bookings for your spot, prepare your room, and arrange room assignments based on your confirmed dates and preferences.\nThis means that if you pay the deposit, as stated in the contract, you cannot expect it to be returned if you later change your mind about any details already present in the contract.\nPlease read the contract very, very, very well before sending any money.\nYou will not be given access to the house without this signed contract.\n\n\n\nQuestions?\nIf you have any questions about this specific legal process, please Contact me (Simone Testino).\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta pagina descrive il processo di onboarding ufficiale e obbligatorio per tutti i futuri residenti. The spirit of collaboration is central to our project, but it‚Äôs crucial to understand our legal framework. We clarify the term ‚Äúvolunteer,‚Äù what residents can and cannot do, and how you can truly contribute your skills by joining us as an entrepreneurial partner or resident, as outlined on our Openings page.\n\n\n\nThe Spirit of ‚ÄúVolunteering‚Äù\nWe have been genuinely amazed by how many people from all over the world are willing to come and help bring our project at Ville Chiappella to life. This diversity and energy are what make it possible to build a joyful, collective experience together.\nHowever, to protect both our residents and the project, we must operate within a clear legal structure. The term ‚Äúvolunteer‚Äù must be understood within the specific legal limits of Italian law.\n\n\n                  \n                  A Crucial Legal Distinction \n                  \n                \n\n\nFor marketing and simplicity, we often use the term ‚Äúvolunteer.‚Äù However, from a legal standpoint, no one at ColivingLiguria is a volunteer in the traditional sense. Coliving Liguria is a for-profit enterprise and cannot use volunteering as defined by the Italian ‚ÄúThird Sector‚Äù laws.\n\n\n\nThe Legal Framework: Residents, Not Volunteers\nEvery person who stays with us, regardless of their contribution, is legally a Resident (either a tenant, conduttore, or in loan-for-use, comodatario).\n\nYour Contract: Every resident must sign a Contract for Residents. This contract, which clearly outlines rights, rules, and costs, does not obligate you to perform any work.\n\nWhat You Can Do: Community Life &amp; Ordinary Maintenance\nAs a resident living in the house, you are legally and contractually expected to participate in ‚Äúcommunity life.‚Äù This includes:\n\nCooking, cleaning common areas, and taking care of the house.\nThis participation is legally defined as Manutenzione Ordinaria (Ordinary Maintenance).\nThis is not considered work; it is the legal duty of any resident to care for the space they live in, as defined by the Italian Civil Code.\n\nThe Legal Limit: What You Cannot Do\nFor clear legal and safety reasons, residents are strictly prohibited from performing any tasks that qualify as Manutenzione Straordinaria (Extraordinary Maintenance).\n\nThis includes structural renovation, technical work (electrical, plumbing), or any construction.\nThis work is reserved only for qualified professionals, such as a registered Carpenter, or the owner, Simone Testino.\n\nHow to Truly Contribute Your Skills\nThe best way to contribute your specific skills (e.g., as a carpenter, designer, farmer, or marketer) is not as a simple ‚Äúvolunteer,‚Äù but by taking on a formal role within the project.\n\nApply for an Opening: This is our preferred method. We are actively looking for entrepreneurial individuals for roles like Farmer, Gardening Designer, Social Media Manager, and more. These are partnerships with clear remuneration models (from free rent to equity).\nPropose Your Own Project: If you have a different idea that fits our ecosystem, follow the process on our Propose a Project page.\n\nOur Residency Offer (Replacing ‚ÄúShared Expenses‚Äù)\nOur offer is now simplified and legally clear, replacing the old ‚Äúshared expenses‚Äù model.\n\nShort-Term Stays (&lt; 30 days): This is the standard entry model. It‚Äôs a short-term rental agreement where residents contribute ‚Ç¨30 per week to cover utility costs.\nMedium-Long Term Stays (&gt; 30 days):\n\nPart-Time Option: A registered rental agreement with a small monthly rent (under ‚Ç¨200) for those who contribute part-time to a project.\nLoan-for-Use (Comodato): For key collaborators, we can offer a free-rent contract, which requires a one-time ‚Ç¨200 registration tax (paid by the resident).\n\n\n\nHow to Apply\nThe old application form is no longer in use.\n\nRead the Core Documents: Understand our legal framework by reading Limiti Legali del Volontariato and the Contract for Residents.\nFind Your Role: Review our Openings page or prepare a project idea via Propose a Project.\nContact Us: Get in touch with me, Simone Testino, directly. All details are on our Contact page.\n\nA Note on Visas\nAs a general rule, we do not offer visa assistance for ‚Äúvolunteer‚Äù positions due to the legal complexities. Assistance is generally reserved for paying guests or formally contracted partners. For more information read the Visa Assistance Policy.\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta pagina spiega cosa significa ‚Äúvolontariato‚Äù a ColivingLiguria. Questa diversit√† ed energia sono ci√≤ che rende possibile costruire insieme un‚Äôesperienza collettiva e gioiosa.\nTuttavia, per proteggere sia i nostri residenti che il progetto, dobbiamo operare all‚Äôinterno di una chiara struttura legale. Tuttavia, da un punto di vista legale, nessuno a ColivingLiguria √® un volontario in senso tradizionale. Coliving Liguria √® un‚Äôimpresa a scopo di lucro e non pu√≤ avvalersi del volontariato come definito dalle leggi italiane sul ‚ÄúTerzo Settore‚Äù.\n\n\n\nIl Quadro Legale: Residenti, Non Volontari\nOgni persona che soggiorna da noi, indipendentemente dal suo contributo, √® legalmente un Residente (un inquilino, conduttore, o in comodato d‚Äôuso, comodatario).\n\nIl Tuo Contratto: Ogni residente deve firmare un Contract for Residents. Questo contratto, che delinea chiaramente diritti, regole e costi, non obbliga a svolgere alcun lavoro.\n\nCosa Puoi Fare: Vita Comunitaria e Manutenzione Ordinaria\nCome residente che vive nella casa, ci si aspetta legalmente e contrattualmente che tu partecipi alla ‚Äúvita comunitaria‚Äù. Questo include:\n\nCucinare, pulire le aree comuni e prendersi cura della casa.\nQuesta partecipazione √® legalmente definita come Manutenzione Ordinaria.\nQuesto non √® considerato lavoro; √® il dovere legale di qualsiasi residente prendersi cura dello spazio in cui vive, come definito dal Codice Civile italiano.\n\nIl Limite Legale: Cosa Non Puoi Fare\nPer chiare ragioni legali e di sicurezza, ai residenti √® severamente vietato svolgere qualsiasi compito che si qualifichi come Manutenzione Straordinaria.\n\nCi√≤ include ristrutturazioni strutturali, lavori tecnici (elettrici, idraulici) o qualsiasi costruzione.\nQuesto lavoro √® riservato solo a professionisti qualificati, come un Carpenter registrato, o al proprietario, Simone Testino.\n\nCome Contribuire Veramente con le Tue Competenze\nIl modo migliore per contribuire con le tue competenze specifiche (ad es. come falegname, designer, agricoltore o esperto di marketing) non √® come semplice ‚Äúvolontario‚Äù, ma assumendo un ruolo formale all‚Äôinterno del progetto.\n\nCandidati per una Posizione Aperta: Questo √® il nostro metodo preferito.
