Definitions\n\n\\langle K, b , R, \\{S_x : x \\in K\\} \\rangle is a Veltman Prestructure if:\n\nK \\not = \\emptyset\nb \\in K \\land \\forall_{x \\in K} x = b \\lor bRx\nR is binary relations\nS_x are binary relations on K s.t. \\forall_{x, y, z \\in K} y S_x z \\to x R y\n\nS[x] := S_x\n\n\n\n\nA \\triangleright B iff T + A is (relatively) interpretable in T + B, (it is axiomatised in the construction of BIL)\n\nfor T + A := \\{\\varphi: \\exists_{\\varphi_1, ..., \\varphi_n \\in T}\\exists_{\\psi_1, ..., \\psi_m \\in A} \\{\\varphi_1, ..., \\varphi_n, \\psi_1, ..., \\psi_m\\}\\vdash \\varphi\\}, if theories are meant to be inferentially closed, otherwise, T + A := T \\cup A.\n\n\nfor K \\not = \\emptyset and \\mathcal{L} the language, \\Vdash is a relation between K and \\mathcal{L} with the &quot;usual clauses&quot;, together with:\n\nfor x \\in K, A, B theories, (x \\Vdash A \\triangleright B)\\leftrightarrow (\\forall_{y \\in K} ((x R y \\land y \\Vdash A) \\to \\exists_{z \\in K}(y S_x z \\land z \\Vdash B)))\n\n\nfor V a Veltman prestructure, \\Vdash a forcing relation on V, \\langle V , \\Vdash \\rangle is a Veltman Premodel\nfor W, W&#039; two Veltman Premodels, \\beta is a bisimulation if:\n\n\\beta is a relation between K and K&#039;\nb \\beta b&#039;\n\\forall_{x \\in K} \\forall_{x&#039; \\in K&#039;} x \\beta x&#039; \\to (\\forall_{y \\in K} (x R y \\to \\exists_{y&#039; \\in K&#039;}(y \\beta y&#039; \\land x&#039; R y&#039; \\land \\forall_{z&#039; \\in K&#039;}(y&#039; S_x z&#039; \\to \\exists_{z \\in K}( z \\beta z&#039; \\land y S_x z))))\n\\forall_{x \\in K} \\forall_{x&#039; \\in K&#039;} x \\beta x&#039; \\to (\\forall_{y&#039; \\in K&#039;} (x&#039; R y&#039; \\to \\exists_{y&#039; \\in K&#039;}(y \\beta y&#039; \\land x R y \\land \\forall_{z \\in K}(y S_{x&#039;} z \\to \\exists_{z&#039; \\in K&#039;}( z&#039; \\beta z \\land y&#039; S_{x&#039;} z&#039;))))\n\\forall_{x \\in K} \\forall_{x&#039; \\in K&#039;} x \\beta x&#039; \\to (x \\Vdash p \\leftrightarrow x&#039; \\Vdash p) for all atoms p\n\n\ncf. 3. Expressive Power and Invariance\n\n\n\n2. Facts\n\n(i) bisimulating is an equivalence relation\n(ii) for \\beta a bisimulation between W, W&#039; and x \\in K, x&#039; \\in K&#039; s.t. x \\beta x&#039;, then for any theory A of the language x \\Vdash A \\Leftrightarrow x&#039; \\Vdash&#039; A.\n\ncorresponds to J4, K1, K2.\n\n\n\n3. Some Principles &amp; Correspondences for Veltman Prestructures\nsee 4. Frame Correspondence. These principles show the strong similarities between &quot;\\triangleright&quot; and &quot;\\to&quot;.\n\n\\vdash \\square ( A \\to B) \\to A \\triangleright B, (J1)\n\ncorresponds to: x R y \\to y S_x y\n\n\n\\vdash (A \\triangleright B \\land B \\triangleright C) \\to A \\triangleright C, (J2)\n\nTransitivity\ncorresponds to: for all x \\in K, S_x is transitive and y S_x z \\to x R z\nif we consider structures with (ii), J2 corresponds to (i).\n\n\n\\vdash (A \\triangleright C \\land B \\triangleright C) \\to (A \\lor B) \\triangleright C, (J3)\n\\vdash A \\triangleright B \\to (\\lozenge A \\to \\lozenge B), (J4)\n\ncorresponds to (ii)\n\n\n\\vdash (A \\triangleright B \\land \\square(B \\to C)) \\to A \\triangleright C, (K1)\n\ncorresponds to (ii)\n\n\n\\vdash (A \\triangleright B \\land B \\triangleright \\bot) \\to A \\triangleright \\bot, (K2)\n\ncorresponds to (ii)\n\n\n\\vdash \\lozenge A \\triangleright A, (J5)\n\ncorresponds to: x R y \\land y R z \\to y S_x z\n\n\n\n4. More Definitions\n\n\\langle K, b , R, \\{S_x : x \\in K\\} \\rangle is a Veltman Structure if:\n\nK \\not = \\emptyset\nb \\in K \\land \\forall_{x \\in K} x = b \\lor bRx\nR is binary relations\nS_x are transitive and reflexive binary relations \\{y \\in K : x R y\\} (=: xR)\n\\forall_{x, y, z \\in K} (x R  y \\land y R z) \\to y S_x z (equivalently R|_{xR} \\subseteq S_x)\n\n4. &amp; 5. imply that R is transitive\n\n\n\n\n\n5. Basic Interpretability Logic\n\n\\vdash A \\Rightarrow \\vdash \\square A (L1)\n\\square (A \\to B) \\to (\\square A \\to \\square B), (L2)\n\\square A \\to \\square \\square A, (L3)\n\\square (\\square A \\to A) \\to \\square A, (L4)\nBIL is Prop. Modal Logic with L1-4 &amp; J1-5\n\nL3 is derived by L4 but also by J4-5\n\n\n\n6. Some Facts about BIL\n\na Veltman Structure is upwards well-founded if R is upwards well-founded.\nif a Veltman Structure is upwards well-founded, then BIL is valid.\nBIL \\vdash A \\Leftrightarrow for all (finite) upwards well-founded Veltman Models W and all k of W, k \\Vdash A (Completeness Theorem, De Jongh, Veltman)\n\n7. Some Derivations in BIL\n\nA \\equiv B := A \\triangleright B \\land B \\triangleright A\n\\square^+A := A \\land \\square A\n\\vdash \\square^+ (C \\leftrightarrow D) \\to (AC \\leftrightarrow AD), (K3)\n\nwhat is AC?\nderived from J1, J2\n\n\n\\vdash A \\equiv (A \\lor \\lozenge A), (K4)\n\nderived from J1, J3, J5\n\n\n\\phi A:= A \\lor \\lozenge A\n\\psi A := A \\land \\square \\lnot A\n(K5) is made from\n\n\\vdash \\phi A \\leftrightarrow \\phi \\phi A\n\\vdash A \\leftrightarrow \\phi \\psi A\n\\vdash \\psi A \\leftrightarrow \\psi \\psi A\n\\vdash \\psi A \\leftrightarrow \\psi \\phi A\n\n\n\\vdash A \\triangleright (A \\land \\square \\lnot A), (K6)\n\nit is an alternative for J5.\n\n\n\\vdash A \\equiv (A \\land \\square \\lnot A), (K7)\n\\vdash A \\triangleright \\bot \\to \\square \\lnot A, (K8)\n\nderived from J4\n\n\n\\vdash \\lozenge A \\to \\lnot (A \\triangleright \\lozenge A), (K9, Feferman Principle)\n\nthis is not derivable in BIL\n\n\n\\vdash \\lozenge A \\triangleright \\lnot (A \\triangleright \\lozenge A), (K10)\n\nis a weakening of K9 that is derivable in BIL\n\n\n"},"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Alexandru-Baltag/Baltag,-A.-(2016),-To-Know-is-to-Know-the-Value-of-a-Variable":{"slug":"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Alexandru-Baltag/Baltag,-A.-(2016),-To-Know-is-to-Know-the-Value-of-a-Variable","filePath":"Academia/Notes & Papers/Authors/Alexandru Baltag/Baltag, A. This is one of the sources I use to connect my B.A. Philosophy Thesis to the literature. I will therefore often make comparisons with my work and definitions.\nIntroduction\nThere are two definitions from the past papers by Tarski that are relevant here:\nFor theories T and S we say ‚ÄùT interprets S‚Äù if there is a translation \\tau: \\mathcal{L}_S \\to \\mathcal{L}_T s.t. \\forall_{\\varphi \\in \\mathcal{L}_S} S \\vdash \\varphi \\to T \\vdash \\tau(\\varphi). This exactly resembles my notion of Partial Translation of the theory T. Here what I call Logic are called ‚ÄúLanguages‚Äù.\nBefore proceeding I switch to studying:"},"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Hannes-Leitgeb/Leitgeb,-H.,-Ladyman,-J.-(2007),-Criteria-of-Identity-and-Structuralist-Ontology":{"slug":"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Hannes-Leitgeb/Leitgeb,-H.,-Ladyman,-J.-(2007),-Criteria-of-Identity-and-Structuralist-Ontology","filePath":"Academia/Notes & Papers/Authors/Hannes Leitgeb/Leitgeb, H., Ladyman, J. I show my reasonings on the paper and an attempt to formalise it in Overleaf: Structuralism &amp; Identity."},"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Helmut-Schwichtenberg/Helmut-Schwichtenberg":{"slug":"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Helmut-Schwichtenberg/Helmut-Schwichtenberg","filePath":"Academia/Notes & Papers/Authors/Helmut Schwichtenberg/Helmut Schwichtenberg.md","title":"Helmut Schwichtenberg","links":["Academia/Active--and--Works/Bachelor/3rd-Semester/Mathematics/Constructive-Analysis-(Lecture)","Academia/Active--and--Works/Master/5th-Semester/Proof-Theory-(Lecture)"],"tags":[],"content":"Website\nI followed the seminar on Constructive Analysis (Lecture), which presupposed knowledge in basic functioning of Minlog.\nIn Proof Theory (Lecture) we followed in class the proof in:\nHelmut Schwichtenberg. Proof theory: Some applications of cut-elimination. In Studies in Logic and the Foundations of Mathematics, volume 90, pages 867‚Äì895. Elsevier, 1977."},"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Hans-Halvorson/Halvorson,-H.-(2012),-What-Scientific-Theories-Could-not-Be":{"slug":"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Hans-Halvorson/Halvorson,-H.-(2012),-What-Scientific-Theories-Could-not-Be","filePath":"Academia/Notes & Papers/Authors/Hans Halvorson/Halvorson, H. (2012), What Scientific Theories Could not Be.md","title":"Halvorson, H. (2012), What Scientific Theories Could not Be","links":["Academia/Active--and--Works/Bachelor/3rd-Semester/Philosophy/Structure-on-Models","Academia/Active--and--Works/Bachelor/4th-Semester/Questions--and--Other-Works/First-Thesis-Concept/First-Bachelor-Thesis-Concept","Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Hans-Halvorson/Halvorson,-H.-(2013),-The-semantic-view,-if-plausible,-is-syntactic","Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Hans-Halvorson/Hans-Halvorson","Academia/Active--and--Works/Bachelor/3rd-Semester/Philosophy/Modal-Logic-(Lecture)","Academia/Active--and--Works/Bachelor/4th-Semester/Questions--and--Other-Works/First-Thesis-Concept/Mathematics-First-Thesis-Concept/Algebra-on-Worlds"],"tags":[],"content":"The PDF of the paper can be found here. My comment and understanding of the paper can be found in the essay Structure on Models and what follows are some other, mostly related, remarks.\n\nHere I collect brief notes on particular topics connected or of particular interest for my First Bachelor Thesis Concept. On the same topic, see Halvorson, H. (2013), The semantic view, if plausible, is syntactic. For other papers by the same author, visit Hans Halvorson\nIdentity Crisis for Theories\nIn this part of the paper Halvorson presents three possible identity criteria for theories in the semantic view: for mod(T) := \\{\\mathcal{M} is a model : T \\models \\mathcal{M}\\}.\n\nT \\sim_E T&#039; :=  exists f: mod(T) \\to mod(T&#039;) s.t. f is bij.\nT \\sim_P T&#039; := exists f: mod(T) \\to mod(T&#039;) s.t. f is bij. and \\forall_{\\mathcal{M} \\in mod(T)} \\mathcal{M} \\cong f(\\mathcal{M}).\nT \\sim_ I T&#039; := mod(T) = mod(T&#039;)\nThese criteria, I believe, assume an intuition on mod(T), namely that it is no more than a set. For instance, if mod(T) had some structure, like a partial order or the one of a group, one would define some equivalence relation as isomorphisms of such structures. For this reason I am interested in finding some further structure to mod(T) so that some alternative equivalence relation as an isomorphism of such structures can be defined.\n\nPartial Order\nFollowing the usual construction of a maximally order set through the procedure of the Lindenbaum‚Äôs Lemma (see 7. Soundness and Completeness I, whose proof gives a practical grasp to the algorithm), one notices that for  \\mathcal{P}_T:= \\{A \\subseteq \\mathcal{L} : T \\subseteq A \\land A \\not \\models \\bot \\}, (\\mathcal{P}_T, \\subseteq) is a partial order whose minimal element is T and maximal elements of each chain are in mod(T). Following the previous reasonings one could now consider two other identity criteria for theories:\n\nT \\sim_{PO_1} T&#039; \\Leftrightarrow (\\mathcal{P}_T, \\subseteq) \\cong (\\mathcal{P}_{T&#039;}, \\subseteq)\nT \\sim_{PO_2} T&#039; \\Leftrightarrow (\\mathcal{P}_T, \\subseteq) \\cong (\\mathcal{P}_{T&#039;}, \\subseteq) for f isom., \\forall_{\\mathcal{M} \\in mod(T)} \\mathcal{M} \\cong f(\\mathcal{M})\n\nOne might also consider: (\\mathcal{P}_T, \\subseteq) \\cong (\\mathcal{P}_{T&#039;}, \\subseteq) for f isom., \\forall_{A \\in \\mathcal{P}_T} A \\cong f(A). Though clearly A \\cong A&#039; for A, A&#039; \\in \\mathcal{P} is not defined since A, A&#039; are only consistent sets, i.e. theories, but not structures. One could instead define:\n\nT \\sim_{PO_3} T&#039; \\Leftrightarrow (\\mathcal{P}_T, \\subseteq) \\cong (\\mathcal{P}_{T&#039;}, \\subseteq) for f isom., \\forall_{A \\in mod(T)} A \\sim_{PO_2} f(A)\nIt might be the case though that T \\sim_{PO_3} T&#039; \\Leftrightarrow T \\sim_{PO_2} T&#039;.\n\nIt would be then interesting to see whether \\sim_{PO_1}, \\sim_{PO_2} and \\sim_{PO_3} are equivalent to one of the previously mentioned relation or if they are subject to the same critique.\nSpecial Identities\nHalvorson considers only those identity criteria that can be applied on all theories in full generality, just like the method I described above. Though, one might be willing, for some other reason, to consider only some theories in particular and define some equivalence relation not subject to Halvorson‚Äôs critique. I do not dive into the numerous possibilities here but want instead consider one precise method that goes in this direction which is strictly related to my First Bachelor Thesis Concept in particular to: Algebra on Worlds.\nThe thesis I want to argue for in part of my thesis is that, thanks to some structure on generators of ultrafilters, I am able to transfer such a structure up to ultraproducts (i.e. some models). For the sake of this comment, I will assume that there is some algebra \\mathcal{A} on ultraproducts of (A_n)_{n\\in \\mathbb{N}} a sequence of structures. More precisely I assume that there are some operations (of any arity) R_1, ..., R_n on \\mathcal{X} := \\{\\prod_{\\mathcal{U}} A_n : \\mathcal{U} is ultrafil.\\} s.t. for any X, Y \\in \\mathcal{X} we have X R_i Y \\in \\mathcal{X}.\nNow, in case mod(T) = \\mathcal{X},\n\nT \\sim_{\\Pi_1} T&#039; \\Leftrightarrow mod(T) \\cong mod(T&#039;) for mod(T) = \\{\\prod_{\\mathcal{U}} A_n : \\mathcal{U} is ultrafil.\\} and operations R_1, ..., R_n.\n\nThe case mod(T) = \\mathcal{X} rightfully seems not to be a probable one, though, since in \\mathcal{X} we range on all \\mathcal{U} and keep A_n fixed, we might set A_n := mod(T), hence consider: \\mathcal{X}_T := \\{\\prod_{\\mathcal{U}} mod(T) : \\mathcal{U} is ultrafil.\\} and \\mathcal{A}_T its algebra. A relevant question here is: does mod(T) \\subseteq \\mathcal{X}_T hold for any theory?\nIf we have mod(T) \\subseteq \\mathcal{X}_T we can then define:\n\nT \\sim_{\\Pi_2} T&#039; \\Leftrightarrow \\mathcal{A}_T \\cong \\mathcal{A}_{T&#039;} for  is ultrafil..\n\nNow back to the question, does mod(T) \\subseteq \\mathcal{X}_T hold for any theory? By ≈Åos Theorem, for \\mathcal{U} ultrafil. and A \\equiv A&#039; := \\forall_{\\varphi \\in \\mathcal{L}} A \\models \\varphi \\Leftrightarrow A&#039; \\models \\varphi, we have \\forall_{u \\in \\mathcal{U}} n \\in u \\Rightarrow \\prod_\\mathcal{U} A_n \\equiv A_n and since \\forall_{n \\in \\mathbb{N}} \\exists_{\\mathcal{U} \\subseteq \\mathcal{P}(\\omega)}(\\mathcal{U} is ultrafil. \\land \\forall_{u \\in \\mathcal{U}} n \\in u), then \\forall_{n \\in \\mathbb{N}} \\exists_{X \\in \\mathcal{X}} A_n \\equiv X hence, up to elem. equivalence, (A_n)_{n \\in \\mathbb{N}} \\subseteq \\{\\prod_\\mathcal{U}A_n : \\mathcal{U} is ultrafil.\\}. To get to a formal proof I should prove: (i) \\forall_{n \\in \\mathbb{N}} \\exists_{\\mathcal{U} \\subseteq \\mathcal{P}(\\omega)}(\\mathcal{U} is ultrafil. \\land \\forall_{u \\in \\mathcal{U}} n \\in u) and (ii) \\forall_{u \\in \\mathcal{U}} n \\in u \\Rightarrow \\prod_\\mathcal{U} A_n \\equiv A_n.\nTechnical Part\nHere I summarise some of the results and definition that Halvorson states from page 191. \\mathcal{L}(T) is the language of the theory T.\n\nfor T, T&#039; theories, F: \\mathcal{L}(T) \\to \\mathcal{L}(T&#039;) preserving var. and arity of constants s.t. for each \\varphi, \\psi \\in T, \\varphi \\vdash \\psi \\Rightarrow F(\\varphi) \\vdash F(\\psi) p. 191 (Interpretation)\nF: T \\to T‚Äô, G: T‚Äô \\to T interpretations s.t. \\forall_{\\varphi \\in \\mathcal{L}(T)}(T \\vdash G \\circ F (\\varphi) \\leftrightarrow \\varphi)\\land \\forall_{\\psi \\in \\mathcal{L}(T&#039;)}(T&#039;) \\vdash F \\circ G(\\psi) \\leftrightarrow \\psi), (G is weak inverse)\n\nI don&#039;t see how concatenation of the functions can work here\n\n\nF, G interp. s.t. G weak inv. of F (T, T&#039; definitionally equivalent)\nT = \\{\\exists_{= 1} x ( x = x)\\}, T&#039; = T \\cup \\{i \\in \\mathbb{N} : Q_0 (x) \\vdash Q_i(x)\\}\n\n|mod(T)| = |mod(T&#039;)|\nthere is a bij. f : mod(T) \\to mod(T&#039;) s.t. f(m) \\cong m. (p. 192bottom)\n\n\nF, F^* interp. s.t. F^* weak inv. of F, \\exists_{m&#039; \\in mod(T&#039;)}|m&#039;| \\not = |F^*(m&#039;)|.\n\nhence def.equiv. theories don‚Äôt have isom. models. (?)\n\n\n"},"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Hans-Halvorson/Halvorson,-H.-(2013),-The-semantic-view,-if-plausible,-is-syntactic":{"slug":"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Hans-Halvorson/Halvorson,-H.-(2013),-The-semantic-view,-if-plausible,-is-syntactic","filePath":"Academia/Notes & Papers/Authors/Hans Halvorson/Halvorson, H. (2013), The semantic view, if plausible, is syntactic.md","title":"Halvorson, H. (2013), The semantic view, if plausible, is syntactic","links":["Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Hans-Halvorson/Halvorson,-H.-(2012),-What-Scientific-Theories-Could-not-Be","Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Hans-Halvorson/Hans-Halvorson"],"tags":[],"content":"In this paper Halvorson replies some remarks by Glymour to Halvorson, H. (2012), What Scientific Theories Could not Be. For other papers by the same author, visit Hans Halvorson.\nIn the semantic view models, and hence theories, are supposed to live in an extralinguistic level, some conceptual form still to be distinguished from a platonic realm of concepts (like in G√∂del). Particularly relevant in the debate is the remark by Glymour:\nTo be at all plausible, the semantic view must distinguish between the content of a theory ‚Äî its class of models ‚Äî and the means of characterizing that class ‚Äî the theory expressed in some language.\nThat is to say, as it seems to me, that you have models on an ‚Äúhigher‚Äù level than their linguistic ‚Äúinstances‚Äù, which gives a very platonic flavour to the semantic view.\nThere are two (analogous) ways though in which I can understand more precisely this concept: on one hand I imagine these semantical abstract entities to require a syntactical component (i.e. a language) to be instantiated, though, such a choice is both necessary (as presented in the last quote of the p. 3) and irrelevant. On the other hand, as exposed again by Glymour:\nA tenable semantic view, as I construe it, also requires that there is a model theoretic relation that establishes a common content to different presentations of a theory in different languages.\nThere is the need of some ‚Äúmodel theoretic relation‚Äù between the syntactical entities so that we can construct the semantical level as a composition of such equivalence classes.\nHalvorson though argues by giving a simple (yet still unclear to me) example where the theory of groups seems not to share the underlying models if the language changes and therefore concludes that ‚Äúmodels are necessarily language-bounded objects‚Äù.\nA possible developments at this point would be to present some concrete abstraction of a syntactic-model to some semantic-model. Even though Halvorson argues for the failure of models to be the invariant of theories under change of language, I do not see arguments against the formerly given (distinct?) proposal(s). Let‚Äôs consider those again.\n\nGiven an equivalence relation between the well-known syntactic-models one might take equivalence classes and call those semantic-models. Then T and T&#039; are said equivalent if, after a choice of languages and the respective formulation of the theories, say T_{\\mathcal{L}} and T_{\\mathcal{L}&#039;}, the equivalence classes of their models match (given some equivalence relation, like those exposed in Halvorson, H. (2012), What Scientific Theories Could not Be).\nAlternatively one might consider define (far less constructively) a semantic-model to be the class of all those syntactic models that are the result of the choice of some language. For instance we might imagine \\mathbb{Z}_2 to have a ‚Äúsemantical existence‚Äù (comparable to the platonism) and have some instantiations for a specific choice of a language (comparable to concrete instantiations of \\mathbb{Z}_2 in the world which we can find in computers). Again, two theories are equivalent their semantic-models match (given some equivalence relation, like those exposed in Halvorson, H. (2012), What Scientific Theories Could not Be).\nI still see those two ways to be plausible.\n\nTo conclude, I do not see a necessary but irrelevant passage through the syntactic level enough to label the semantic view as syntactic."},"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Hans-Halvorson/Halvorson,-H.-(2015),-Morita-Equivalence":{"slug":"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Hans-Halvorson/Halvorson,-H.-(2015),-Morita-Equivalence","filePath":"Academia/Notes & Papers/Authors/Hans Halvorson/Halvorson, H. Horsten. Arguments against some of the theses sustained by Prof. Horsten are available here Overleaf: Horsten, L. (2010), Having an Interpretation. In the same file, the second section presents consequences I derived from structuralism which I could not find in the literature.\nI contacted Prof. Horsten to get clarification on the points presented and discuss my arguments, though got no answer.\nAbstract\nI divide the document into two sections, in the first I argue against some theses present in the article, in particular: relevance of the reference fixing question, the social theory of reference and the missing reference of unobservables in empirical structuralism. The second section contains a brief exposition of consequences in philosophy of logic which I see to follow directly from ontological structuralism but to which I did not find any reference yet.\nRelated Pages\n\nPhilosophy First Thesis Concept\nStructuralism\nThe Silent Assumption in Tarskian Semantics\n"},"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Leon-Horsten/Horsten,-L.-(2019),-The-Metaphysics-and-Mathematics-of-Arbitrary-Objects":{"slug":"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Leon-Horsten/Horsten,-L.-(2019),-The-Metaphysics-and-Mathematics-of-Arbitrary-Objects","filePath":"Academia/Notes & Papers/Authors/Leon Horsten/Horsten, L. (2010), Having an Interpretation\nHalvorson, H. (2012), What Scientific Theories Could not Be\nBachelor Thesis\n"},"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Others/Kunen,-K.--(2011),-Set-Theory":{"slug":"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Others/Kunen,-K.--(2011),-Set-Theory","filePath":"Academia/Notes & Papers/Authors/Others/Kunen, K.  (2011), Set Theory.md","title":"Kunen, K.  (2011), Set Theory","links":["Academia/Active--and--Works/Research-Areas/Set-Theory","Academia/Active--and--Works/Bachelor/2nd-Semester/Mathematics/Lecture-Notes/Advanced-Set-Theory-(Lecture)","Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Universities/University-of-Constance","Academia/Active--and--Works/Bachelor/1st-Semester/1st-Semester","Academia/Active--and--Works/Master/5th-Semester/Forcing-(Research-Project)","Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Universities/ILLC-Amsterdam","Academia/Active--and--Works/Master/5th-Semester/5th-Semester"],"tags":[],"content":"The PDF of the book is available here..\nI worked on Set Theory and specifically on this book in two courses, first in Advanced Set Theory (Lecture) at the University of Constance during my 1st Semester and then in Forcing (Research Project) at the ILLC Amsterdam during my 5th Semester.\nThe older 1980 version is also available here."},"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Others/Russell,-G.-(2018),-Logical-Nihilism-Could-There-Be-No-Logic":{"slug":"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Others/Russell,-G.-(2018),-Logical-Nihilism-Could-There-Be-No-Logic","filePath":"Academia/Notes & Papers/Authors/Others/Russell, G. (2018), Logical Nihilism Could There Be No Logic?.md","title":"Russell, G. (2018), Logical Nihilism Could There Be No Logic?","links":["tags/3rd_Semester","tags/LMU","Academia/Active--and--Works/Bachelor/3rd-Semester/Philosophy/The-Silent-Assumption-in-Tarskian-Semantics","Academia/Active--and--Works/Bachelor/4th-Semester/Questions--and--Other-Works/First-Thesis-Concept/Mathematics-First-Thesis-Concept/Mathematics-First-Thesis-Concept"],"tags":["3rd_Semester","LMU"],"content":"I wrote those notes in response to an essay of a classmates of the class on Philosophy of Logic by A. Marra during the 3rd_Semester at the LMU. Many of the following passages are related to The Silent Assumption in Tarskian Semantics, an introduction on the distinction of object and meta language is present in the Mathematics First Thesis Concept.\nDefinability Issues with ‚ÄúPREM‚Äù and ‚ÄúSOLO‚Äù\nHere I present an argument of mine against both ‚ÄúPREM‚Äù and ‚ÄúSOLO‚Äù argument by Russel. What I claim to hold for ‚ÄúPREM‚Äù, I claim it for ‚ÄúSOLO‚Äù too.\nIn this section I argue that even if one succeeds in finding one informal proposition of the kind of ‚ÄúPREM‚Äù, it would only prove a logic to be incomplete other than inconsistent in respect to natural deduction.\nThe ‚ÄúPREM‚Äù statement, sounds to me like defining an object x in mathematics such that, x = 3 if it is sunny and x = 1 if it‚Äôs cloudy. Against the existence of such an object, or, more precisely, against the existence of the function (the interpretation in the ‚ÄúPREM‚Äù case) that maps x to either 1 or 3, I would argue that there is no proposition \\varphi in \\mathcal{L}_\\epsilon (language of mathematics, namely of ZFC for more see Wikipedia such that it is true if it is sunny and false if it is cloudy.\nAlso, I do not see why one should start the research for ‚ÄúPREM‚Äù within the natural language instead of the formal system itself. I believe that the core assumption here is that  (I): any argument valid in the natural language shall be interpreted (hence be either valid or invalid) one formal logic. Though, I am more tempted to doubt this assumption than the one that there is at least one correct logic. In fact if one is to say that (I) does not hold and (II): there is one statement, call it ‚ÄúPREM‚Äù that is true iff. it is a premise, then it may still be the case that it does not get mapped to any formal statement. On the other hand, I could think of several arguments that many hold for true in some informal ways but that, on a formal level, lose any of their validity (not that they are invalid, but simply cannot be written in the language). Considering the former example, I could informally correctly state that if x = 3 then it is sunny, though the formal value of this statement would be the same as the one of random characters. On the other hand I see that one may wish to have at least one logic such that (I) holds, namely a ‚Äúcomplete logic‚Äù.\nNow, it might be the case that the author agrees that the refusal of (I) is equivalent to logical nihilism, if that were the case, it would seem to me to be a natural conclusion. On the other hand it seems to me far weaker than the attempts of the ‚ÄúPREM‚Äù argument, since coming to the conclusion that there is one false argument in any logic, like \\varphi \\models \\varphi instantiated on ‚ÄúPREM‚Äù, would prove any logic to be false (i.e. inconsistent with informal deduction) instead of simply being incomplete in respect to informal deduction. And, arguably, one prefers incompleteness over inconsistency (the same choice one has in the G√∂delian Incompleteness Theorem).\nI believe that the argument I exposed in this section is highly influenced by the Tarskian Semantics and mostly by the distinction of meta- and object-language, I would therefore claim the informal statements to be metalinguistic and the formal ones to be in the object language, and I find it totally normal to have some arguments that are true at the meta level but not expressible in the object-language. For instance, ‚Äúthis is a false statement‚Äù is such a statement, it cannot be phrased in the object language but can be defined only through a deeper analysis of the truth predicate (which takes place in the meta level).\n\n02.06.2024: After reasoning on the paper and discussing it, I got the impression that I didn‚Äôt really understand it."},"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Others/Tait,-W.-W.-(1981).-Finitism":{"slug":"Academia/Notes--and--Papers/Authors/Others/Tait,-W.-W.-(1981).-Finitism","filePath":"Academia/Notes & Papers/Authors/Others/Tait, W. W. (1981). Finitism.md","title":"Tait, W. W. (1981). The analysis is based on Italian legal requirements for habitability and planned renovations, as detailed in our reference notes on Agibilit√†, Abitabilit√† e la Destinazione d‚ÄôUso. The goal is to ensure transparency and compliance in our accommodation offerings.\n\n\n\nOverall Summary:\n\nTotal Current Capacity: 3 Bedrooms / 7 Beds\nTotal Potential Capacity (Post-Renovation): 6-7 Bedrooms / 14-15 Beds\nThe timeline for achieving these goals is outlined in the Calendar.\n\nOne should take into account that this involves not all the Ville Chiappella but only Casa del Noce and Casa del Forno excluding for now the Casa del Caco.\nMethodological Notes\nPost-Assignment Flexibility: Once a resident is formally assigned a bed in a legally compliant room, they may request to move to a different private space for personal reasons. This is subject to discussion and requires explicit permission from the founder. This internal flexibility will only be considered after the initial, formal room assignment is completed.\nRoom Count\nCasa del Noce\n\n\nTotal Summary: PLANIMETRIA FG 29 MAPP 519 SUB 6.pdf\n\nCurrent Status:\n\nHabitable Bedrooms: 1\nCurrent Beds: 1\n\n\nPotential Status (post-renovation):\n\nTotal Bedrooms: 4 (1 current + 3 new)\nTotal Beds: 5 (1 current + 4 new)\n\n\n\n\n\nGround Floor\n\nWoodshead:\n\nStatus: Not habitable, currently used as storage.\nDimensions: 19.70 m¬≤, height 2.20 m.\nPotential: Designated as potential personal accommodation for the founder. Not counted in the guest bed total.\nRequired Works for Habitability: Excavation to increase height; enlargement of existing small windows.\n\n\n\n\n\nMunicipal Road Level\n\nStatus: Not habitable, currently registered as cellar and storage.\nNotes: This area has the structural height to become habitable. It will be used by the founder as personal accommodation until work is complete.\nPotential (after change of use and renovation):\n\n2 Single Rooms:\n\nSize: 9.70 m¬≤ each.\nHeight: 2.80 m.\nBeds: 1 per room (Total: 2).\n\n\n1 Double Room:\n\nSize: 14.40 m¬≤.\nBeds: 2.\n\n\n1 Bathroom:\n\nSize: 5.10 m¬≤ (converted from a ‚Äúsmall room‚Äù).\n\n\n\n\nLogistics: The two single rooms will share an entrance; the double room will have a separate entrance. Important Note: This unit will not have a dedicated internal kitchen.\n\n\n\nFirst Floor\n\nStatus: Partially habitable, with a separate entrance.\nCurrent and Functional Rooms:\n\n1 Bedroom:\n\nStatus: Already registered and used as a bedroom.\nSize: 12.8 m¬≤.\nHeight: 2.20 m.\nBeds: 1 (being &lt; 14 m¬≤). Configured as a private room.\n\n\n1 Kitchen:\n\nSize: 10.7 m¬≤.\nUse: Will be shared.\n\n\n1 Bathroom:\n\nStatus: Current and functional.\n\n\n\n\nAttic (connected to this floor):\n\nHeight: ~1.90 m (average).\nDesignated Use: Common area for sporadic, non-continuous use. Can be set up with desks for flexible work, especially when outdoor spaces are unavailable. Cannot be a legal office or habitable room.\n\n\n\n\n\nCasa del Forno\n\n\nTotal Summary:\n\nCurrent Status:\n\nHabitable Bedrooms: 2\nCurrent Beds: 6 (1 in Room 1 + 5 in Room 2)\n\n\nPotential Status (post-renovation):\n\nTotal Bedrooms: 2-3 (depending on the reconfiguration of Sub. 6)\nTotal Beds: 9-10 (2 in Room 1 + 5 in Room 2 + 2/3 in Sub. 6)\n\n\n\n\n\nSubalterno 5 PLANIMETRIA FG 29 MAPP 440 SUB 5.pdf\n\nFirst Floor:\n\nStatus: Partially habitable apartment with a functional bathroom.\nRooms:\n\nKitchen: 6 m¬≤.\nRoom 1 (Single/Potential Double):\n\nCurrent Size: 13.10 m¬≤ (1 bed).\nPotential: Will be extended to 14 m¬≤ (taking space from the kitchen) to become a double room (2 beds).\n\n\nRoom 2 (Dormitory):\n\nCurrent Size: 27.1 m¬≤ + a small attached room, for a functional total of approx. 29 m¬≤.\nBeds: 5 beds (calculated as 14m¬≤ for the first 2 + 5m¬≤ for each of the next 3).\n\n\n\n\nNon-habitable rooms:\n\nHayloft: 18.3 m¬≤, height 2.30 m. Not considered for residential use.\nCellar (second basement floor): 18.3 m¬≤, height 2.45 m.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSubalterno 6 PLANIMETRIA FG 29 MAPP 440 SUB 6.pdf\n\nStatus: Not habitable in its current condition. Complete renovation, including the installation of all systems (electrical, plumbing, heating) and finishes.\n\n\n\nOther Units (Subalterno 7 and Forno)\n\nSubalterno 7: The rooms (cellars and storage) are already considered in the analysis of other subalterns and do not constitute separate units.\nForno (Oven): A structure dedicated to an outdoor kitchen and wood-fired oven, not relevant for calculating bed capacity.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesto documento fornisce una panoramica chiara e strutturata della capienza attuale e potenziale di stanze e posti letto per le propriet√† di Ville Chiappella. The property consists of a main residential building, a separate utility building (‚ÄúThe Oven‚Äù), and appurtenant lands.\n\nLocation: Str. Chiappella, 19 | Google Maps | Coordinates: 44¬∞24‚Äô11.2‚ÄùN 8¬∞15‚Äô13.5‚ÄùE\nMain Residential Building - Particella 440\nThis is the larger of the two houses. The structure is a mix of stone and brick, but it is well-plastered, with straight walls and no obvious structural issues. The windows need to be replaced.\nSubalterno 5\n\nLand Registry: Foglio 29, Particella 440, Sub. 5\nSurface Area: 96 m¬≤\nRooms: 5.0 vani\nFloor Plan: PLANIMETRIA FG 29 MAPP 440 SUB 5.pdf\nLayout Description: A kitchen will be located at the current entrance. There is a mid-size bedroom (13.10 m¬≤) that needs to be slightly expanded to 14 m¬≤ to legally qualify as a double bedroom. To the left, a large living room can either be kept as a shared space or be converted into a large dormitory with bunk beds.\nBathroom: The bathroom is accessed via stairs from the living room. It is in good condition and is expected to be one of the first operational bathrooms on the property.\n\nSubalterno 6\n\nLand Registry: Foglio 29, Particella 440, Sub. 6\nSurface Area: 79 m¬≤\nRooms: 5.0 vani\nFloor Plan: PLANIMETRIA FG 29 MAPP 440 SUB 6.pdf\nLayout Description: This apartment is in decent condition. It features a small kitchen at the entrance, followed by three bedrooms in a row. The plan is for the last room to be a private bedroom, while the other two will be shared. The size of the private room must be verified to ensure it meets the requirements for a double bedroom.\nBathroom: A critical issue is the lack of a directly connected bathroom. With a surface area of over 4,000 m¬≤, its primary potential lies in forestry (firewood) and strategic utility installations (5G antenna), rather than agriculture.\n\n\n\n\nLocation: Google Maps | Coordinates: 44.399902, 8.255036\nLand Registry: Foglio 46, Particella 200 (Total Area: 4,410 m¬≤)\n\n\n\nDescription and Potential Use\nThis property consists of a single large plot (Particella 200, 4,410 m¬≤), which is steep and heavily wooded. It is located at the source of a stream‚Äîthe very one that flows into the larger stream near our house. However, due to the direction of the current, water from this source flows away from our main property.\n\nPotential Uses:\n\n5G Antenna Installation: The high ground could be interesting for installing a 5G internet antenna to get a faster connection in the valley. However, it‚Äôs unclear if the signal is actually better there; this needs to be tested.\nFirewood Harvesting: The land can be used as a source of firewood. Transporting the wood would be a challenge as there is no vehicle access. It could potentially be moved by hand or by using the stream during high water for smaller logs. Once the wood reaches the main stream, it would flow away from the house but could be collected further down along Str. Chiappella and transported the final distance with a vehicle.\nAgricultural Use: The northwest-facing slope provides non-optimal sun exposure, making it unsuitable for most agricultural purposes.\n\n\n\nLegal Strategy and Surrounding Plots\nThis area is promising for applying Usucapione (Adverse Possession) due to the low number of nearby buildings.\n\nKey Plots of Interest:\n\n224 &amp; 199: Large adjacent plots that could serve as a bordering forest for additional firewood or for as-yet-unknown Supplementary Projects.\n130, 306 &amp; 129: Strips of land that follow the stream down towards the valley.\n211 &amp; 212: An interesting cleared spot located slightly higher up. The reason for the clearing is unknown, but it could be a potential camping area.\n\n\n\nRisks and Verifications\n\nIdentified Risks: The steepness of the terrain and the presence of water sources mean that hydrological and landslide risks must be verified.\nVerification Status: I have not yet personally visited the site.\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesto documento descrive i Terreni alla Fonte, un ampio appezzamento scosceso e boschivo situato alla sorgente di un torrente. Due to their flat nature and proximity to water, these lands have been officially designated as the grazing and management area for the horses residing at ColivingLiguria.\n\n\n\n\nLocation: Google Maps | Coordinates: 44¬∞24‚Äô07.7‚ÄùN 8¬∞15‚Äô10.6‚ÄùE\nLand Registry: Foglio 46, Particelle 104 &amp; 105 (Total Area: 1,240 m¬≤)\n\n\nDescription and Potential Use\nThe property consists of two agricultural plots:\n\nParticella 104 (600 m¬≤): Half of it is woodland, offering potential for wood harvesting.\nParticella 105 (640 m¬≤): Already cleared of wood.\n\nBeing flat and close to the stream, these lands are particularly suitable for agricultural purposes and grazing. They are the designated home for the horses of the ColivingLiguria community. Upcoming work will focus on preparing this area to safely host the animals. You can read the detailed preparation plan on the Terrain Setup Plan page.\nBuildability (CDU Verification): According to the CDU 2025/102, these lands fall under Zone E (Agricultural).\n\nResidential Construction: Excluded due to the ANI-MA classification.\nAgricultural Construction: Permitted with a low land utilization index (Uf=0.03 mq/mq). This allows for small agricultural structures, such as shelters for the horses or tool sheds, subject to specific project approval.\n\nAccess and Connection Strategies\nAccess to these plots presents some logistical challenges that we plan to address during the Terrain Setup Plan phase.\n\nVehicle Access: The municipal road (Str. Chiappella) leads towards the stream but ends near plot 106, which is not owned by us. We need to verify the possibility of accessing our lands (104 &amp; 105) by passing directly through plot 106.\nConnection for Horses: To connect the grazing area (104 &amp; 105) with the main property, we are exploring a path along the stream bank. The goal is to create a route that leads from these plots directly to Particella 522, the land situated right in front of Casa del Noce. This would allow for easier management of the animals.\n\nRisks and Verifications\n\nPre-emption Rights: These lands are likely subject to Agricultural Pre-emption Rights. We are currently investigating this risk.\nHydrological Risk: Official hydrological risk assessments are pending. However, empirical observation during the major flood of September 2025 showed no apparent damage to these lands.\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesto documento delinea le caratteristiche dei Terreni oltre Torrente, due lotti agricoli situati oltre il torrente. Questa scelta √® stata ponderata e si basa su diversi fattori chiave che hanno reso questo fornitore la soluzione ideale per le nostre esigenze.\nIn primo luogo, un confronto diretto delle tariffe ha evidenziato come i prezzi di Octopus fossero particolarmente competitivi e inferiori rispetto a molti altri operatori sul mercato. Oltre al vantaggio economico, siamo stati positivamente colpiti dalla reputazione e dalle recensioni generali trovate online. Il feedback degli utenti √® in larga parte eccellente, lodando in particolare la trasparenza e la qualit√† del servizio clienti, un aspetto per noi fondamentale.\nUn contributo significativo alla nostra decisione √® arrivato seguendo le analisi di esperti del settore. Potete trovare il video a questo link: La Fine del Mercato Tutelato, come scegliere il NUOVO GESTORE LUCE!.\nInfine, abbiamo optato per una combinazione di tariffe che si adatta alla nostra filosofia di gestione. Abbiamo scelto sia la tariffa multioraria, che distingue i consumi in diverse fasce orarie (F1, F2, F3) con prezzi differenti, sia la tariffa a prezzo variabile (o indicizzato). Abbiamo ritenuto che il sovrapprezzo richiesto per bloccare una tariffa fissa non fosse giustificato. Preferiamo assumerci un rischio maggiore legato alle fluttuazioni del mercato, con l‚Äôobiettivo di ottenere una spesa complessivamente inferiore nel lungo periodo.\nPer poter procedere con l‚Äôattivazione, √® stato necessario recuperare i codici POD dei contatori, dato che non erano disponibili vecchie bollette. Abbiamo seguito la procedura indicata sul sito di E-Distribuzione, compilando e inviando il modulo apposito in qualit√† di comodatari. √à importante sottolineare che, sebbene al momento della richiesta il nostro accordo fosse solo verbale (formula prevista e valida dal codice civile), questo √® stato sufficiente per attestare il nostro diritto. Non √® stato quindi necessario l‚Äôintervento del proprietario per recuperare i codici. Ho seguito perci√≤ le istruzioni come sul sito di e-distribuzione.\nPurtroppo ho scoperto adesso che octupus non si occupa di subetri quindi devo trovare un altro subentro per fare in modo. Ho pagato quindi tramite enel 35 euro per ciascuno dei due contatori per poter attivare l‚Äôenergia elettrica e ho fatto il tutto tramite il consuleten concetto di Facile.it tramite una chiamta questo il 25 agosto nel pomeriggio, si spera che l‚Äôattivazione possa avvenire a bree e poi che io possa direttamente appena fatta l‚Äôattivazione optare per il subentro con octopus energy che non ha costo di attivazione (uan votla gia attivati i contatori)\n\nSe non fosse gi√† ovvio dalla nostra minuscola dimensione mediatica, questo non √® un annuncio pagato ma solo un feedback onesto sulla nostra esperienza."},"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/Deletion-of-the-Open-Groupchat":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/Deletion-of-the-Open-Groupchat","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/Deletion of the Open Groupchat.md","title":"Deletion of the Open Groupchat","links":["ColivingLiguria/People/Organisation/Whatsapp-Community","ColivingLiguria","ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/Ethics-of-ColivingLiguria"],"tags":[],"content":"--- Italiano sotto ---\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nThis document outlines a strategic change to the Whatsapp Community structure. Due to challenges with high notification volume and potential risks associated with a fully open forum in a rapidly growing community, the main public group is being restructured. The new model prioritises clear communication through an announcement-only channel, while fostering focused discussion in a new, invite-only group for active members.\n\n\n\nI first drafted this note on September 22nd, and after careful consideration, I have concluded today, September 29th, that this is the right course of action. Therefore, the existing Open Group will be permanently deleted by the end of today.\nThis decision is based on two significant risks that have become apparent as the community has grown. Firstly, the community now has over 150 members. In a large group chat, a high volume of notifications can be disruptive, leading interested members to leave. We have already seen this pattern whenever the number of messages increases. An open forum is not sustainable for maintaining a large, engaged audience.\nSecondly, an open group presents a more serious risk. As our numbers grow, we will inevitably attract individuals who may be critical of the ColivingLiguria project or its Ethics of ColivingLiguria. An open chat provides them with a platform to easily reach everyone, which could cause reputational damage without context.\nFor these reasons, the structure is changing. All new members will join the community‚Äôs announcement channel directly. All essential information will be shared there, ensuring important news reaches everyone without spam.\nIn place of the old open group, a new, separate, invite-only Discussion Group will be created. This will allow members to chat and share ideas freely, without the worry that excessive messaging could reduce the community‚Äôs overall size.\nThe other groups within the Whatsapp Community will remain unchanged for now, though it is likely we will add new chats in the near future to distinguish between the different villas.\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesto documento descrive una modifica strategica alla struttura della Whatsapp Community. A causa delle sfide legate a un volume elevato di notifiche e ai potenziali rischi associati a un forum completamente aperto in una comunit√† in rapida crescita, il gruppo pubblico principale viene ristrutturato. Il nuovo modello d√† priorit√† a una comunicazione chiara attraverso un canale di soli annunci, promuovendo al contempo una discussione mirata in un nuovo gruppo solo su invito per i membri attivi.\n\n\n\nHo redatto una prima bozza di questa nota il 22 settembre e, dopo un‚Äôattenta riflessione, ho concluso oggi, 29 settembre, che questa sia la giusta linea d‚Äôazione. Pertanto, l‚Äôattuale Gruppo Aperto sar√† eliminato definitivamente entro la fine della giornata di oggi.\nQuesta decisione si basa su due rischi significativi che sono diventati evidenti con la crescita della comunit√†. In primo luogo, la comunit√† conta ora oltre 150 membri. In una chat di gruppo cos√¨ grande, un volume elevato di notifiche pu√≤ essere fastidioso, portando i membri interessati ad andarsene. Abbiamo gi√† osservato questo schema ogni volta che il numero di messaggi aumenta. Un forum aperto non √® sostenibile per mantenere un pubblico vasto e coinvolto.\nIn secondo luogo, un gruppo aperto presenta un rischio pi√π serio. Con l‚Äôaumentare del numero di iscritti, attireremo inevitabilmente persone che potrebbero essere critiche nei confronti del progetto ColivingLiguria o della sua Ethics of ColivingLiguria. Una chat aperta offre loro una piattaforma per raggiungere facilmente tutti, il che potrebbe causare un danno reputazionale senza un contesto adeguato.\nPer queste ragioni, la struttura sta cambiando. Tutti i nuovi membri entreranno direttamente nel canale annunci della comunit√†. Tutte le informazioni essenziali saranno condivise l√¨, garantendo che le notizie importanti raggiungano tutti senza spam.\nAl posto del vecchio gruppo aperto, verr√† creato un nuovo Gruppo di Discussione separato e solo su invito. Ci√≤ consentir√† ai membri di chiacchierare e scambiare idee liberamente, senza la preoccupazione che una messaggistica eccessiva possa ridurre le dimensioni complessive della comunit√†.\nGli altri gruppi all‚Äôinterno della Whatsapp Community rimarranno per ora invariati, anche se √® probabile che in futuro aggiungeremo nuove chat per distinguere tra le diverse ville."},"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/Private-Camp-Site-Regulations":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/Private-Camp-Site-Regulations","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/Private Camp Site Regulations.md","title":"Private Camp Site Regulations","links":[],"tags":[],"content":""},"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/Purchasing-DIY-Tools":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/Purchasing-DIY-Tools","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/Purchasing DIY Tools.md","title":"Purchasing DIY Tools","links":[],"tags":[],"content":"List of purchased items:\n\nMetro\nAspirapolvere\nFor now only these two, which I ordered today on the 26th of August and are going to arrive by amazon up here on the 28th.\n\nProject &amp; Procurement Notes\n1. Laser Level\nInitially, the plan was to acquire a self-levelling laser level. A suitable model, the Huepar Self-Levelling Laser, was identified on Subito, complete with a tripod, and the aim was to negotiate a purchase price of approximately ‚Ç¨25, including shipping. The inspiration for its use came from this YouTube video.\nHowever, upon further consideration, I have decided to postpone this purchase. For the immediate interior work, a standard spirit level placed on the floor will suffice to check for level, and a tape measure will be adequate for all other requirements. A laser level is not deemed essential at this stage, though it may prove useful for future landscaping projects, such as levelling the garden.\n2. Heavy-Duty Vacuum Cleaner\nThe intention is to purchase a Lavor Freddy 1200W Wet &amp; Dry Vacuum Cleaner with a 20L tank. This machine is intended for heavy-duty cleaning tasks involving both solids and liquids, rather than for daily use. For routine cleaning, a Roomba will be acquired at a later date. Unfortunately, the specific second-hand unit I was monitoring has been sold, so the search will continue for another. Penso quindi di optare per prendere questo: amzn.eu/d/2abeV7B, da 16L 1200W mi costa il doppio ma almeno lo prendo su amazon cosi se ci fossero problemi si pu√≤ fare il reso.\n3. Concrete &amp; Microcement Projects\nI am exploring the creation of concrete countertops and outdoor furniture, inspired by this YouTube tutorial. The video highlights a significant challenge: the specialised countertop concrete mix used in the US is not readily available in Italy. Alternative solutions present their own difficulties:\n\nFibre-reinforced concrete is recommended to prevent shattering but is prohibitively expensive (approximately ‚Ç¨19 per 25kg bag).\nRapid-set cement is a slight improvement over standard cement but is not ideal.\n\nA more viable approach suggested is to use a finishing cement plaster over a timber base. However, this requires carpentry skills to build the underlying structure, which I feel falls outside my current expertise if the entire structure relies on it.\nTherefore, the most practical solution seems to be applying a microcement finish to existing surfaces. This technique is demonstrated very effectively in this tutorial. My plan is to modify the existing kitchen structure according to my design and then apply microcement to the countertop. To ensure it is durable and smooth enough for kitchen use, I will finish it with a protective resin, as shown in the original video. This same microcement technique could potentially be applied to other surfaces, such as doors, perhaps without the final resin coat."},"ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Carpenter":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Carpenter","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/People/Openings/Roles/Carpenter.md","title":"üß± Carpenter Wanted for ColivingLiguria","links":["ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Location","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Casa-del-Noce","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Casa-del-Forno","ColivingLiguria/Rules/Regulations/Risorse-Umane/Risorse-Umane-per-la-Ristrutturazione","Contract-for-Residents","ColivingLiguria/Financials/Public-Financial-Aid/FESR-Azione-1.3.3.-EU-Grant","ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Supplementary-Projects/Supplementary-Projects","ColivingLiguria/System/Contact"],"tags":[],"content":"‚Äîitaliano sotto‚Äî\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nWe are looking for a skilled Carpenter or craftsperson to take a leading role in the renovation of Location. This is a foundational, hands-on role with work starting immediately. We offer a highly flexible partnership: you can join as a resident, be hired as a formal contractor, or‚Äîour preferred option for a long-term partner‚Äîearn equity and co-ownership in the buildings you help restore.\n\n\n\nThe renovation of Casa del Noce and Casa del Forno is beginning now, and we are looking for a key person to lead the hands-on work. This is one of the most critical roles in the entire project.\nThe Role: Hands-On Renovation Lead\nYour mission will be to take charge of all or part of the renovation.\n\nYou will work with the plans from our architect and interior designer.\nYou will also have significant freedom to propose your own designs and practical solutions to bring the vision to life.\nThis is not just ‚Äúcommunity help‚Äù; this is skilled, extraordinary maintenance, as defined in our Human Resources for Renovation policy.\n\nCompensation Models: A Flexible Partnership\nThis role requires a formal agreement, and we have three possible paths:\n\n\nCore Resident\nYou can join the community as a resident, contributing your skills in exchange for free or heavily reduced rent. Your stay will be formalised with a Contract for Residents.\n\n\nPaid Contractor (Registered Company)\nTo receive direct monetary payment for your work, you must operate as a legally registered company (ditta edile). This is a strict legal requirement in Italy. You (or your company) must be able to:\n\nBe registered in Italy (or have a foreign company registered here).\nHandle all Italian bureaucracy, including paying for INAIL (workplace injury insurance).\n\n\n\nEquity Partner (Our Preferred Option)\nFor a candidate committed to a long-term, on-site partnership, we are particularly inclined to offer remuneration in the form of equity (a portion of ownership) in the properties themselves. This is perhaps the clearest case in our entire project for this type of partnership. For this case the same requirements listed for the previous option apply.\n\n\nWhat We Provide\n\nMaterial Costs &amp; Retribution: All costs for materials and construction will be covered by the project, supported by our FESR Azione 1.3.3. EU Grant grant.\nCommunity: A vibrant place to live and work, surrounded by interesting people. You will also have full accesso to all the Supplementary Projects.\n\nOther Opportunities\n\nDIY Courses: You can earn additional income by hosting paid DIY or carpentry courses for our residents, who are very interested in learning. This can be run as your own Supplementary Projects.\n\nHow to Apply\nThis is urgent. The renovation is starting immediately. Italiano sotto ‚Äî\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nWe are looking for an entrepreneurial and creative Farmer to take charge of our agricultural production. This role has immense freedom, from managing vegetable gardens to planting orchards and raising livestock. We offer flexible models: work as a resident for free rent, build your own business by selling produce, and for long-term partners, a path to co-ownership of the land itself.\n\n\n\nAt ColivingLiguria, our extensive outdoor spaces are managed by three distinct, synergistic roles:\n\nGardener: Focuses on the aesthetic and leisure gardens around the houses.\nWoodland Steward: Manages our wild forests for creative projects and sustainable resources.\nFarmer (This Role): Focuses on production‚Äîgrowing food, managing livestock, and creating agricultural value from our lands.\n\nThe Vision: Your Farm, Your Creativity\nThis role requires a high degree of creativity and autonomy. You will largely decide what to do and how to do it. You will set your own goals, in dialogue with the project‚Äôs needs.\nYour ‚Äúfields‚Äù are varied and full of potential:\n\nVegetable Gardens: Start with the existing orticello (small garden) at Casa del Forno and expand into new plots, like the large garden at Casa del Noce.\nAgricultural Land: The flat, streamside plots of Terreni oltre Torrente are perfect for larger-scale cultivation of vegetables or other crops.\nForests &amp; Orchards: Our woodlands (Terreni Lungotorrente, etc.) are ideal for planting fruit and nut trees or for sustainable firewood harvesting.\nLivestock: We are especially interested in proposals that involve raising livestock. We have the space and are excited to support a partner willing to manage this long-term.\n\nSynergies &amp; Support\n\nThe Cook: You will work in close synergy with our future Cook to supply the Coliving kitchen with fresh, on-site produce.\nRegulations: For any project (especially livestock), you must adhere to local regulations. The founder, Simone Testino, will personally assist with all bureaucratic matters and translate all necessary rules into English to be consulted on this site, so we can develop the project together.\n\nCompensation &amp; Business Models\nWe offer multiple, flexible pathways for this role:\n\nCore Resident Model: You can live at Location with free or heavily reduced rent, managing the farm as your primary contribution to the community under a Contract for Residents.\nIndependent Business (Model A): Use your own VAT number (Partita IVA). You can earn income by:\n\nSelling produce to residents or local markets.\nCreating internal agreements and synergies (e.g., selling directly to the Cook‚Äôs budget).\n\n\nLong-Term Equity (In Addition): For individuals who commit to a long-term plan (especially for livestock or perennial crops), we offer a path to co-ownership of the agricultural lands you manage.\n\nOwnership of Products: The ownership of the crops and livestock is also flexible. Depending on the contract we stipulate together, they can be 100% yours (if you run an independent business) or shared between you and ColivingLiguria.\nThe Ideal Candidate\n\nHighly creative, autonomous, and self-motivated.\nExperienced in agriculture, permaculture, or livestock management.\nWe strongly prefer candidates with long-term plans, especially those involving livestock.\nA collaborative spirit, excited to work with the Cook and other land managers.\nPrepared for the rustic, in-progress renovation environment at Location.\nEnglish is required; Italian is a plus.\n\nHow to Apply\nTo apply, please send an email to colivingliguria@gmail.com with:\n\nYour CV and a motivation letter.\nA Concept Proposal: This is essential. Following the Propose a Project guidelines, send us a brief document with your initial ideas for the farm.\n\nContacts\nFor an informal first chat, feel free to contact me (Simone Testino):\n\nEmail: colivingliguria@gmail.com\nWhatsApp: +39 339 637 9372\nInstagram: @colivingliguria\n\nSee our Contact page for more details.\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nStiamo cercando un Agricoltore (Farmer) imprenditoriale e creativo che si faccia carico della nostra produzione agricola. Questo ruolo ha un‚Äôimmensa libert√†, dalla gestione degli orti alla piantumazione di frutteti e all‚Äôallevamento di bestiame. As the founder, Simone Testino, I am building ColivingLiguria as an ecosystem to launch new ventures. We offer space, resources, and support for you to join one of our startups (like Luna), or launch your own independent company from our hub.\n\n\n\nAs the founder, Simone Testino, I am actively working on building an environment that serves as a launchpad for like-minded entrepreneurs. We offer a unique opportunity to live and work in Liguria while benefiting from a structured support system. We welcome collaborators in two primary ways:\n1. Join Our In-House Startup: Luna\nWe are actively seeking co-founders and collaborators for our flagship technical startup, Luna, which has received funding through the FESR Azione 1.3.3. EU Grant. For individuals who wish to dedicate significant skills to this project, we offer highly advantageous terms, including potentially free accommodation at Coliving Liguria.\nWhat is Luna?\nLuna solves the inefficiencies of traditional light towers used on construction sites and at events. It is a large, spherical, helium-filled aerostatic balloon containing powerful LEDs, providing wide, diffuse, and energy-efficient illumination from a high vantage point (10-25 metres).\n\nWe are looking for individuals with skills in engineering, electronics, and business development.\n\n2. This role is primarily offered as a Core Resident position (in exchange for accommodation) due to the high volume of interest. We strongly prefer candidates who can start as soon as possible to help shape the project from its foundational stage.\n\n\n\nThe renovation of Location is starting now, and we need a clear design direction. While the main structural work begins, we need someone with a vision for the interiors, even if final furniture choices will be made progressively.\nThe Role: Defining Our Home\nYour primary mission will be to create the complete interior design project for our two main properties:\n\nCasa del Noce\nCasa del Forno\n\nThis includes planning layouts, defining the aesthetic, choosing materials, and creating a cohesive atmosphere.\nYou will also have the opportunity to collaborate with other key roles to shape the project‚Äôs overall brand:\n\nWith the Gardener on the flow between indoor and outdoor leisure spaces.\nWith the Social Media Manager and Photographer to ensure the design is visually compelling and aligned with our brand.\n\nCompensation Models\nWe are looking for the right person and vision, but it is important to be transparent about our preferences.\n\n\nPreferred Model: Core Resident\nDue to the high volume of applications we are already receiving for this role, our strong preference is for a candidate willing to join us as a Core Resident. In this model, you contribute your design expertise in exchange for free or heavily reduced rent, formalized with a Contract for Residents.\n\n\nExceptional Cases\nIn rare and exceptional cases, we may consider:\n\nPaid Contract (VAT/Partita IVA): For a registered professional or firm requiring direct payment.\nEquity Partnership: As discussed in our other Openings, a long-term profit-sharing agreement or a path to co-ownership of the property.\n\n\n\nThe Ideal Candidate\n\nA proven portfolio in interior design is essential.\nTiming: We strongly prefer candidates who can start as soon as possible.\nYou are excited by the challenge of designing for a rustic, co-living environment.\nYou are a great collaborator, ready to work with the founder and other creative roles.\nYou are prepared to live in a dynamic, in-progress renovation project at Location.\n\nHow to Apply\nThis position is receiving a lot of interest. This is a unique opportunity to create a new MTB destination right next to the world-famous Finale Ligure and build your own guiding business from our coliving hub.\n\n\n\nColivingLiguria is located a short drive from the Finale Outdoor area, a global hotspot for mountain biking. From spring to autumn, thousands of riders come to Finale from all over the world. We have a unique opportunity to create our own trail network on the hillsides and forests surrounding our properties, like Terreni oltre Torrente, Terreni alla Fonte and Terreni Lungotorrente.\nWe are looking for an entrepreneurial individual to take charge of this project. The role has two main parts: designing and building the trails, and just as importantly, building a business as an MTB guide for our residents and for new guests you bring to the coliving.\nThe Mission: Trail Builder &amp; MTB Guide\nYour role is to develop this new venture from the ground up.\n\nTrail Design &amp; Building:\n\nScout, design, and plan a network of Enduro/Downhill trails on the hillside available to us.\nThe top of the hill is accessible by car, making it ideal for shuttle-assisted runs.\nWe will work with you to secure all necessary permits for the land.\n\n\nGuiding &amp; Business Development:\n\nAct as the resident MTB guide for ColivingLiguria guests.\nMarket and attract new guests (riders) to stay at our coliving, who will then be your clients for guided tours.\nDevelop packages (e.g., ‚ÄúStay &amp; Ride‚Äù) in collaboration with us.\n\n\n\nBusiness Model &amp; Earning Potential\nThis is your business. We provide the land, accommodation, and a base of potential clients; you build the enterprise.\n\nModel: This will be run as your own independent business (Model A from Propose a Project), where you rent resources from us at a minimal cost and keep the profits from your guiding services.\nYour Income: Your revenue will come directly from the guests you guide. You will have the freedom to set your prices and packages.\nFuture Investment: As this project grows, we have the possibility to use our European funding to co-invest in necessary equipment, such as a fleet of rental bikes or tools.\n\nWhat We Offer\n\nLand &amp; Location: An entire hillside with forest, accessible by car, ready for development. All this, located right next to the Finale Ligure MTB mecca.\nTools &amp; Resources:\n\nAll necessary planning and design tools.\nAvailability of an Enduro bike (the owner‚Äôs, Simone Testino) for you to use.\n\n\nAccommodation:\n\nWe offer you a free or heavily reduced rent for a room (private or shared) at Location.\nThis will be formalized with a Contract for Residents, ensuring your stay is legally sound.\n\n\nCommunity &amp; Network: A vibrant community of international remote workers and volunteers, providing an instant customer base and a great living environment.\n\nThe Ideal Candidate\n\nProven experience in trail design and construction (please provide a portfolio).\nCertified MTB guide qualifications.\nEntrepreneurial mindset, motivated to build a business from scratch.\nGood knowledge of the MTB market, especially the Finale Ligure scene.\nSociable, community-oriented, and ready to live in a rustic, hands-on renovation environment at Location.\nGood level of English is required to communicate with our international guests.\n\nHow to Apply\nTo formally apply, please send an email to colivingliguria@gmail.com with the following:\n\nYour CV and a motivation letter.\nA portfolio of trails you have designed or built.\nA copy of your MTB guide certifications.\nAny initial ideas or a concept proposal for the project.\n\nContacts\nFor an informal first chat, feel free to contact me (Simone Testino):\n\nEmail: colivingliguria@gmail.com\nWhatsApp: +39 339 637 9372\nInstagram: @colivingliguria\n\nSee our Contact page for more details.\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nStiamo cercando un Mountainbike Trail Designer e Guida esperto per sviluppare una rete di sentieri Enduro/Downhill sulla nostra propriet√†. This role is a blank canvas for someone to develop unique projects, from creating nature oases to new business ventures. This is a resident-based position offering free or reduced rent, with a long-term path to potential equity in the woodlands themselves.\n\n\n\nThis is not a typical land management role. At ColivingLiguria, our outdoor spaces are managed by three distinct roles:\n\nFarmer: Focuses on agriculture and food production.\nGardener: Focuses on the aesthetic and leisure gardens around the houses.\nWoodland Steward (This Role): Focuses on the creative and sustainable development of our wilder, forested lands.\n\nThe Vision: A Blank Slate for Our Woods\nWe are looking for someone to take ownership of our forests, primarily the Terreni Lungotorrente (‚ÄúLands Along the Stream‚Äù), Terreni alla Fonte (‚ÄúLands at the Source‚Äù), and Terreni oltre Torrente (‚ÄúLands Beyond the Stream‚Äù).\nAs their names suggest, these properties are rich with water sources (‚Äúrigoli d‚Äôacqua‚Äù or rivulets). This role has the most creative freedom and ‚Äúcarta bianca‚Äù of any position at ColivingLiguria. We want you to be inventive, set your own goals, and unlock the potential of these lands.\nKey Project Areas (Examples of Your Mission)\n\nWater Features: Creatively manage and lightly shape the natural streams and water sources to create ‚Äúluoghi ameni‚Äù‚Äîpleasant, cool spots for relaxation just a short walk from the house.\nCreative Spaces: In synergy with the Farmer, design and build unique resources in the woods:\n\nSmall, hidden offices for remote workers.\nCreative areas for artists (meditation platforms, land art).\n\n\nResource Management:\n\nSustainably harvest resources like chestnuts.\nExplore potential for raising livestock.\n\n\nCollaboration: Work closely with the Mountain Bike Guide &amp; Trail Designer to ensure trails are integrated beautifully and sustainably into the forest.\nExpansion: Your creativity is our engine for growth. If we find successful, sustainable applications for our woods, we will look to acquire more and expand this part of the project.\n\nCompensation &amp; Business Model\nThis opportunity is offered primarily as a resident-based position.\n\nAccommodation: We offer heavily reduced or null rent for a place at Location, formalized with a Contract for Residents.\nLong-Term Partnership: This role is crucial for our long-term vision. For the right person who commits to the project, we offer a unique compensation path: the opportunity to gain equity and co-ownership of the woodlands themselves.\nFreedom: You will be a full member of the community, free to participate in (or propose) any other Supplementary Projects.\n\nProcess &amp; Collaboration\nWhile you have creative freedom, all projects must be developed transparently and in synergy with the founder, Simone Testino. You will be expected to follow the formal process outlined on our Propose a Project page to bring your ideas to life.\nThe Ideal Candidate\n\nHighly creative, inventive, and self-motivated. You are comfortable setting your own goals.\nYou have a passion for nature, ecology, and sustainable land use.\nSkills in permaculture, forestry, land art, or landscape design are a huge plus, but we value creativity and vision above all.\nA collaborative spirit, ready to work with the Farmer and MTB Guide.\nPrepared for a rustic, in-progress renovation environment at Location.\nEnglish is required; Italian is a plus.\n\nHow to Apply\nTo apply, please send an email to colivingliguria@gmail.com with:\n\nYour CV and a motivation letter.\nA Concept Proposal: This is the most important part. Following the Propose a Project guidelines, send us a brief document with your initial ideas for our woodlands.\n\nContacts\nFor an informal first chat, feel free to contact me (Simone Testino):\n\nEmail: colivingliguria@gmail.com\nWhatsApp: +39 339 637 9372\nInstagram: @colivingliguria\n\nSee our Contact page for more details.\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nStiamo cercando un Curatore dei Boschi (Woodland Steward) creativo e ricco di inventiva per gestire i nostri terreni boschivi. Questo ruolo √® una ‚Äúcarta bianca‚Äù per chiunque voglia sviluppare progetti unici, dalla creazione di oasi naturali a nuove iniziative imprenditoriali. √à una posizione basata sulla residenza che offre affitto gratuito o ridotto, con un percorso a lungo termine verso una potenziale quota di propriet√† dei boschi stessi.\n\n\n\nQuesto non √® un tipico ruolo di gestione del territorio. It outlines the different requirements‚Äîfrom simple sign-ups to contracts and deposits‚Äîand clarifies where to find specific details (on the event page) and who to ask for help (the Event Organisation Team).\n\n\n\nWhere to Find Registration Details (The Most Important Step)\nBefore contacting anyone, please check the dedicated page for the specific event you are interested in.\nAt the bottom of every event page, you will find a clear ‚ÄúHow to Register‚Äù section. This will state:\n\nWhat category the event falls into (see below).\nThe exact steps to register.\nThe cost, if any (some events are free, some have a fee).\nThe required deposit amount, if any.\nWhich version of the Contract for Events you need to sign.\n\nEvent Requirement Categories\nEvents fall into different categories based on their size and nature.\n\nOpen Events: Very rare. Open to everyone, no registration needed.\nRegistration Required: Open, but you must register (e.g., so we know numbers for a free workshop).\nRegistration + Contract: Requires registration and signing the Contract for Events.\nRegistration + Contract + Deposit: This is the standard for most mid-sized and major events. It requires all three steps.\n\nRegistration, Contracts, and Deposits\nFor most events, you will need to sign a contract and pay a deposit.\n\nContract for Events: This is a legal necessity to ensure all participants understand the rules, safety guidelines, and risks. It is a strict measure to ensure Coliving Liguria does not take on more responsibility than it can afford.\nThe Signing Process: You must follow all instructions on the contract page. You will receive the document, sign it, and return it. You will then receive a final, digitally countersigned copy from the founder, Simone Testino, via the official company email.\nThe Deposit: The deposit is a security measure. It will be held in a Coliving Liguria account for the duration of the event (and the contract‚Äôs validity) and will be paid back to you after the event, provided all rules are respected.\n\nAfter You Register: Communication\nOnce your registration is complete (including contract and deposit, if required), you will be added to a temporary, event-specific WhatsApp group.\nThis group will be part of our main Whatsapp Community structure but will be deleted after the event has ended.\nQuestions?\nIf, after reading the specific event page, you still have questions about the registration process, please contact our Event Organisation Team. They are here to help!\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta pagina spiega il processo di registrazione per un evento a Coliving Liguria. This page is the central hub for understanding our event philosophy, from our official Events Calendar and recurring Periodic Events to how you can propose your own idea.\n\n\n\nThe Heart of the Community\nEvents are a major part of life at Coliving Liguria. We believe they enhance our community, power our marketing by giving people exciting reasons to visit, and are, most importantly, a lot of fun. They are opportunities to connect, learn, and celebrate together.\nOur Event Calendars\nWe have two main calendars to keep you updated:\n\nThe Calendar: This is the single source of truth for everything happening soon at the project (including arrivals, construction, etc.) and is updated most frequently. This is your primary reference.\nThe Events Calendar: This calendar is focused only on events and is also updated regularly. Check it for a clear overview of all upcoming parties, workshops, and gatherings.\n\nTypes of Events\nOur events fall into two main categories:\n\nPeriodic Events: These are our recurring gatherings that provide a steady rhythm to our community life, from weekly pizza nights to large seasonal parties. You can read about all of them on our dedicated page.\nSpecial Events: These are one-off events, workshops, or activities proposed by residents or the organisation team. They will always be announced on the Events Calendar.\n\nPropose Your Own Event!\nWe are always open to new ideas! If you want to host a workshop, organize a hike, or launch a new celebration, we encourage you to propose it.\n\nHow to Propose: Please see our dedicated Propose an Event page for a full guide on what we need.\nMusic Events: Are you an artist or band? We have a special fast-track for you to play at our ‚ÄúMusic Saturday‚Äù. Check the details on the Propose a Music Event page!\nContact: You can also get in touch directly with Simone Testino.\n\nWho Can Join?\n\nInternal Residents: Residents of Coliving Liguria have access to all events.\nExternal Guests: External guests are very welcome!\n\nOpen Events: Our large seasonal events (like the Spring Party or Autumn Party) are open to everyone.\nBy Invitation/Request: For smaller community events (like the weekly Saturday Pizza Night), external guests are welcome but must ask for permission first and be approved on a personal basis.\n\n\n\nHow to Register\nNot all events are open for anyone to just show up. For organisational purposes, many events have a limited number of spots.\n\nRegistration: You must register for most events. Please follow the instructions on our Event Registration page.\nEvent Team: Our events are managed by the dedicated Event Organisation Team.\n\nFinancial &amp; Legal Policy\n\nCost Philosophy: Events are not a primary profit source for Coliving Liguria; they are for the community. They will generally be free or very cheap. However, to be sustainable, the price must cover material expenses plus a low margin to account for organisational costs (like the founder‚Äôs time or the event team). This ensures events remain a healthy and vivid part of our project.\nFinancial Models: We are open to two main models: Marketing-Driven Events (free for all, focused on community/promotion) and Financial-Driven Events (with a ticket fee). This will be defined with the founder when you propose your idea.\nLegal Framework: Events involve rules and risks. Our legal framework is built on three key contracts:\n\nContract for Event Proposals: The main agreement between the Organizer and Coliving Liguria, defining costs, responsibilities, and any profit-sharing.\nContract for Music Event Proposals: A specific version of the proposal contract for artists and bands.\nContract for Events: The agreement that all attendees (including residents and external guests) must sign to participate.\n\n\nDeposits: A small deposit may be required for external guests to secure their spot. This is not necessary for internal residents, whose main security deposit already covers them.\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nGli eventi sono un pilastro dell‚Äôesperienza a ColivingLiguria, pensati per costruire la comunit√†, promuovere la creativit√† e attrarre nuove persone. Crediamo che arricchiscano la nostra comunit√†, potenzino il nostro marketing dando alle persone motivi entusiasmanti per visitarci e, soprattutto, siano molto divertenti. Sono opportunit√† per connettersi, imparare e celebrare insieme.\nI Nostri Calendari Eventi\nAbbiamo due calendari principali per tenerti aggiornato:\n\nIl Calendar: Questa √® l‚Äôunica fonte di verit√† per tutto ci√≤ che accade a breve termine nel progetto (inclusi arrivi, lavori, ecc.) ed √® aggiornato molto frequentemente.
