Noce","links":["ColivingLiguria/System/Attachments/PLANIMETRIA-FG-29-MAPP-521.pdf","ColivingLiguria/Rules/Regulations/Regolazioni-Edili/Agibilit√†,-Abitabilit√†-e-la-Destinazione-d'Uso","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Documentation-on-Property/Certificato-di-Destinazione-d'Uso-Terreni-Chiappella","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Potential/Casa-del-Caco"],"tags":[],"content":"‚ÄîItaliano sotto‚Äî\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nConclusion on Mappale 521: The current rustic building (Mappale 521) is approximately 133 \\, \\text{m}^3. Our preliminary calculations suggest that by leveraging available building rights, we could potentially construct a new, modern house of over 419 \\, \\text{m}^3 (approx. 150 m¬≤ of internal space).\nThis is a hypothesis that depends entirely on legal and permit verifications with the municipality. Once these crucial points are confirmed, our internal team of architects, engineers, and our designer will develop the final project.\n\n\n\n\nLocation: Google Maps | Coordinates: 44.402817, 8.253551\nLand Registry: Foglio 29, Particella 521\nCategory: C/2 (Warehouse/Storage)\nSurface Area: Gross Surface Area is 54.4 m¬≤ across two floors\nFloor Plan: PLANIMETRIA FG 29 MAPP 521.pdf\nStructural Condition: The building is structurally sound and straight, with a solid base of stone and brick. The roof structure is holding up well, though some metal sheet additions need removal. The interior is in a raw state, without flooring, but the upper floor slab is rigid and in good condition.\n\n\nRenovation and Expansion Potential\nThis building is one of the project‚Äôs greatest assets. Currently, its official designation is C/2 (storage), which is not a habitable category. To transform this into a new, independent house, it must undergo a full renovation and a change of intended use (Cambio di Destinazione d‚ÄôUso), respecting all the criteria outlined in Agibilit√†, Abitabilit√† e la Destinazione d‚ÄôUso.\nThe current volume is limited and would only allow for a small apartment for ~3 people. However, we have reason to believe we can significantly expand this volume.\nVolumetric Calculations (Hypothesis)\nLet‚Äôs analyse the potential buildable volume.\n1. Current Gross Volume (V_{\\text{attuale}})\nWe can estimate the current ‚ÄúVolume Lordo‚Äù (gross volume) of the building.\n\nTotal Gross Surface Area (sum of 2 floors): 54.4 \\, \\text{m}^2\nGross Surface Area per Floor (A_{\\text{lorda\\_per\\_piano}}): 54.4 \\, \\text{m}^2 / 2 = 27.2 \\, \\text{m}^2\nGround Floor Net Height (H_{\\text{terra}}): 2.30 \\, \\text{m} (Net area 23.7 m¬≤)\nFirst Floor Net Height (H_{\\text{primo}}): 2.20 \\, \\text{m} (Net area 25.1 m¬≤)\nEstimated Slab Thickness (H_{\\text{solaio}}): 0.20 \\, \\text{m}\nEstimated Roof Thickness (H_{\\text{tetto}}): 0.20 \\, \\text{m}\n\nWe calculate the gross volume floor by floor, multiplying the gross area of that floor by its total height (net height + slab/roof).\nV_{\\text{terra}} = A_{\\text{lorda\\_per\\_piano}} \\times (H_{\\text{terra}} + H_{\\text{solaio}})\nV_{\\text{terra}} = 27.2 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times (2.30 \\, \\text{m} + 0.20 \\, \\text{m}) = 27.2 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times 2.50 \\, \\text{m} = 68.00 \\, \\text{m}^3\nV_{\\text{primo}} = A_{\\text{lorda\\_per\\_piano}} \\times (H_{\\text{primo}} + H_{\\text{tetto}})\nV_{\\text{primo}} = 27.2 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times (2.20 \\, \\text{m} + 0.20 \\, \\text{m}) = 27.2 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times 2.40 \\, \\text{m} = 65.28 \\, \\text{m}^3\nV_{\\text{attuale}} = V_{\\text{terra}} + V_{\\text{primo}} = 68.00 \\, \\text{m}^3 + 65.28 \\, \\text{m}^3 = \\mathbf{133.28 \\, \\text{m}^3}\n2. Standard 20% Expansion (V_{20\\%})\nIt is often permitted to expand an existing structure by 20% of its current volume during a major renovation.\nV_{20\\%} = V_{\\text{attuale}} \\times 0.20 = 133.28 \\, \\text{m}^3 \\times 0.20 = \\mathbf{26.66 \\, \\text{m}^3}\n\n\n                  \n                  To Be Verified \n                  \n                \n\n\nThe right to this 20% expansion is a standard assumption in Italian planning but must be verified with the municipality (Comune) for this specific building category (C/2) and zone.\n\n\n\n3. Building Rights from Mappale 522 (V_{522})\nThe Certificato di Destinazione d‚ÄôUso Terreni Chiappella states that the adjacent garden, Mappale 522, has its own building rights. We can ‚Äúuse‚Äù this volume and attach it to the new Mappale 521 building.\n\nTotal Area of Mappale 522: 1270 \\, \\text{m}^2\nArea in Zone Bp 4 (Residential @ 0.4 \\, \\text{m}^3/\\text{m}^2): 1270 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times 30\\% = 381 \\, \\text{m}^2\nArea in Zone E (Agricultural @ 0.03 \\, \\text{m}^3/\\text{m}^2): 1270 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times 70\\% = 889 \\, \\text{m}^2\n\nV_{522} = (381 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times 0.4 \\, \\text{m}^3/\\text{m}^2) + (889 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times 0.03 \\, \\text{m}^3/\\text{m}^2)\nV_{522} = 152.4 \\, \\text{m}^3 + 26.67 \\, \\text{m}^3 = \\mathbf{179.07 \\, \\text{m}^3}\n\n\n                  \n                  CRITICAL Verification \n                  \n                \n\n\nThis is our biggest assumption. We must verify with the municipality that the building rights for Mappale 522 have not already been used for the construction of Mappale 521 or other surrounding buildings. We are currently assuming they are fully available.\n\n\n\n4. Potential Transferable Rights (V_{\\text{altri\\_terreni}})\nWe may also be able to acquire building rights from other nearby parcels.\n\nMappale 515: This parcel is owned by the proprietors of Casa del Caco. We plan to acquire this parcel. Let‚Äôs assume its building rights are 15% of V_{522}.\nV_{515} = 179.07 \\, \\text{m}^3 \\times 0.15 = \\mathbf{26.86 \\, \\text{m}^3}\nMappale 517: This parcel is not ours, but we could theoretically purchase its building rights. Let‚Äôs assume its rights are 30% of V_{522}.\nV_{517} = 179.07 \\, \\text{m}^3 \\times 0.30 = \\mathbf{53.72 \\, \\text{m}^3}\n\n\n\n                  \n                  To Be Verified \n                  \n                \n\n\nThis entire section is hypothetical (‚Äúda controllare‚Äù). We must verify if (a) these parcels have any available building rights and (b) if those rights can be legally transferred (bought) and ‚Äúmoved‚Äù to our Mappale 521 project.\n\n\n\n5. Total Potential Volume (V_{\\text{totale}})\nBy summing all these potential sources, we get a hypothetical total volume for the new building.\nV_{\\text{totale}} = V_{\\text{attuale}} + V_{20\\%} + V_{522} + V_{515} + V_{517}\nV_{\\text{totale}} = 133.28 + 26.66 + 179.07 + 26.86 + 53.72\nV_{\\text{totale}} = \\mathbf{419.59 \\, \\text{m}^3}\nThis total volume is more than three times larger than the current building, allowing for a well-sized, modern house to be built (more than tripling the current gross volume).\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nConclusioni sul Mappale 521: L‚Äôattuale edificio rustico (Mappale 521) ha un volume di circa 133 \\, \\text{m}^3. I nostri calcoli preliminari suggeriscono che, sfruttando i diritti edificatori disponibili, potremmo potenzialmente costruire una casa nuova e moderna di oltre 419 \\, \\text{m}^3 (circa 150 m¬≤ di spazio interno).\nQuesta √® un‚Äôipotesi che dipende interamente da verifiche legali e autorizzative con il Comune. Una volta confermati questi punti cruciali, il nostro team interno di architetti, ingegneri e designer svilupper√† il progetto definitivo.\n\n\n\n\nPosizione: Google Maps | Coordinate: 44.402817, 8.253551\nCatasto: Foglio 29, Particella 521\nCategoria: C/2 (Magazzino/Deposito)\nSuperficie: Superficie Lorda Totale √® 54.4 m¬≤ su due piani\nPlanimetria: PLANIMETRIA FG 29 MAPP 521.pdf\nCondizioni Strutturali: L‚Äôedificio √® strutturalmente sano e dritto, con una solida base in pietra e mattoni. La struttura del tetto √® in buone condizioni, sebbene alcune aggiunte in lamiera vadano rimosse. L‚Äôinterno √® allo stato grezzo, senza pavimentazione, ma il solaio del primo piano √® rigido e in buono stato.\n\n\nPotenziale di Ristrutturazione ed Espansione\nQuesto edificio √® uno dei maggiori asset del progetto. Attualmente, la sua designazione ufficiale √® C/2 (deposito), che non √® una categoria abitabile. Per trasformarlo in una nuova casa indipendente, deve subire una ristrutturazione completa e un Cambio di Destinazione d‚ÄôUso, rispettando tutti i criteri delineati in Agibilit√†, Abitabilit√† e la Destinazione d‚ÄôUso.\nIl volume attuale √® limitato e permetterebbe solo un piccolo appartamento per circa 3 persone. Tuttavia, abbiamo motivo di credere di poter espandere significativamente questo volume.\nCalcoli Volumetrici (Ipotesi)\nAnalizziamo il volume edificabile potenziale.\n1. Volume Lordo Attuale (V_{\\text{attuale}})\nPossiamo stimare il ‚ÄúVolume Lordo‚Äù attuale dell‚Äôedificio.\n\nSuperficie Lorda Totale (somma dei 2 piani): 54.4 \\, \\text{m}^2\nSuperficie Lorda per Piano (A_{\\text{lorda\\_per\\_piano}}): 54.4 \\, \\text{m}^2 / 2 = 27.2 \\, \\text{m}^2\nAltezza Netta Piano Terra (H_{\\text{terra}}): 2.30 \\, \\text{m} (Superficie netta 23.7 m¬≤)\nAltezza Netta Piano Primo (H_{\\text{primo}}): 2.20 \\, \\text{m} (Superficie netta 25.1 m¬≤)\nSpessore Solaio Stimato (H_{\\text{solaio}}): 0.20 \\, \\text{m}\nSpessore Tetto Stimato (H_{\\text{tetto}}): 0.20 \\, \\text{m}\n\nCalcoliamo il volume lordo piano per piano, moltiplicando la superficie lorda di quel piano per la sua altezza totale (altezza netta + solaio/tetto).\nV_{\\text{terra}} = A_{\\text{lorda\\_per\\_piano}} \\times (H_{\\text{terra}} + H_{\\text{solaio}})\nV_{\\text{terra}} = 27.2 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times (2.30 \\, \\text{m} + 0.20 \\, \\text{m}) = 27.2 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times 2.50 \\, \\text{m} = 68.00 \\, \\text{m}^3\nV_{\\text{primo}} = A_{\\text{lorda\\_per\\_piano}} \\times (H_{\\text{primo}} + H_{\\text{tetto}})\nV_{\\text{primo}} = 27.2 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times (2.20 \\, \\text{m} + 0.20 \\, \\text{m}) = 27.2 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times 2.40 \\, \\text{m} = 65.28 \\, \\text{m}^3\nV_{\\text{attuale}} = V_{\\text{terra}} + V_{\\text{primo}} = 68.00 \\, \\text{m}^3 + 65.28 \\, \\text{m}^3 = \\mathbf{133.28 \\, \\text{m}^3}\n2. Espansione Standard del 20% (V_{20\\%})\n√à spesso consentito espandere una struttura esistente del 20% del suo volume attuale durante una ristrutturazione importante.\nV_{20\\%} = V_{\\text{attuale}} \\times 0.20 = 133.28 \\, \\text{m}^3 \\times 0.20 = \\mathbf{26.66 \\, \\text{m}^3}\n\n\n                  \n                  Da Verificare \n                  \n                \n\n\nIl diritto a questa espansione del 20% √® un‚Äôipotesi standard nella pianificazione italiana, ma deve essere verificata con il Comune per questa specifica categoria di edificio (C/2) e zona.\n\n\n\n3. Diritti Edificatori dal Mappale 522 (V_{522})\nIl Certificato di Destinazione d‚ÄôUso Terreni Chiappella attesta che il giardino adiacente, Mappale 522, ha diritti edificatori propri. Possiamo ‚Äúutilizzare‚Äù questo volume e annetterlo al nuovo edificio del Mappale 521.\n\nArea Totale Mappale 522: 1270 \\, \\text{m}^2\nArea in Zona Bp 4 (Residenziale @ 0.4 \\, \\text{m}^3/\\text{m}^2): 1270 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times 30\\% = 381 \\, \\text{m}^2\nArea in Zona E (Agricola @ 0.03 \\, \\text{m}^3/\\text{m}^2): 1270 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times 70\\% = 889 \\, \\text{m}^2\n\nV_{522} = (381 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times 0.4 \\, \\text{m}^3/\\text{m}^2) + (889 \\, \\text{m}^2 \\times 0.03 \\, \\text{m}^3/\\text{m}^2)\nV_{522} = 152.4 \\, \\text{m}^3 + 26.67 \\, \\text{m}^3 = \\mathbf{179.07 \\, \\text{m}^3}\n\n\n                  \n                  Verifica CRITICA \n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta √® la nostra pi√π grande supposizione. Dobbiamo verificare in Comune che i diritti edificatori del Mappale 522 non siano gi√† stati utilizzati per la costruzione del Mappale 521 o di altri edifici circostanti. Attualmente presumiamo che siano completamente disponibili.\n\n\n\n4. Diritti Trasferibili Potenziali (V_{\\text{altri\\_terreni}})\nPotremmo anche essere in grado di acquisire diritti edificatori da altre particelle vicine.\n\nMappale 515: Questa particella √® di propriet√† dei titolari di Casa del Caco. Abbiamo in programma di acquisire questa particella. Ipotizziamo che i suoi diritti edificatori siano il 15% di V_{522}.\nV_{515} = 179.07 \\, \\text{m}^3 \\times 0.15 = \\mathbf{26.86 \\, \\text{m}^3}\nMappale 517: Questa particella non √® nostra, ma potremmo teoricamente acquistarne i diritti edificatori. Ipotizziamo che i suoi diritti siano il 30% di V_{522}.\nV_{517} = 179.07 \\, \\text{m}^3 \\times 0.30 = \\mathbf{53.72 \\, \\text{m}^3}\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Da Verificare \n                  \n                \n\n\nTutta questa sezione √® ipotetica (‚Äúda controllare‚Äù). Dobbiamo verificare se (a) queste particelle abbiano diritti edificatori disponibili e (b) se tali diritti possano essere legalmente trasferiti (acquistati) e ‚Äúspostati‚Äù sul nostro progetto del Mappale 521.\n\n\n\n5. Volume Potenziale Totale (V_{\\text{totale}})\nSommando tutte queste fonti potenziali, otteniamo un volume totale ipotetico per il nuovo edificio.\nV_{\\text{totale}} = V_{\\text{attuale}} + V_{20\\%} + V_{522} + V_{515} + V_{517}\nV_{\\text{totale}} = 133.28 + 26.66 + 179.07 + 26.86 + 53.72\nV_{\\text{totale}} = \\mathbf{419.59 \\, \\text{m}^3}\nQuesto volume totale √® pi√π di tre volte pi√π grande dell‚Äôedificio attuale, permettendo la costruzione di una nuova casa di buone dimensioni e moderna (pi√π che triplicando il volume lordo attuale)."},"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/November/Attivazione-Utenze":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/November/Attivazione-Utenze","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/November/Attivazione Utenze.md","title":"Attivazione Utenze","links":["Ville-Chiappella","ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/November/Week-Before-Purchase","ColivingLiguria/People/Simone-Testino"],"tags":[],"content":"\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta pagina dettaglia lo stato e la procedura operativa per la riattivazione delle forniture essenziali (Acqua ed Elettricit√†) presso Ville Chiappella.                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta lista di controllo definisce i passaggi obbligatori da completare prima di poter far firmare legittimamente il primo contratto di locazione a un ospite. L‚Äôordine delle azioni √® propedeutico: non √® possibile procedere allo step successivo senza aver completato il precedente. I requisiti tecnici fanno riferimento al documento Adempimenti per l‚Äôavvio di Attivit√† Ricettiva.\n\n\n\nFASE 1: Adeguamento Fisico e Certificativo (La ‚ÄúCasa‚Äù)\nPrima di interagire con la burocrazia, l‚Äôimmobile deve essere fisicamente a norma.\n\n Verifica Urbanistica: Archiviare la Perizia Giurata Case Chiappella come prova formale della regolarit√† urbanistica, catastale e paesaggistica.\n Certificazione Impianti (Elettrico/Gas): Ottenere fisicamente la DiRi (Dichiarazione di Rispondenza) firmata da tecnico abilitato (ex D.M. 37/08) che attesti la sicurezza degli impianti ante-1990 (messa a terra, differenziale, ecc.).\n\nüëâ Utilizza questo brief per il tecnico: Cercasi Perito per DiRi\n\n\n Sicurezza Antincendio (L. 191/2023):\n\nüëâ Utilizza questo brief per la ditta: Cercasi Tecnico Sistemi Antincendio\n Installare rilevatori di Gas Combustibili e Monossido di Carbonio.\n Acquistare e posizionare almeno 1 estintore per piano (min. 6kg, omologato).\n Attivare il registro di manutenzione antincendio (prima visita della ditta specializzata).\n\n\n Caldaia: Verificare presenza del Libretto di Impianto aggiornato e validit√† del controllo fumi (Bollino blu).\n\nFASE 2: Preparazione Documentale (Le ‚ÄúCarte‚Äù)\nDocumenti da avere pronti in formato digitale (PDF) prima di aprire il portale SUAP.\n\n Polizza Assicurativa: Stipulare assicurazione RC Terzi specifica per attivit√† ricettiva (Affittacamere/CAV).\n Planimetria: Predisporre planimetria quotata in scala (1:100 o 1:50) con indicazione dei posti letto, firmata dal tecnico.\n Classificazione: Compilare il modulo di autoclassificazione regionale (es. assegnazione dei ‚Äúsoli‚Äù).\n Diritti di Istruttoria: Effettuare il pagamento dei diritti di segreteria al SUAP (PagoPA) e salvare la ricevuta.\n\nFASE 3: L‚ÄôAvvio Formale (La SCIA)\nDa questo momento l‚Äôattivit√† esiste legalmente.\n\n Invio SCIA: Compilare e inviare telematicamente la SCIA al SUAP del Comune di Cairo Montenotte.\n Ricevuta: Scaricare e conservare la ricevuta di protocollazione (che vale come autorizzazione immediata).\n\nFASE 4: Credenziali e Codici (Prima del Check-in)\nSenza questi codici non puoi registrare il primo ospite che entra.\n\n Alloggiati Web: Richiedere alla Questura competente le credenziali per il portale Alloggiati Web (obbligatorio per comunicare i dati degli ospiti entro 24h).\n CIN (Codice Identificativo Nazionale): Accedere alla BDSR (Banca Dati Strutture Ricettive) del Ministero del Turismo tramite SPID, integrare i dati mancanti e ottenere il CIN.\n Ross1000 (ISTAT): Richiedere credenziali alla Regione Liguria per la comunicazione dei flussi turistici.\n Imposta di Soggiorno: Registrarsi al portale del Comune (se presente) o verificare le requirements for the ‚ÄúFirst Stage‚Äù of residency at Ville Chiappella. The goal is to establish basic, functional living components (Kitchen, Bathroom, Bedrooms) that enable the community to reside on-site. This list defines the starting point, and the plan to resolve the remaining open tasks is detailed in First Week after Purchase.\n\n\n\n1. üç≥ Kitchen\nThe kitchen must have basic facilities for preparing and storing food.\n\nCooking Apparatus:\n\n Stove\n\nStatus: Woodstove available and functional for cooking.\n\n\n\n\nRefrigeration:\n\n Fridge\n\nStatus: Missing.\nAction Plan: Procure a cheap, used fridge (Budget: ‚Ç¨0-‚Ç¨300). This task is a priority, and the detailed execution plan is part of the First Week after Purchase.\n\n\n\n\nPreparation &amp; Dining:\n\n Table\n\nStatus: A clean table is available and ready to be brought to the site.\n\n\n\n\nWater Supply:\n\n Running Water\n\nStatus: Water activation procedures are underway and expected to be active from the first day of residency.\nReference: See the water activation timeline detailed in Attivazione Utenze.\n\n\n\n\nPower Supply:\n\n Working Power Outlet\n\nStatus: Electricity activation procedures are underway and expected to provide power. Must be tested on site to ensure functionality in the designated kitchen area.\n\n\n\n\n\n2. üöø Bathroom\nThe bathroom requires water, heat, and basic functionality.\n\nWater &amp; Heat:\n\n Running Water\n\nStatus: Expected to be active from the first day (See Kitchen section).\n\n\n Warm Water\n\nStatus: At least one working boiler is available and expected to provide warm water.\n\n\n\n\nFunctionality Check:\n\n Working Bathroom (Hydraulic &amp; Electrical)\n\nStatus: The most functional bathroom must be identified and tested. This is a primary task for the First Week after Purchase, as the exact best-working location is currently unknown. (Likely that at least one of the 1-3 available locations works well).\n\n\n\n\n\n3. üõèÔ∏è Bedrooms (Sleeping Quarters)\nThe sleeping quarters must ensure adequate comfort and warmth.\n\nBeds:\n\n Mattresses\n\nStatus: Air mattresses (1 meter high) will be provided, offering comfort comparable to traditional beds.\n\n\n Linen\n\nStatus: Bedsheets, covers, and necessary bedding will be provided.\n\n\n\n\nHeating:\n\n Primary Heating\n\nStatus: A functional petrol heating system is available and should ensure the house is warm enough.\n\n\n Supplementary Heating\n\nStatus: This can be combined with the available woodstoves located throughout the house for additional warmth.\n\n\n\n\n\n4. üîë Access &amp; Security\nSecurity and access arrangements for the first stage.\n\n Keys/Door Security\n\nStatus: The primary issue of door security will be temporarily resolved by simply keeping the doors open, as existing locking mechanisms do not significantly enhance safety. These activities are a key part of the Week Before Purchase operations. The primary objective is to prepare the land for the arrival of horses and to establish a functional connection between the grazing area and the main house.\n\n\n\nThe Target: Terreni oltre Torrente\nWhile most of our land is wooded and steep, the plots known as Terreni oltre Torrente (across the stream) are mostly flat. This characteristic makes them the designated area for the incoming horses.\nObjectives &amp; Tasks\n1. Boundary Identification and Marking\n\nGoal: Legal and spatial clarity. This is a key task for 27th November, dedicated to understanding the full scope, layout, and potential of all our land parcels, especially the non-appurtenant ones.\nAction: I will precisely identify where our property begins and ends. Understanding the exact layout (lay of the land) is crucial before installing any temporary fencing.\nMethod: We will use a very long, low-cost nylon ribbon to physically mark the boundaries of all our properties. This is a temporary measure until more permanent solutions are planned.\n\nNylon Ribbon: We have identified an extremely cost-effective option: 500m of 5mm red ribbon for ‚Ç¨5.21.\nEcological Alternative: For remote areas like Terreni alla Fonte and Terreni Lungotorrente, where the ribbon might remain for a long time, we are considering a natural twine. This is more expensive (approx. 3x the price) and less durable, but more ecological. Example: Natural Twine.\n\n\nNylon Ribbon Requirement Estimation:\n\nFormula: We assume each plot is square, calculate its perimeter, and multiply by 1.5 for a safety margin. (Required Ribbon = 6 \\times \\sqrt{\\text{Area}}).\nTerreni oltre Torrente (1,240 m¬≤): 6 \\times \\sqrt{1240} \\approx 212 m\nTerreni alla Fonte (4,410 m¬≤): 6 \\times \\sqrt{4410} \\approx 399 m\nCasa del Noce Garden (1,270 m¬≤): 6 \\times \\sqrt{1270} \\approx 214 m\nCasa Maggiore Land (1,000 m¬≤): 6 \\times \\sqrt{1000} \\approx 190 m\nCasa del Forno Lands (314 m¬≤): 6 \\times \\sqrt{314} \\approx 107 m\n(Note: Data for Terreni Lungotorrente and Plot 515 is pending).\nTotal Estimated: 212 + 399 + 214 + 190 + 107 = 1,122 meters\nPurchase Plan: We will purchase 3 rolls of the 500m nylon ribbon (Total: 1,500m).\nTotal Cost: 3 x ‚Ç¨5.21 = ‚Ç¨15.63\n\n\n\n3. Creating the ‚ÄúStream Path‚Äù\n\nGoal: Connection. We need a direct, walkable route between the horses and the main house.\nAction: I will clear a foot pathway that runs along the bank of the stream.\nRoute: The path will connect Terreni oltre Torrente (the horse area) directly to the garden in front of Casa del Noce. This ensures that the person caring for the horses can easily move between the living quarters and the animals without taking a long detour.\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta pagina descrive le attivit√† specifiche di preparazione del terreno previste tra il 27 novembre e il 3 dicembre. Queste attivit√† sono parte fondamentale delle operazioni della Week Before Purchase (Settimana prima dell‚ÄôAcquisto). L‚Äôobiettivo primario √® preparare il terreno per l‚Äôarrivo dei cavalli e stabilire un collegamento funzionale tra l‚Äôarea di pascolo e la casa principale.\n\n\n\nL‚ÄôObiettivo: Terreni oltre Torrente\nMentre la maggior parte dei nostri terreni √® boschiva e scoscesa, i lotti noti come Terreni oltre Torrente sono prevalentemente pianeggianti. Questa caratteristica li rende l‚Äôarea designata per i cavalli in arrivo.\nObiettivi e Compiti\n1. Pulizia e Spianamento per i Cavalli\n\nObiettivo: Trasformare il terreno incolto in un paddock sicuro e confortevole.\nAzione: Taglier√≤ l‚Äôerba alta in eccesso, rimuover√≤ i detriti e spianer√≤ il terreno irregolare dove possibile. Lo scopo √® garantire che i cavalli possano starci facilmente e in sicurezza fin dal primo giorno.\n\n2. Identificazione e Marcatura dei Confini\n\nObiettivo: Chiarezza legale e spaziale. Questo √® un compito chiave per il 27 novembre, giornata dedicata a comprendere l‚Äôintera estensione, la conformazione e il potenziale di tutte le nostre particelle di terreno, specialmente quelle non pertinenziali.\nAzione: Identificher√≤ con precisione dove inizia e finisce la nostra propriet√†. Comprendere l‚Äôesatta conformazione del terreno √® fondamentale prima di installare qualsiasi recinzione temporanea.\nMetodo: Useremo un nastro di nylon molto lungo ed economico per marcare fisicamente i confini di tutte le nostre propriet√†. Si tratta di una misura temporanea fino a quando non saranno pianificate soluzioni pi√π permanenti.\n\nNastro di Nylon: Abbiamo identificato un‚Äôopzione estremamente conveniente: 500m di nastro rosso da 5mm a 5,21 ‚Ç¨.\nAlternativa Ecologica: Per le aree remote come Terreni alla Fonte e Terreni Lungotorrente, dove il nastro potrebbe rimanere per lungo tempo, stiamo valutando uno spago naturale. √à pi√π costoso (circa 3 volte il prezzo) e meno durevole, ma pi√π ecologico. Esempio: Spago Naturale.\n\n\nStima Fabbisogno Nastro di Nylon:\n\nFormula: Ipotizziamo che ogni lotto sia quadrato, calcoliamo il suo perimetro e moltiplichiamo per 1,5 come margine di sicurezza. (Nastro Richiesto = 6 \\times \\sqrt{\\text{Area}}).\nTerreni oltre Torrente (1.240 m¬≤): 6 \\times \\sqrt{1240} \\approx 212 m\nTerreni alla Fonte (4.410 m¬≤): 6 \\times \\sqrt{4410} \\approx 399 m\nGiardino Casa del Noce (1.270 m¬≤): 6 \\times \\sqrt{1270} \\approx 214 m\nTerreno Casa Maggiore (1.000 m¬≤): 6 \\times \\sqrt{1000} \\approx 190 m\nTerreni Casa del Forno (314 m¬≤): 6 \\times \\sqrt{314} \\approx 107 m\n(Nota: Dati per Terreni Lungotorrente e Particella 515 in attesa).\nStima Totale: 212 + 399 + 214 + 190 + 107 = 1.122 metri\nPiano d‚ÄôAcquisto: Acquisteremo 3 rotoli di nastro di nylon da 500m (Totale: 1.500m).\nCosto Totale: 3 x 5,21 ‚Ç¨ = 15,63 ‚Ç¨\n\n\n\n3. Creazione del ‚ÄúSentiero del Torrente‚Äù\n\nObiettivo: Connessione. Abbiamo bisogno di un percorso diretto e percorribile a piedi tra i cavalli e la casa principale.\nAzione: Aprir√≤ un sentiero pedonale che corre lungo la riva del torrente.\nPercorso: Il sentiero collegher√† Terreni oltre Torrente (l‚Äôarea cavalli) direttamente al giardino di fronte a Casa del Noce. Questo assicura che la persona che si prende cura dei cavalli possa spostarsi facilmente tra gli alloggi e gli animali senza dover fare lunghe deviazioni.\n"},"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/November/Week-Before-Purchase":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/November/Week-Before-Purchase","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/November/Week Before Purchase.md","title":"Week Before Purchase","links":["ColivingLiguria/People/Simone-Testino","Ville-Chiappella","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Potential/Casa-Maggiore","ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/November/Attivazione-Utenze","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Location","ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Marketing/Marketing-Team","ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/November/Cercasi-Perito-per-DiRi","ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/November/Cercasi-Tecnico-Sistemi-Antincendio","ColivingLiguria/Rules/Regulations/Attivit√†-Ricettive/Necessita-Planimetria-Quotata","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Terreni-Lungotorrente","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Terreni-oltre-Torrente","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Terreni-alla-Fonte","ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/November/Terrain-Setup-Plan","ColivingLiguria/Diary/2025/Pre-Start/November/First-Week-after-Purchase","Note-sul-Geometra---Documentazione-Planimetrica"],"tags":[],"content":"‚ÄîItaliano sotto‚Äî\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nThis document outlines the planned activities and preparatory steps to be undertaken by the founder, Simone Testino, during the crucial week leading up to the definitive acquisition of Ville Chiappella on 3rd December 2025. This period, from 26th November to 2nd December, focuses on pre-acquisition tasks, site assessments, and initial preparations.\n\n\n\nPlans for 26th November (Site Visit)\nOn Tuesday, 26th November, Simone Testino will make a vital site visit to the area.\n\n09:00 - Visit to Casa Maggiore:\n\nThe day will commence with a scheduled visit to the potential new property, Casa Maggiore. This visit will involve a thorough assessment and an initial estimate of its potential for integration into the project.\n\n\nUtility Activation Procedures:\n\nThe primary objective at Ville Chiappella is to initiate the process for activating essential utilities (water and electricity).\nAction: A formal PDF document will be prepared and signed by one of the current owners. This document will grant explicit permission to activate the utilities prior to the final deed of sale, with all associated costs to be borne by Simone Testino.\nDetails: For an in-depth explanation of the steps, contacts, and potential challenges, please refer to the dedicated page: Attivazione Utenze.\n\n\nExterior Photography:\n\nA significant portion of the time will be dedicated to capturing high-quality exterior photographs of the Location properties. These visuals are crucial for the Marketing Team to begin developing compelling social media content ahead of the official opening.\nPotential: Collaboration with a friend possessing a drone could enhance the visual content, providing aerial perspectives.\n\n\n\nBureaucratic Preparation (SCIA &amp; Safety)\nWhile on-site or immediately after, we must finalize all documentation required for the SCIA (Certified Report of Commencement of Activity) to legally open the accommodation business.\n\nTechnical Certifications (DiRi):\n\nWe need to coordinate with a qualified technician to inspect the existing electrical and thermal systems.\nGoal: Obtain the DiRi (Declaration of Compliance) or a sworn appraisal certifying the safety of the systems, as required for the SCIA. See Cercasi Perito per DiRi.\n\n\nFire Safety Compliance:\n\nWe must appoint a specialized company to install the mandatory fire extinguishers and detectors.\nGoal: Ensure all fire safety equipment is in place and the maintenance registry is activated before the first guest arrives. See Cercasi Tecnico Sistemi Antincendio.\n\n\nSurveyor Documentation:\n\nWe need to work with the geometra to produce the specific quoted floor plans (1:100 scale) required for the SUAP submission, separate from the existing appraisal. See Necessita Planimetria Quotata.\n\n\n\nRemote Work &amp; Terrain Assessment (27th November - 2nd December)\nFollowing the visit, access to the houses will not be possible again until the formal signing of the deed on 3rd December. The rest of the week will be dedicated to remote work and assessment of the surrounding terrains.\n\nMarketing Content Creation:\n\nThe photographs gathered on 26th November will be sent to the Marketing Team for immediate processing and content generation.\n\n\nTerrain Inspection &amp; Documentation:\n\nFocus will shift to assessing the various land parcels associated with the project. This involves a detailed review of the three primary terrain pages:\n\nTerreni Lungotorrente\nTerreni oltre Torrente\nTerreni alla Fonte\n\n\nObjective: Following a thorough visual inspection (from the exterior), these pages will be updated with crucial information regarding their current state, estimated value, potential uses, and any initial findings.\nBoundary Tracing: A key task during the setup phase will be to trace the property boundaries for each terrain. We will use the formaps.it website, which allows us to view cadastral maps on a mobile phone and utilise its GPS position to find our location (albeit with a 5-10 metre margin of error). We will then use red ribbon to physically mark these boundaries. This will give us a clear understanding of what is ours and what is not.\nInitial Cleaning: Where feasible and non-intrusive, some preliminary cleaning or clearing of the terrains may commence during this period. I detail this further on the Terrain Setup Plan page.\n\n\n\nNext Steps: Final Acquisition (3rd December Onwards)\nThis preparatory week culminates in the signing of the notarial deed on 3rd December. Upon formal acquisition, the immediate priority will be on gaining full access to the properties and initiating the hands-on setup phase.\nFor the detailed plan concerning the immediate actions after the signature, please refer to First Week after Purchase.\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesto documento delinea le attivit√† pianificate e i passi preparatori che saranno intrapresi dal fondatore, Simone Testino, during la settimana cruciale che precede l‚Äôacquisizione definitiva di Ville Chiappella il 3 dicembre 2025. After identifying unforeseen bureaucratic complications (the need for a Judge‚Äôs authorisation), the acquiring party has proactively postponed the final deed to December 3rd, 2025, to ensure all legal requirements are successfully met and to avoid further delays.\n\n\n\nCancellation of the 7 November Deed\nIt is with great regret that the notarial deed (rogito) for the acquisition of Ville Chiappella, set for 7 November, has been cancelled.\nThis cancellation is in no way due to any reconsideration or failure on our part (the acquiring party), but is the direct result of serious and unforeseen bureaucratic failings by the sellers.\nThe Cause of the Delay: Authorisation from the Protective Judge\nOn 4 November, La Commercialista (the accountant) representing the sellers informed us of an insurmountable complication.\nLa proprietaria anziana (the elderly owner), one of the property‚Äôs co-owners, has been under the legal guardianship of an Amministratore di Sostegno (a Supporting Administrator) for about a year. L‚Äôavvocatessa (the lawyer) appointed by them confirmed that, given this situation, a formal authorisation from the Giudice Tutelare (Protective Judge) is legally required to proceed with the sale of the owner‚Äôs share.\nThis procedure was not initiated in time, as the Supporting Administrator was reportedly only informed of the deed date on 31 October.\nNew Strategy and Final Date (Update 13 November)\nThe timeline to obtain the mandatory appraisal (perizia) and the subsequent authorisation from the Judge made the previous target date of November 26th extremely tight.\nFailing to meet that deadline would have created a significant risk: the necessary postponement would have pushed the deed past the Christmas holidays, likely into mid-January 2026.\nTo eliminate this risk and ensure a definitive timeline, la parte acquirente (the acquiring party) has proactively decided to reschedule the final appointment.\n\nNew Definitive Date: The notarial deed is now confirmed for December 3rd, 2025, at 18:00 (6:00 PM) at the office of Notary Stefano Palmieri.\nConfidence Level: This new date provides the necessary buffer to complete all technical and legal steps (appraisal and Judge‚Äôs authorisation). Confidence that the acquisition will be finalised on this date is now very high.\n\nCurrent Status: Appraisal Completed (Update 22 November)\nThe mandatory Perizia Giurata Case Chiappella (Sworn Appraisal) has been successfully produced by the appointed surveyor and certified.\nWe are now awaiting the submission of this appraisal to the Giudice Tutelare (Protective Judge) responsible for the elderly owner‚Äôs legal guardianship. Once the Judge reviews the documentation and issues the formal authorisation, the final procedural obstacle will be cleared.\nThe December 3rd date remains secure, as this timeline was specifically designed to accommodate the complete Judge‚Äôs review process.\nOperational Start and Bookings\nThis new, secure date allows us to begin operations immediately following the purchase.\n\nProject Start: The founder will be able to legally reside in the houses immediately after the signature of the deed on the evening of December 3rd, allowing renovations and setup to begin.\nBookings Now Open: We are actively accepting bookings for all residents (e.g., volunteers, digital nomads) with an arrival date starting from December 3rd, 2025.\nProcedure: All new arrivals must follow the procedure outlined on the Onboarding page and sign the Contract for Residents. We are already signing these contracts, which are conditional upon the successful purchase of the houses on December 3rd.\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta pagina documenta le cause del ritardo dell‚Äôatto notarile per l‚Äôacquisizione di Ville Chiappella. A seguito dell‚Äôidentificazione di complicazioni burocratiche impreviste (la necessit√† di un‚Äôautorizzazione giudiziaria), la parte acquirente ha posticipato proattivamente l‚Äôatto definitivo al 3 dicembre 2025, per garantire il completamento di tutti i requisiti legali ed evitare ulteriori ritardi.\n\n\n\nAnnullamento dell‚ÄôAtto del 7 Novembre\nCon grande rammarico, l‚Äôatto notarile (rogito) per l‚Äôacquisizione di Ville Chiappella, fissato per il 7 novembre, √® stato annullato.\nQuesta cancellazione non √® in alcun modo dovuta a ripensamenti o mancanze da parte nostra (la parte acquirente), ma √® il risultato diretto di gravi e impreviste mancanze burocratiche da parte dei venditori.\nLa Causa del Ritardo: L‚ÄôAutorizzazione del Giudice Tutelare\nIl 4 novembre, La Commercialista che segue i venditori ci ha informato di una complicazione insormontabile.\nLa proprietaria anziana, una delle co-proprietarie dell‚Äôimmobile, √® da circa un anno sotto la tutela legale di un Amministratore di Sostegno. L‚Äôavvocatessa incaricata ha confermato che, data questa situazione, per procedere con la vendita della quota della signora √® legalmente necessaria un‚Äôautorizzazione formale da parte del Giudice Tutelare.\nQuesta procedura non era stata avviata per tempo, poich√© pare che l‚ÄôAmministratore di Sostegno sia stato informato della data dell‚Äôatto solo il 31 ottobre.\nNuova Strategia e Data Definitiva (Aggiornamento 13 Novembre)\nLe tempistiche necessarie per ottenere la perizia obbligatoria e la successiva autorizzazione del Giudice Tutelare rendevano la precedente data del 26 novembre estremamente rischiosa.\nUn eventuale fallimento nel rispettare tale scadenza avrebbe comportato un rischio significativo: il rinvio dell‚Äôatto oltre le festivit√† natalizie, con conseguente slittamento a met√† gennaio 2026.\nPer eliminare questo rischio e garantire una tempistica certa, la parte acquirente ha deciso proattivamente di riprogrammare l‚Äôappuntamento.\n\nNuova Data Definitiva: Il rogito notarile √® ora confermato per il 3 dicembre 2025, alle ore 18:00 presso lo Studio Notarile Stefano Palmieri.\nLivello di Fiducia: Questa nuova data fornisce il margine di tempo necessario per completare tutti i passaggi tecnici e legali (perizia e autorizzazione del Giudice). La fiducia nel finalizzare l‚Äôacquisizione in questa data √® ora molto alta.\n\nStato Attuale: Perizia Completata (Aggiornamento 22 Novembre)\nLa Perizia Giurata Case Chiappella obbligatoria √® stata prodotta con successo dal geometra incaricato e certificata.\nSiamo ora in attesa che questa perizia venga sottomessa al Giudice Tutelare responsabile della tutela legale della proprietaria anziana. Una volta che il Giudice avr√† esaminato la documentazione ed emesso l‚Äôautorizzazione formale, l‚Äôultimo ostacolo procedurale sar√† superato.\nLa data del 3 dicembre rimane sicura, poich√© questa tempistica √® stata specificamente progettata per permettere il completamento dell‚Äôintero processo di revisione da parte del Giudice.\nAvvio Operativo e Prenotazioni\nQuesta nuova data ci permette di avviare l‚Äôoperativit√† immediatamente dopo l‚Äôacquisto.\n\nAvvio Progetto: Il fondatore potr√† legalmente risiedere negli immobili subito dopo la firma del rogito la sera del 3 dicembre, permettendo l‚Äôinizio dei lavori di ristrutturazione e allestimento.\nPrenotazioni Aperte: Stiamo accettando attivamente prenotazioni per tutti i residenti (es. volontari, nomadi digitali) con data di arrivo a partire dal 3 dicembre 2025.\nProcedura: Tutti i nuovi arrivi devono seguire la procedura descritta nella pagina di Onboarding e firmare il Contract for Residents. Descrive l‚Äôidentificazione dei confinanti, l‚Äôuso di un software proprietario per analizzare le particelle catastali, e la generazione di una lista di 25 codici fiscali. Dettaglia infine la verifica delle qualifiche (CD/IAP) tramite visura camerale. Questo documento √® parte integrante della preparazione per l‚ÄôAtto Notarile Ville Chiappella.\n\n\n\nQuesto documento descrive la procedura di verifica eseguita in merito al Diritto di Prelazione Agraria per la compravendita degli immobili Ville Chiappella siti in Cairo Montenotte. Questa analisi √® un allegato tecnico fondamentale per la stesura dell‚ÄôAtto Notarile Ville Chiappella.\nIdentificazione e Acquisizione Dati Catastali\nLa fase iniziale di analisi √® consistita nell‚Äôidentificazione dei proprietari dei terreni confinanti. Utilizzando i servizi telematici dell‚ÄôAgenzia delle Entrate (Catasto), abbiamo ottenuto gli estratti di mappa e le visure catastali per immobile relative a tutte le particelle che confinano con i terreni oggetto di compravendita.\nQuesto include i terreni confinanti a:\n\nTerreni Lungotorrente\nTerreni oltre Torrente\nTerreni alla Fonte\nTutte le particelle classificate come pertinenze agricole delle unit√† abitative.\n\nMetodologia e Software di Analisi\nPer gestire questa complessa mappatura di relazioni tra particelle, abbiamo sviluppato un‚Äôapplicazione software proprietaria in Python, parte del Software per ColivingLiguria. Questo strumento modella ogni singola particella catastale (sia nostra che dei confinanti) come un oggetto software (CadastralParcel). Abbiamo ritrovato i codici fiscali necessari tramite il portale dell‚ÄôAgenzia delle Entrate.\nAd ogni particella vengono associati i suoi dati fondamentali, derivati dalle visure:\n\nSe √® di tipo agricolo (rilevante per la prelazione).\nSe √® una propriet√† target (una di quelle che stiamo acquistando).\nL‚Äôelenco dei codici fiscali dei suoi proprietari.\n\nIl programma esegue poi un‚Äôanalisi incrociata: identifica tutti i confinanti di ogni nostra particella agricola, filtra automaticamente i confinanti non rilevanti (ad esempio quelli non agricoli o quelli gi√† di nostra propriet√†) e genera una lista consolidata di tutti i codici fiscali unici che appartengono a proprietari di terreni agricoli confinanti.\nNel pieno rispetto della normativa sulla privacy (GDPR), i file contenenti i dati catastali sensibili e i codici fiscali dei soggetti coinvolti non sono pubblici e rimangono strettamente confidenziali.\nOutput: Al termine di questa fase, il software ha generato una lista consolidata di 25 codici fiscali unici, appartenenti ai proprietari dei terreni confinanti agricoli. Questi, per motivi di privacy, non sono pubblicati ma sono comunque presenti in Verifica Prelazione Agraria (Private).\nUtilizzo per Consulenza\nQuesto strumento software proprietario, sviluppato per questa analisi specifica, pu√≤ essere adattato ed utilizzato come parte dei servizi offerti nella mia attivit√† di consulenza Business Consultancy, per assistere clienti che necessitano di una mappatura e analisi del rischio di prelazione agraria per i loro progetti.\nVerifica delle Qualifiche Professionali\nSuccessivamente, si √® proceduto alla Verifica delle Qualifiche Professionali per i 25 codici fiscali identificati. L‚Äôobiettivo era determinare quali (e se) tra i soggetti identificati possedessero la qualifica di Coltivatore Diretto (CD) o Imprenditore Agricolo Professionale (IAP), come dettagliato nelle note sul Diritto di Prelazione Agraria.\nQuesta verifica √® stata effettuata tramite una Visura Camerale Ordinaria per ogni singolo codice fiscale, utilizzando il portale ufficiale registroimprese.it. Come previsto, la ricerca per codice fiscale ha permesso di identificare immediatamente i soggetti non iscritti (per i quali non sussiste il diritto), e di acquistare la visura solo per i casi in cui la ricerca dava esito positivo.\nEsito della Verifica e Conclusioni Operative\nTramite visureinrete.it possiamo verifichiamo l‚Äôesistenza di ditte con denominazione identica o simile al nome e cognome dei proprietari. Questo introduce un margine di incertezza dato che un certo proprietario potrebbe avere una ditta, magari non individuale, e che quindi non ha come denominazione il proprio nome. Non essendoci per√≤ alcun codice fiscale di Persona Giuridica, possiamo gi√† escludere che ci siano IAP e concentrare la ricerca su CD, i quali sono tipicamente ditta individuale e avrebbero quindi come denominazione il nome e cognome della persona fisica."},"ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Events/Music-Events/Music-Events":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Events/Music-Events/Music-Events","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business Segments/Events/Music Events/Music Events.md","title":"Music Events","links":["ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Events/Music-Events/Music-Events","ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Events/Periodic-Events/Periodic-Events","ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Events/Events-Calendar","ColivingLiguria/Rules/Policies/Contracts/Active-Contracts/Contract-for-Music-Event-Proposals","How-to-get-here","ColivingLiguria/Advertising/Social-Media/Social-Media","ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Marketing/Marketing-Team","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Casa-del-Noce","ColivingLiguria/Houses/Chiappella/Properties/Terreni-oltre-Torrente","ColivingLiguria/People/Team/Event-Organisation-Team","ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Events/Event-Registration","Music-Events-at-ColivingLiguria"],"tags":[],"content":"‚Äî Italiano sotto ‚Äî\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nThis internal document outlines the strategy for Music Events, a key recurring event. It details the operational framework for ‚ÄúMusic Saturday,‚Äù the two collaboration models (Marketing-Driven and Financial-Driven), and the logistical resources we will deploy, including venues, transport, and team collaboration.\n\n\n\n1. The ‚ÄúMusic Saturday‚Äù Concept\nThe ‚ÄúMusic Saturday‚Äù is a new cornerstone of our Periodic Events calendar. The concept is to create a recurring, high-quality live music event to build community and generate significant marketing exposure.\n\nFrequency: We will reserve the first Friday and Saturday of every month on the Events Calendar as the dedicated ‚ÄúMusic Saturday‚Äù slot.\nNature: This is a ‚Äúspecial‚Äù periodic event. It only happens if an artist or band successfully proposes their concert and books the slot. We can host several bands over the two-day period.\nGoal: The primary goal is marketing and community building. For small bands, we offer a complete package (venue, promotion, accommodation, transport) in exchange for their performance, which benefits them and our community.\n\n2. The Two Collaboration Models\nEvery concert, regardless of the model, is governed by a Contract for Music Event Proposals. This contract will specify the terms based on one of these two models:\nModel 1: The Marketing-Driven Concert (Free Event)\nThis is our preferred model. The event is completely free for all attendees, including external guests.\n\nThe Band Receives:\n\nFree use of the venue, stage, and sound system.\nFree accommodation for the band (up to 4 members) for the night of the event.\nFree transport for the band and their instruments from Cairo Montenotte (Station).\nFull promotion of the event across all Coliving Liguria Social Media channels, managed by our Marketing Team.\n\n\nThe Band Gives:\n\nTheir performance.\nCollaboration with our Marketing Team (e.g., providing media, cross-posting).\n\n\nFinancials: The band cannot charge a ticket fee or sell merchandise in a way that implies a mandatory purchase.\n\nModel 2: The Financial-Driven Concert (Ticketed Event)\nThis model applies if the artist/band has a financial expectation or wishes to charge an entry fee for external guests.\n\nRules:\n\nResidents Attend Free: All registered Coliving Liguria residents must be allowed to attend for free.\nTicketed Guests: A ticket fee can be charged only to external guests.\n\n\nFinancials: The Contract for Music Event Proposals will clearly define the financial split. Coliving Liguria will retain a percentage of the ticket sales to cover our costs (use of space, utilities, team organisation time).\nServices: The band still receives free accommodation and transport from the station, as in Model 1.\n\n3. Venues &amp; Logistics\nAll concerts are weather-dependent. If the weather is bad, the event must be rescheduled.\n\nMain Venues: We have two large outdoor spaces suitable for concerts:\n\nCasa del Noce Garden: The 1,270 m¬≤ garden (Particella 522) in front of the main house.\nTerreni oltre Torrente: The 1,240 m¬≤ of flat agricultural land across the stream (Particelle 104 &amp; 105).\n\n\nWhat We Provide (All Models):\n\nThe physical stage/performance area.\nA full PA system (speakers and mixer).\nFree accommodation for the band (up to 4 members).\nVehicle transport for the band and their instruments from the Cairo Montenotte (Station) to the coliving facility.\n\n\nWhat the Band Provides:\n\nAll their personal instruments (guitars, keyboards, etc.).\n\n\nFuture Plans: In the future, we aim to have more ‚Äúhouse instruments‚Äù (e.g., a drum kit, amps) available on-site.\n\n4. Team Collaboration\nThis event is a collaboration between three teams:\n\nThe Artist/Band: Provides the performance and media content.\nEvent Organisation Team: Manages all logistics, guest Event Registration, and on-site coordination.\nMarketing Team: This is the key value driver. This team works with the band to maximise social media exposure for both the artist and Coliving Liguria.\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesto documento interno delinea la strategia per gli Music Events at ColivingLiguria, un evento ricorrente chiave. Dettaglia il quadro operativo per il ‚ÄúSabato in Musica‚Äù, i due modelli di collaborazione (basato sul Marketing e basato sulla Finanza) e le risorse logistiche che impiegheremo, incluse location, trasporti e collaborazione tra team.\n\n\n\n1. Il concetto √® creare un evento di musica dal vivo ricorrente e di alta qualit√† per costruire la comunit√† e generare una significativa esposizione mediatica.\n\nFrequenza: Riserveremo il primo venerd√¨ e sabato di ogni mese sul Calendario Eventi come slot dedicato al ‚ÄúSabato in Musica‚Äù.\nNatura: Si tratta di un evento periodico ‚Äúspeciale‚Äù. Italiano sotto ‚Äî\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nThis page outlines the periodic events that form the backbone of community life at ColivingLiguria. It details our hierarchy of recurring events‚Äîfrom major annual festivals to weekly gatherings. For specific dates, schedules, and one-off special events, please always consult our master Events Calendar, which is updated most frequently.\n\n\n\nThe Rhythm of Community Life\nAt Coliving Liguria, we structure our community life around a series of periodic events. These create a predictable rhythm, offering regular opportunities for celebration, connection, and fun. Our events are organised in a hierarchy: the less frequent the event, the larger its scale.\n\nYearly Events: Major traditional festivals.\nSeasonal Events: Large, themed parties to welcome externals.\nMonthly Events: Mid-sized community activities.\nWeekly Events: Small, regular social gatherings.\n\nThis page serves as a guide to what you can expect. Alongside these, we will also host Special Events, which are non-periodic and will be announced on the Events Calendar as opportunities arise.\nPropose Your Own Event\nWe highly welcome proposals for new events! If you have an idea, please follow the official process on our Propose an Event page. You can also get in touch with the Event Organisation Team or Simone Testino with your questions.\nYearly Events\nThese are our celebrations of major Western festivities, re-interpreted with a Coliving Liguria spirit. We focus on community activities and creating shared experiences. Each of these events has a dedicated page for more details.\n\nNew Year üéâ: Welcoming the new year together.\nChristmas üéÑ: A communal celebration with our own traditions.\nEaster üê£: Celebrating spring and renewal.\nHalloween üéÉ: A creative and spooky gathering.\nUniversity Start Event üéì: An event held around the start of the academic year, organised in collaboration with the University of Genoa, aimed at welcoming students.\n\nSeasonal Events\nThese are our largest signature events, designed to bring new people into our community. During these periods, accommodation is often offered for free or at a significant discount to welcome external guests. The dates are flexible and change each year; please check the individual event pages and the Events Calendar for this year‚Äôs schedule.\n\nWinter Party üî•: Our biggest event, lasting one week (end of Jan/beginning of Feb). We focus on outdoor activities, warmed by a large bonfire in the garden in front of Casa del Noce.\nSpring Party üå∏: A 3-5 day event in the second half of March to celebrate nature‚Äôs return.\nSummer Party ‚òÄÔ∏è: A 3-5 day event held in June to kick off the summer.\nAutumn Party üçÇ: A 3-5 day event at the end of November, focusing on harvest and indoor cosiness.\n\nMonthly Events\n\nMusic Saturday üéµ: We are introducing ‚ÄúMusic Saturday‚Äù as our recurring monthly live music slot, scheduled for the first Friday and Saturday of every month.\n\nNote: This is a special periodic event. It is not guaranteed and only happens if a musician, band, or artist successfully applies to perform.\nSeasonal: This event is also seasonal, taking place primarily in Spring, Summer, and Autumn when the weather is good for our outdoor stages.\nGet Involved: Are you an artist? We provide the stage, sound system, transport, and free accommodation. Read all the details on our Propose a Music Event page!\n\n\n\nWeekly Events\nThese are our small, consistent gatherings that anchor the community‚Äôs social life.\n\nSaturday Pizza Night üçï: Every Saturday evening, we fire up the wood oven to cook and enjoy pizzas together, outdoors or indoors depending on the weather.\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta pagina delinea gli eventi periodici che costituiscono la spina dorsale della vita comunitaria a ColivingLiguria. Dettaglia la nostra gerarchia di eventi ricorrenti, dai grandi festival annuali agli incontri settimanali. Per date specifiche, orari ed eventi speciali una tantum, si prega di consultare sempre il nostro Events Calendar principale, che viene aggiornato pi√π frequentemente.\n\n\n\nIl Ritmo della Vita Comunitaria\nA Coliving Liguria, la vita comunitaria √® strutturata attorno a una serie di eventi periodici. Questi creano un ritmo prevedibile, offrendo opportunit√† regolari per celebrare, connettersi e divertirsi. Led by our professional Cook, it‚Äôs a chance to learn how to make real Italian pizza, share a meal in the garden of Casa del Noce, and connect with all the residents.\n\n\n\nOur Weekly Community Tradition\nEvery Saturday evening, we host our most important social event: the Pizza Night. It‚Äôs a fun, hands-on tradition where we all come together to make and eat authentic Italian pizza.\nThe Food &amp; The Process\nThis isn‚Äôt just any pizza. We are led by our professional Cook, who prepares the dough and ingredients. We use the large, traditional wood-fired oven located in front of Casa del Forno to get the perfect result.\nHow to Join: The Weekly Plan\nParticipation is easy, but requires a little planning:\n\nEvery Tuesday: The Cook will send a poll to the In Loco üè° group chat.\nThe Poll: In the poll, you must confirm if you are joining and select your pizza. There are always multiple options, including guaranteed vegetarian and vegan choices.\nThe Deadline: You must confirm your choice by Friday at 12:00 (12:00 PM).\nWhy the deadline? After this time, the Cook will buy the fresh ingredients and begin preparations based on the exact number of orders. No changes can be made after this point.\n\nTimeline &amp; Helping Out\nThe meal is a group effort, and all help is encouraged!\n\n15:00 - 16:00 (3:00 PM - 4:00 PM): The Cook begins the main preparations.\nFrom 16:00 (4:00 PM) onwards: Residents are welcome (and encouraged!) to come and help. You can learn how to stretch the dough, prepare toppings, or help set the tables. Please text the Cook if you plan to come early.\n19:00 (7:00 PM): The meal begins! We eat together at the long tables in the main garden of Casa del Noce.\n22:30 (10:30 PM): Official event end. By this time, everyone is expected to have helped clean up. All communal dishes and areas must be clean and tidy. A designated person will be responsible for ensuring this happens. Guests can stay longer, but they are then responsible for their own items and cleaning up after themselves.\n\nThis event is the heart of our community life, and we expect all residents to take part, not just in eating, but in the fun of preparing and cleaning up together.\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nLa ‚ÄúSaturday Pizza Night‚Äù (Pizza Night del Sabato) √® il nostro principale evento comunitario settimanale. We have the solution. This page outlines our exclusive offer for horse owners: a dedicated facility, a beautiful riverside paddock, and a community that welcomes you both.\n\n\n\nA Home for You and Your Horse\nAt ColivingLiguria, we don‚Äôt just accept pets; we build for them. We are creating a unique environment where you can live, work remotely, and keep your horse right on your doorstep.\nThe Facilities: Comfort &amp; Technology\nThe Paddock\nYour horse will reside on the Terreni oltre Torrente, a beautiful, flat riverside plot of 1,240 m¬≤. This area is dedicated to grazing and free movement, ensuring your animal has ample space to thrive.\n\nExpansion Potential: We have a concrete plan to significantly expand this flat terrain if demand increases, potentially tripling the available grazing area.\n\nThe Shelter\nWe are constructing a dedicated Horse Shelter to ensure maximum comfort in all seasons.\n\nWinter: The structure will be fully enclosed and insulated to protect against the cold.\nSummer: A forced ventilation system will keep the shaded areas cool and airy.\nTechnology: The stable will be energy-autonomous (solar panels) and connected to the internet, featuring internal cameras so you can monitor your horse from your room.\n\nCapacity &amp; Demand\n\nCurrent Limit: To ensure the highest quality of life and compliance with regulations, our current capacity is strictly limited to 3 Horses.\nHigh Demand: We already have bookings for the upcoming season. If you are interested, you must let us know well in advance. Last-minute requests are unlikely to be accommodated.\n\nActivities &amp; Lifestyle\nLiving here means more than just stabling. It defines the responsibilities, deliverables, and compensation for organising events at the Coliving Liguria facilities.\nScope of Services\n\nPlanning and coordination of events (cultural, educational, recreational).\nManaging logistics, permits, and compliance with local regulations.\nEnsuring safety, accessibility, and alignment with community values.\nReporting outcomes and post‚Äëevent evaluation.\n\nCompensation\nCompensation will be defined per event based on scope, duration, and resources required. Payments are made upon successful completion and approval of the event deliverables.\nTimeline\n\nPre‚Äëqualification (Before Geometra registration): Initial event concept and feasibility study (estimated 10‚ÄØhours).\nPost‚Äëqualification (After Geometra registration): Detailed planning, permits, and execution (estimated 30‚ÄØhours).\n\n\nNote: The total estimated hours will be summed and reflected in the payment schedule.\n\nSignatures\n\nSigned by the authorised representatives of both parties."},"ColivingLiguria/Rules/Policies/Contracts/Active-Contracts/Contract-for-Event-Proposals":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/Rules/Policies/Contracts/Active-Contracts/Contract-for-Event-Proposals","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/Rules/Policies/Contracts/Active Contracts/Contract for Event Proposals.md","title":"Contract for Event Proposals","links":["/","ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Events/Propose-an-Event","ColivingLiguria/People/Simone-Testino","ColivingLiguria/Rules/Policies/Contracts/Passive-Contracts/Contract-for-Events","ColivingLiguria/Advertising/Social-Media/Social-Media","ColivingLiguria/Financials/Business-Segments/Events/Event-Registration","ColivingLiguria/Rules/Policies/Contracts/Contracts"],"tags":["contracts","event","proposal"],"content":"\n\n                  \n                  Contract Status \n                  \n                \n\n\nContract Type: P01\nStatus: ‚úÖ Active\nLast Updated: 2025-11-25\n\n\n\n‚Äî Italiano sotto ‚Äî\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nThis page outlines the process for establishing a Contract for Event Proposals at ColivingLiguria. It establishes clear priority rules and conflict resolution mechanisms when a person is bound by more than one agreement simultaneously.\n\n\n\nWhat is the Master Contract?\nWhen a single person has multiple active contracts with ColivingLiguria (for example, a resident who is also working as a Geometra partner), conflicts or contradictions between those contracts may arise. The Master Contract serves as the ultimate reference document that defines:\n\nPriority Hierarchy: Which contract takes precedence when rules conflict\nConflict Resolution: How to resolve contradictions between different agreements\nCumulative Obligations: How obligations from multiple contracts combine\nTermination Cascades: What happens to other contracts if one is terminated\n\nPriority Hierarchy\nWhen multiple contracts apply to the same person, the following priority order is enforced:\n\nActive Contracts (role-based partnerships) take priority over Passive Contracts\nAmong Active Contracts, the most recent takes precedence\nPassive Contracts (client/guest agreements) are subordinate\nSpecific clauses override general clauses in all cases\n\nExample\nIf someone is both a Resident (Passive - L01) and a Social Media Manager (Active - S01), and there‚Äôs a conflict about work hours or payment terms, the Active Contract (S01) takes precedence.\nConflict Resolution Mechanisms\nWhen a contradiction arises between two or more contracts:\n\nExplicit Superseding Clause: If one contract explicitly states it supersedes another, that clause wins\nMost Restrictive Rule Applies: For obligations and prohibitions, the most restrictive version applies\nMost Favorable to Individual: For rights and benefits, the most favorable version applies\nJudicial Interpretation: In case of ambiguity, Simone Testino or designated legal counsel provides binding interpretation\n\nCumulative Obligations\nWhen obligations from multiple contracts stack:\n\nDeposits: Deposits are cumulative. If you have a L01 deposit of ‚Ç¨500 and a G01 deposit of ‚Ç¨1000, total deposit held is ‚Ç¨1500\nRestrictions: The strictest restriction from any contract applies to all activities\nDeadlines: The earliest deadline applies if multiple contracts have conflicting timelines\n\nTermination Cascades\nWhen one contract is terminated:\n\nIndependent Contracts: Terminating a Passive Contract does not automatically terminate an Active Contract\nDependent Contracts: Some Active Contracts may require a Passive Contract as a precondition (this will be stated explicitly)\nBreach Propagation: A serious breach of any contract may trigger termination of all contracts at the sole discretion of Simone Testino\n\nLegal Framework\nThe Master Contract concept is based on:\n\nItalian Contract Law (Codice Civile, Articles 1321-1469)\nGeneral Principles of Contract Interpretation (Articles 1362-1371)\nSupremacy of Written Agreements over verbal understandings\n\nImportant Notes\n\n\n                  \n                  No Automatic Protections \n                  \n                \n\n\nHaving multiple contracts does NOT provide additional protection against termination. Each contract stands on its own terms, and breach of any single contract may result in termination of ALL contracts.\n\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Single Signature Authority \n                  \n                \n\n\nThe Master Contract framework is enforced by the sole signatory authority of Simone Testino. His interpretation is final unless challenged in court.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nIl Master Contract √® un quadro legale superiore che governa la relazione tra pi√π contratti contemporanei sottoscritti dalla stessa persona presso ColivingLiguria. Stabilisce chiare regole di priorit√† e meccanismi di risoluzione dei conflitti quando una persona √® vincolata da pi√π accordi simultaneamente.\n\n\n\nCos‚Äô√® il Master Contract?\nQuando una singola persona ha pi√π contratti attivi con ColivingLiguria (ad esempio, un residente che lavora anche come partner Geometra), possono sorgere conflitti o contraddizioni tra quei contratti. Il Master Contract funge da documento di riferimento finale che definisce:\n\nGerarchia di Priorit√†: Quale contratto ha la precedenza quando le regole sono in conflitto\nRisoluzione dei Conflitti: Come risolvere le contraddizioni tra accordi diversi\nObbligazioni Cumulative: Come si combinano gli obblighi derivanti da pi√π contratti\nEffetti a Cascata della Risoluzione: Cosa succede agli altri contratti se uno viene risolto\n\nGerarchia di Priorit√†\nQuando pi√π contratti si applicano alla stessa persona, viene applicato il seguente ordine di priorit√†:\n\nI Contratti Attivi (partnership basate su ruoli) hanno priorit√† sui Contratti Passivi\nTra i Contratti Attivi, il pi√π recente ha la precedenza\nI Contratti Passivi (accordi con clienti/ospiti) sono subordinati\nLe clausole specifiche prevalgono sulle clausole generali in tutti i casi\n\nEsempio\nSe qualcuno √® sia un Residente (Passivo - L01) che un Social Media Manager (Attivo - S01), e c‚Äô√® un conflitto su orari di lavoro o termini di pagamento, il Contratto Attivo (S01) ha la precedenza.\nMeccanismi di Risoluzione dei Conflitti\nQuando sorge una contraddizione tra due o pi√π contratti:\n\nClausola di Sostituzione Esplicita: Se un contratto dichiara esplicitamente di sostituire un altro, quella clausola prevale\nSi Applica la Regola Pi√π Restrittiva: Per obblighi e divieti, si applica la versione pi√π restrittiva\nPi√π Favorevole all‚ÄôIndividuo: Per diritti e benefici, si applica la versione pi√π favorevole\nInterpretazione Giudiziale: In caso di ambiguit√†, Simone Testino o il consulente legale designato fornisce un‚Äôinterpretazione vincolante\n\nObbligazioni Cumulative\nQuando gli obblighi di pi√π contratti si accumulano:\n\nDepositi: I depositi sono cumulativi. Se hai un deposito L01 di ‚Ç¨500 e un deposito G01 di ‚Ç¨1000, il deposito totale trattenuto √® ‚Ç¨1500\nRestrizioni: La restrizione pi√π severa di qualsiasi contratto si applica a tutte le attivit√†\nScadenze: La scadenza pi√π vicina si applica se pi√π contratti hanno tempistiche contrastanti\n\nEffetti a Cascata della Risoluzione\nQuando un contratto viene risolto:\n\nContratti Indipendenti: La risoluzione di un Contratto Passivo non risolve automaticamente un Contratto Attivo\nContratti Dipendenti: Alcuni Contratti Attivi possono richiedere un Contratto Passivo come precondizione (questo sar√† dichiarato esplicitamente)\nPropagazione della Violazione: Una violazione grave di qualsiasi contratto pu√≤ innescare la risoluzione di tutti i contratti a sola discrezione di Simone Testino\n\nQuadro Legale\nIl concetto di Master Contract si basa su:\n\nDiritto Contrattuale Italiano (Codice Civile, Articoli 1321-1469)\nPrincipi Generali di Interpretazione dei Contratti (Articoli 1362-1371)\nSupremazia degli Accordi Scritti rispetto agli intendimenti verbali\n\nNote Importanti\n\n\n                  \n                  Nessuna Protezione Automatica \n                  \n                \n\n\nAvere pi√π contratti NON fornisce protezioni aggiuntive contro la risoluzione. Ogni contratto vale per i propri termini, e la violazione di un singolo contratto pu√≤ risultare nella risoluzione di TUTTI i contratti.\n\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Unica Autorit√† di Firma \n                  \n                \n\n\nIl sistema del Master Contract √® applicato dall‚Äôunica autorit√† firmataria di Simone Testino. La sua interpretazione √® definitiva salvo ricorso in tribunale.\n\n\n"},"ColivingLiguria/Rules/Policies/Contracts/Passive-Contracts/Contract-for-Developer-Access":{"slug":"ColivingLiguria/Rules/Policies/Contracts/Passive-Contracts/Contract-for-Developer-Access","filePath":"ColivingLiguria/Rules/Policies/Contracts/Passive Contracts/Contract for Developer Access.md","title":"Contract for Developer Access","links":["ColivingLiguria/System/Software/Software-for-ColivingLiguria"],"tags":["contracts","software","privacy"],"content":"Contract for Developer Access\n\n\n                  \n                  Contract Status \n                  \n                \n\n\nContract Type: D01\nStatus: üìã On Request\nLast Updated: 2025-11-27\n\n\n\nThis document outlines the Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) required for any developer or technical contributor who wishes to access the private Coliving Liguria GitHub repository.\nPurpose\nThe primary purpose of this contract is to ensure the strict confidentiality and security of the sensitive data contained within our codebase.\nKey Protections\nThe contract explicitly covers the protection of:\n\nBusiness Secrets: Internal strategies, financial models, and operational data.\nPersonal Data: Private information regarding residents, applicants, and partners (GDPR compliance).\nIntellectual Property: Proprietary software and custom tools developed for the community.\n\nRequirements\nBefore being granted access to the repository, every contributor must:\n\nReview the full legal text of this agreement.\nSign the document                  \n                  Contract Status \n                  \n                \n\n\nContract Type: H01\nStatus: üìã On Request - Will be created when needed\nLast Updated: 2025-11-15\n\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nThis page outlines the bureaucratic procedure and mandatory requirements for hosting horses at ColivingLiguria facilities. Since managing equines involves specific legal and health responsibilities, the entry of animals is subject to strict verification of documentation and the signing of a dedicated contract between the horse owner and Simone Testino.\nNote: The PDF template of the contract is not yet available for public download. It will be drafted and published on this page only after the first formal request for hospitality is received.\n\n\n\nMaximum Capacity\nOur current facilities (see Horse Shelter) and land (Terreni oltre Torrente) are sized to host a maximum of 3 Horses.\nDocument Checklist\nBefore submitting a request, the owner must ensure they have digital copies (PDF or clear scans) of the following documents for each horse:\n\nEquine Passport: Pages showing the animal‚Äôs identification data, Microchip number, and silhouette diagram.\nCoggins Test (EIA): Official certificate of negative result for Equine Infectious Anaemia, valid (performed within the last 12 months or according to current local ordinances).\nVaccination Record: Proof of up-to-date vaccinations, specifically Influenza and Tetanus.\nThird-Party Liability Insurance (RCT): Copy of a valid insurance policy covering damages caused by the horse (or covering the owner for such damages).\nOwner‚Äôs ID: Valid ID card and Tax Code (Codice Fiscale) of the responsible owner.\n\nThe Admission Procedure\nAdmission of horses is not automatic. It follows this strict process:\n\n\nSubmission of Documentation:\nThe owner must send an email to colivingliguria@gmail.com with the subject line ‚ÄúHorse Hospitality Request - [Owner Name]‚Äú. The email must contain all the documents listed in the checklist above.\n\n\nVerification and Contract Dispatch:\nSimone Testino will verify the regularity of the documents. If successful, he will draft the Contract for Horses. This document will be digitally signed by Simone (in .p7m format) and sent exclusively from the official certified email address (PEC): simone.testino@legalmail.it.\n\n\nSignature and Deposit:\nThe owner must countersign the contract and send it back. At the same time, they must pay the specific Security Deposit for the horses (the amount will be specified in the contract based on the number of animals).\n\n\nEntry:\nOnly once the signed contract and deposit have been received, will the horses be allowed to enter the facility.\n\n\nOwner Residency\nPlease note that the horse owner must be present on-site to care for the animals. Therefore, they must also separately sign the Contract for Residents for their own personal accommodation.\n\nContratto per Cavalli\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta pagina delinea la procedura burocratica e i requisiti obbligatori per ospitare cavalli presso le strutture di ColivingLiguria. For any interaction with the project, it is essential for us that everything is conducted according to the rules, paying taxes, and ensuring that all arrangements are legally sound and well-documented, as outlined in our Ethical Code of ColivingLiguria.\n\n\n\nTo collaborate in any way with ColivingLiguria, we require the signing of a contract provided by us. The contract will adhere to Italian law, and on this website, we provide all the necessary documents‚Äîoften translated into English‚Äîto help you get informed. These documents clarify the legal framework governing residency, distinguishing between the different types of stays as detailed in Legal Boundaries of Volunteering. However, please be aware that these are not official translations; they are often written by non-experts or artificial intelligence and should therefore be treated with caution.\nA contract will always be in place, and its type will vary depending on the individual‚Äôs role. However, all residents must sign the ‚ÄúContratto di Locazione‚Äù (Lease Agreement). This is the primary document governing residency, and it is attached below.\n\n\n                  \n                  Lease Agreement (Contratto di Locazione) \n                  \n                \n\n\nThe ‚ÄúContratto di Locazione‚Äù is the fundamental agreement for all residents. It establishes the rights and duties of both the resident (Conduttore) and the landlord (Locatore). The full document is attached to this page. You can download it from here.\n\n\n\n\nContract Structure\nThe Lease Agreement (‚ÄúContratto di Locazione‚Äù) is the main document, but it is composed of several parts:\n\nMain Agreement: This part defines the parties (you and us), the duration of the stay, the specific room/property, and the financial terms (rent and security deposit). This is the part that is customised for your stay.\nThe Annexes (Gli Allegati): These are fixed clauses that form an integral part of the contract. They include:\n\nAnnex F (Financial Management): Details the ‚ÄúDebit/Credit Line‚Äù system for managing the deposit and any outstanding costs or penalties.\nAnnex M (Maintenance Clause): Explains the resident‚Äôs duty for ordinary maintenance and the penalties for unauthorised works.\nAnnex R (Conservation Manual) &amp; Annex C (House Rules): These define the design guidelines and community rules. As per Art. 4, these may be updated, and your acceptance is part of the agreement.\n\n\nSpecific Approval Clause: To ensure full legal validity under Italian law, the contract includes a final section for the ‚Äúdouble signature‚Äù (doppia sottoscrizione), where you specifically approve key clauses (like penalties and termination rules) a second time.\n\nHow to Sign: The Onboarding Procedure\nThis page explains what the contract is. The step-by-step process for receiving, reviewing, and signing it is a mandatory part of our Onboarding process.\nPlease refer to the Onboarding page for the complete procedure, which details:\n\nHow we conduct the video call to review the contract together.\nHow you will receive the official, digitally-signed (.p7m) Italian contract from our certified email (PEC).\nHow to pay the security deposit to finalise the booking.\nThe requirement to print the contract and bring the hand-signed paper copy upon arrival.\n\nContract Guidelines\n\nOfficial Language: The official and legally binding version of the contract is in Italian.\nEnglish Translation: An English translation is provided in good faith. It has been reviewed, but it was written with the help of AI and may not precisely reflect the nuances of the Italian version. The English text is attached to the same document and follows the Italian version, but the Italian text is the authoritative one.\nResident‚Äôs Obligations: This contract does not, in any way, obligate the resident to perform any work or tasks within ColivingLiguria. It serves to establish the resident‚Äôs rights, the costs of the stay, the terms, the security deposit conditions, and the ‚ÄúRegolamento della Casa‚Äù (House Rules). The distinction between mandatory ordinary maintenance and any other type of work is further explained in Human Resources for Renovation.\nSanctions: The regulations attached to the contract include sanctions for non-compliance with certain co-living rules (once defined in Annex C) or with the renovation‚Äôs ‚ÄúLinee Guida Progettuali‚Äù (Design Guidelines, Annex R), specifically in cases where unauthorised actions are taken that conflict with the established project. For more details on what constitutes different types of maintenance, see our notes on Ordinary Maintenance and Permit-Free Construction.\n\n\n\n\n                  \n                  Abstract\n                  \n                \n\n\nQuesta pagina delinea la necessit√† di un contratto formale per tutti i residenti di ColivingLiguria, che abbiano intenzione di collaborare al progetto o di essere semplicemente clienti paganti, che soggiornino per un giorno o per anni. Tuttavia, si prega di notare che queste non sono traduzioni ufficiali; sono spesso scritte da non esperti o da intelligenza artificiale e devono quindi essere prese con le pinze.\nUn contratto sar√† sempre presente e sar√† di diverso tipo a seconda del ruolo della persona.
